loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
K. Nguyễn Thị (20201060044), a 35-year-old female married mother of two school-aged children, lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. For over six years, K. has owned and operated a business manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members, earning approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

In 2008, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 8.288.000 VND to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. K. Nguyễn Thị (20201060044) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, K. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. K. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, K. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, K. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. K. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. K. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Sella Atieno

texts.en: Sella Atieno A. started her tailoring business in 2005 immediately after finishing her training.  Since then she has been playing a big role in their family upkeep. She is 46 years old, married and has four (4) children. She lives in Nyamasaria. Her business has started experiencing an influx of customers making more demands than she can supply. It is for this reason that she has requested for a loan of Ksh. 20,000 to enable her increase her stock to meet the demand. She buys her stock in Kisumu on a weekly basis.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Beka

texts.fr: cette dame est âgée de 38 ans, elle est très dynamique et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006. elle son commerce à son domicile situé dans le quartier d'agoè logopé. le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tous ses clients. elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 20 sacs de charbons de bois. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays plus précisément dans la localité d'anié.
texts.en:
Ms. B. is 38 years old, she is very active and sells sacks of charcoal for a living. She has been doing so since 2006. She sells her charcoal at her house located in the Agoè Logopé neighborhood. Her stock is currently insufficient to meet the demands of her customers. She wants to purchase more stock and she is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can purchase 20 sacks of charcoal. She buys her stock in the inland locality of Anié.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Gregorio Alberto, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos niñas, como él mismo las llama de 24 y 19 años de edad. hace cinco meses forma parte del grupo "La Unión" formado por 7 integrantes residentes del distrito de Comas. Sus compañeras lo eligieron Fiscal del Grupo.
Hace quince años, el Sr. Gregorio Alberto se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi, para lo cual utiliza un auto de su propiedad. Inició éste trabajo para compensar el bajo sueldo que recibía al trabajar parta una entidad estatal.
Gracias a éste trabajo que hacía en sus tiempos libres, puso adquirir su casa propia, brindar estudios a sus hijas y mantener una estabilidad económica sin problemas para él y su familia.
Una de sus metas es poder renovar su carro, cambiarlo por uno menos antiguo que le pueda rendir mejor para el servicio de taxi.
El préstamo recibido lo utilizará para pagar una deuda adquirida para la reparación y mantenimiento de su auto.
texts.en:
Gregorio Alberto is 50 years old and he is married and has two daughters, aged 24 and 19 years. Five years ago he joined the group named "The Union" and it is made up of 7 members, all residents of the Comas district. His colleagues elected him to be the treasurer of the group. For the past 15 years Gregorio Alberto has been a taxi driver, driving his own car. He started this job to supplement his other paid job. He works for the city and the pay is very low. Thanks to this business that he carried out in his spare time he was able to buy his own home, he was able to put his daughters through school and he managed to maintain stable finances for the family. One of this goals is to replace his car with one that is not as old, so that it will be in condition to serve as a taxi service. This loan will be used to pay for the repairs of his car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for repairs done to his car, used as a taxi

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Señor Juan Carlos G. E. tiene la edad de 55 años de edad, es casado tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad, 5 de ellos son independientes del Sr. G. el menor de sus hijos de 15 años de edad, es el único que depende de su padre este, se encuentra estudiando la secundaria y pronto entrara a la universidad, el señor Juan Carlos labora como conductor de camión, luego aprendió los oficios de soldadura y mecánica, fue de esta manera que inicio con su taller, por el mismo solicita un préstamo para la compra de zinc, perlines, arena y cemento para ampliar el local y brindar una mejor atención para su clientela, y de esta forma el aumento en las ventas y la mejora continua de sus condiciones económicas para el apoyo a los estudios universitarios a su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos G. E. is 55 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are independent. His youngest child is 15 years old and the only one who is still a dependent. Upon finishing high school, his son will enter immediately into the university.

Sr. Juan Carlos worked as a truck driver, but he later received training in the welding and mechanical trades. This allowed him to open his own workshop. Juan Carlos is requesting a loan to buy zinc, crossbeams, sand, and cement to expand his studio and provide better service to his customers. This will allow him to increase his sales and continue improving his economic situation so that he can support his youngest son with his university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to remodel his business

loans.name: Arn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arn M., 46 years old, lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhean San, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice to sell to support their family.

She has a problem because her field is infertile and it is far away from any irrigation system. So, to improve production, Mrs. Arn M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. With the rest of the loan she will hire farm laborers and a plow to plow her field.

She is a mother of two children. One is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is an ice cream seller. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.en:
Rukhsora K. is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She sells the national bread “lepeshka” in the local marketplace of Kurgantyube, where she lives with her family of three. She started working in the market as a salesperson. Rukhsora has been in this sphere of trade for 11 years. Currently, she is planning to start her own bakery business with the help of her adult children. That is the reason that she asked for a loan of $1,500 USD. Rukhsora has gained much experience working in the sphere of commerce as a salesperson at first. Today she is happy to be self-employed and see her small enterprise grow and become more and more stable. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta S. is from Rstand Village, Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old. Violeta is married and has two children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling cooked food in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Violeta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Violeta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella S.  is currently in the business of selling onions, tomatoes and cooking oil  and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Estella is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old. Bella is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding.  Bella also helps her husband at the farm. They have a rice field that her husband manages. Their harvest is used for selling and family consumption.

Bella joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Bella is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora María S. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, esta comunidad se encuentra en las afueras de la ciudad,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población han encontrado en la ciudad un trabajo para mejorar su economía.
 
La Señora María tiene 32 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos  de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la construcción ya que es maestro albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María es empleada privada, actividad que realiza hace 5 años, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde y en su casa se dedica a cría de animales como: cuyes, gallinas y ganado, animales que son para su consumo y para la venta.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una vecina quien es socia activa, con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar ganado. Su meta es  terminar su casa ya que se encuentra en construcción.
texts.en:
Maria S. is a member of the community bank Narancay Bajo and lives in a community that bears the same name. This community is located in the outskirts of the city and its people dedicate themselves to agriculture and animal husbandry. Much of its population has found work in the city in order to improve their economy. 

Maria is 32 years old and lives in a common law marriage. She has three children that are 12, 10 and 8 years old. All of her children study in a city school. Her husband works in construction and is a master mason. They do not have their own home so they rent. 

Maria is a private employee which she has been doing for 5 years. She works from Monday to Friday from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. and at her home she raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and cattle. These animals are for her consumption and for sale. 

This is her third loan with the community bank. She was invited by a neighbor who is an active member of the bank. She will purchase cattle with the money from her loan. Her goal is to finish her home as it is currently under construction.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Gidrap

texts.en: Gidrap is 44 years old, married, and has three children. To earn a living, he runs a cafeteria. He has been in this business for ten years. He dreams of opening other cafeterias in the future. He also rents out houses for extra income. Gidrap joined Faulu Kenya in order to get loans more easily. He became a member of Baraka group, whose members guarantee each other's loans. He has requested 80,000 KES to expand the cafeteria and open a shop.

loans.use: To expand the cafeteria and open a shop

loans.name: Felicitas Hermelinda

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 43 años, nació en la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco.

Felicitas se dedica a la venta artesanía; bisutería, joyería, platería y tejidos, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el centro artesanal de San Francisco. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Felicitas que espera recibir de $ 300 USD  y desea aumentar negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo mantas, tejidos y otras cosas más.

Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 43 years old.  She was born in the city of Cusco and she currently lives together with her husband and five children in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province.

Felicita's business is selling handicrafts: costume jewelry, jewelry, silverwork and knitted items.  She has a small sales stall in San Francisco craft center.  She has been in this business for 25 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  Felicitas hopes to receive $300USD in her next loan and would like to increase her business and buy merchandise such as, for example, blankets, knitted items, etc.

Felicitas belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank which is beginning a new stage and will be well run by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, blankets, knitted items, etc.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Lucia, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, vive con sus hijos y nietos su casa es propia y se dedica a vender varios productos como dulces, jabon, huevos, tiene 54 años de edad.
Su negocio tiene 3 años de existir y junto a su hija lo administra, este negocio es la fortaleza con la que cuenta el hogar de Doña Lucia, por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más mercadería y enriquecer el negocio, ya que los produstos que ofrece tienen buena demanda de parte de los clientes pues son cosas que siempre son necesarias en cada hogar, y aprovechara para aumentar las cantidades de mercaderia en negocio.
Su propósito es estar siempre activa y mejorar las condiciones económicas del hogar.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in Puerto El Triunfo in the department of Usulután with her children and grandchildren. Her house is her own and she is 54 years old. She works selling various items like sweets, soap, and eggs and has had the business for three years. She runs it together with her daughter and this business is the strength of Lucia’s home. Right now, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and improve the business as the products that she sells are in good demand by her customers because they are needed in every home. She will take advantage to increase the amount of merchandise at the store.

Her goal is to always be active and to improve the household’s financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (soap, detergents, sweets, and other products)

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambo K. (pictured) is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Yot Po is 46 years old. They have been married since 1983 and have three children, including two sons and one daughter. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sambo is a weaver. Her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi B. is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Zawadi faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation of charcoal. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell during the back-to-school season

loans.name: Joseph Muchiri

texts.en:
Joseph Muchiri is 45 years old, married to Martha Njeri who is a housewife, and has three children – Antony, Brian, and Antony Mwangi. He lives in Kingstone with his family. His primary business is farming and he has been in this business for five years.
Joseph's business is located in the Kingstone area where he sells milk to Daima Company located in the same area. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by the credit officer in charge of Eastlands office. Joseph’s business gives him a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. This loan of 50,000 KES is his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it to buy food for his cattle and pigs. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to add another dairy cow. Joseph’s hope and dream is to become one of the best farmers in the country. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to buy food for cattle and pigs

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza tiene 43  años D. edad, es casada y tiene 2  hijos dependientes a su cargo. Actualmente vive en casa propia en L. zona rural del distrito D. Morrope.  Cuenta con servicios D. agua solamente. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado D. 50  familias. Se gana L. vida desD. hace 12 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio. Suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona en donD. vive. Aprendió esta actividad D. sus padres, es decir conoce a L. perfección el rubro. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Lorenza desea invertir en L. compra D. aves menores para engorD. y alimento balanceado para sus aves y cerdos. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 43 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children in her care.  She currently lives in her own home in the rural part of Morrope district where she only has access to water services.  The community where she lives is small and consists of approximately 50 families.

For 12 years, Lorenza has been earning a living raising and selling animals in pens located behind her home.  She usually raises pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who always visit the area where she lives.  Lorenza learned this business from her parents which means that she knows the work perfectly.  Her business has competition but she also has a large market to sell to.  Lorenza would like to invest this loan in buying young birds to fatten and balanced feed for her birds and pigs.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Veronica Cecilia

texts.es: Verónica Cecilia P. es una mujer muy conocida en el barrio san José de la ciudad de Barranquilla, pues allí tiene un gimnasio donde ofrece para la venta productos energéticos que regulan el organismo después de las actividades lúdico-deportivas, que allí se practican y que sirven para para rehidratar y recuperar carbohidratos  y electrolitos. Verónica comenzó haciendo ejercicios en la sala de su casa con familiares,  a los que se fueron agregando vecinos y gradualmente amigos de los asistentes y referidos,  los que hoy conforman su más consentida clientela, por eso Verónica en términos de que sus clientes estuvieran mejor atendidos, ha ido gradualmente agregando productos a una pequeña vitrina que compró y que debe permanecer surtida, pues sus clientes consumen estos productos en grandes cantidades y como la clientela  ha aumentado   terminan rápidamente con la oferta que ella hace de agua, gatorade, café, jugos naturales de naranja etc. Este es su primer financiamiento al que está aplicando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará Agua, gatorade, naranjas y productos energéticos en general, de contado y en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Verónica Cecilia P. is a very well-known woman in the San José neighborhood in Barranquilla.  That is where she has a gymnasium where she sells energy products.  These products regulate the body after recreational sporting activities at the gym.  These products rehydrate and replenish carbohydrates and electrolytes.

Verónica started doing exercises with family members in the living room of her house.  Neighbors started joining them, and gradually friends of the assistants and people who were referred did as well.  Now they are her most favorite customers.  That is why Verónica has gradually been adding products in a small display case that she purchased so that her customers can be better served.

She needs to always be well-stocked because her customers consume these products in great quantities.  As her number of customers has increased, she quickly runs out of water, Gatorade, coffee, and orange juice, etc.

This is the first loan that she has applied for with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy water, Gatorade, oranges, and energizing products on installments and in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy energizing products and soft drinks

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo M. M., tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado, vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El con el crédito pretende pagar la mano de obra de la siembra sembrada y su posterior asistencia. El quiere llegar a tener una buena cosecha para este año y tener el cultivo en buenas condiciones para generar ganancias las proximas cosechas que vienen. El cuenta con el terreno y la topografía apta para la explotación del cultivo. También tiene muchos años de trabajar en estos cultivos por lo cual cuenta con mucha experiencia. El pretende generar las ganancias para tener un mejor calidad de vida y llegar a cumplir metas que tiene a futuro.al igual quiere seguir brindandole a sus hijos el estudio para que sean profesionales enel futuro.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo M. M. is 45 years old. He is married and he lives with his 4 children and his wife. They are his greatest priority. With his loan he plans on paying the labor expenses for the plantation and for later assistance. He wants to have a good harvest this year and to have a plantation that is in good condition to generate good profits for the next harvest. His has his own land and the topography is perfect for cultivation. He has been working in these fields for many years and he has earned much experience. He aims to increase his revenues to have a better way of life and to read his goals for the future. He also wants to keep his children in school to give them a career in the future.

This is his first loan with Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had previous loans with national banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan, greater benefits, and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to invest in his bean plantation.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is a 36-year-old farmer from the village of Kotelia, Akhalkalaki District. Nargiz is married and lives with her husband and three children: a 16-year-old son and 13- and 7-year-old daughters. Both of her daughters have health problems and receive pensions for persons with disabilities from the government. 

Nargiz and his husband Zurab have four milk cows. They sell milk to the milk collection center in the same village. Also they have 4.5 ha of land. 0.6 ha is used for growing potatoes and 1.0 ha is used for growing wheat. Part of the harvested vegetables is sold locally and the bigger part is sold in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. 

Approximately 50% of the requested loan will be used to purchase fertilizers. With the remaining 50%, she will purchase diesel for the tractor to till the land. 

According to Nargiz and Zurab’s estimations, after fertilization they will have a better crop, which will be sold for a good price. The received income will be used for treatment for their daughters.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and diesel fuel

loans.name: Vilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Vilma, vive con su esposo y una hija, tiene casa propia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, aprendió a elaborar las tortillas por su madre,  y las vende desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene un horario de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y gas, estos materiales son para la producción de tortillas, lo que ella pretende es que a través del préstamo pueda adquirir estos materiales a un mejor precio específicamente el maíz, que lo puede comprar por mayor cantidad para almacenarlo.
Sus aspiraciones es tener un negocio fuerte, con más capacidad para atender a los clientes, mejorar también las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her husband and daughter in their own home. She has earned her living selling tortillas for the past ten years; her mother taught her how to make them. The business is located in the local market, and she works there from 6am to 5pm.

Vilma is seeking a loan to buy corn, firewood, and fuel--all of which she needs to make the tortillas. She hopes to buy these items, especially the corn, at a lower price as she can buy in bulk and store them. Her hopes for the future are to have a strong business, the capacity to serve more customers, and to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and fuel

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 53 años de edad, conviviente y con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la casa está ubicada en un caserío llamado Colera en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura al norte del Perú, Miguel vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Miguel se dedica  a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y vacunos, además cuenta con 1.50 hectáreas de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia, la cual está sembrando limón en producción, que cosecha semanalmente, su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral ambos se apoyan, existe una buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
 
Miguel está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos, y vacunos además para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y realizar labores de deshierbo para logra una mejor producción y así logra un mejor precio de sus animales y limón, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Miguel es una persona bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Miguel tiene 53 años de edad, conviviente y con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la casa está ubicada en un caserío llamado Colera en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura al norte del Perú, Miguel vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Miguel se dedica  a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y vacunos, además cuenta con 1.50 hectáreas de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia, la cual está sembrando limón en producción, que cosecha semanalmente, su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral ambos se apoyan, existe una buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
 
Miguel está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos, y vacunos además para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y realizar labores de deshierbo para logra una mejor producción y así logra un mejor precio de sus animales y limón, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Miguel es una persona bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.

loans.use: Compra de alimento para sus animales y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo.

loans.name: Muniya

texts.en: Muniya is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, who is four years old.  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of her store.  In the future, Muniya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no larger than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 43 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a motorbike driver for hire. 

Hanh supports her family by earning income selling food to people in her community. She started her food stall 5 years ago and she sells many kinds of dishes, especially dishes for lunch. She intends to take a loan to buy new furniture and a greater quantity of food to sell. 

Hanh hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and more food to sell.

loans.name: Ketty Jessenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  7, 6 y 5 años de edad los mismos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en una fábrica de atún en la ciudad de Manta pero además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo las mismas que hace en sus ratos libres y fines de semana, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de su mercadería la vende por pedidos que le realizan los clientes con anticipación, ella deja a crédito sus productos y cobra en tres pagos. Dicha mercadería la compara cada vez que necesita en Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que este negocio lo empezó cuando estaba desocupada y que lo financio con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos emprendió su negocio.
  
Su sueño es algún día tener una boutique en Manta.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside of the country. 

This is where we meet Ketty, who is 27 years old, married, and has three children who are 7, 6, and 5 years old. They are all studying in school. Her husband is a mason.

Our friend works in a tuna processing plant in the city of Manta, but in addition to this she also sells clothing of all kinds, which she does during her free time and on the weekends. She tells us that she sells the majority of her merchandise through orders that customers make ahead of time. She sells her products on credit and charges in three installments. She buys her merchandise each time she needs to in Portoviejo. She tells us that she started this business when she was out of work and that she financed it with the first loan she received from the group.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes. She has been in the community bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because the loans got her business going. Her dream is to one day have a boutique in Manta.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer separada, madre D. 5 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 viven con ella. Ellos son mayores D. edad y D. alguna manera aportan a la canasta familiar. Teresa vive en el distrito D. Calleria, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa y tiene la suerte D. contar con casa propia.Teresa se dedica desD. hace varios años a la venta D. bebidas heladas y postres en su casa, tiene la ayuda D. sus hijos que realizan la venta cuando ella sale a ofrecer otros productos que también venD..Lo que mas le gusta D. su trabajo es que tiene trato directo con los clientes y es una fuente D. ingresos para su economía. Lo que no le gusta es que tiene que estar expuesta al calor cuando hace la cocción del maíz morado y la gelatina y eso le  hace sufrir D. algunos males que le aquejan, ella se siente bien en esta actividad ya que hay clientes a diario. Ella espera poder comprar una refrigeradora ya que la que tiene con la que trabaja es D. su hijo quien ya se mudo D. ahí hace unos meses y por el momento Teresa lo tiene en calidad D. préstamo.Este es el quinto préstamo entre Teresa y MFP, se siente bien en el grupo que esta ya que cuando hubo los problemas lo superaron como grupo que son. Ella con los 800 soles que solicito comprará ingredientes e insumos para poder seguir con su actividad.
texts.en: Teresa is separated and a mother of 5 children, 2 of whom live with her. They are adult and in one way or another contribute to the family expenses. Teresa lives in the district of Calleria, in the city of Pucallpa. She is lucky enough to have her own house. Teresa has sold cold drinks and desserts from her house for several years. She has the help of her children who do the selling while she goes out to offer other products that she sells as well. What she likes the most about her job is that she has direct contact with the customers and it is a source of income for her budget. What she doesn't like is being exposed to the heat when she cooks the blue corn and gelatin and that has led her to suffer from some health problems that bother her. She likes this activity since she has customers every day. She hopes to be able to buy a refrigerator since the one she works with is her son's who moved away some months ago and now Teresa is borrowing it. This is the fifth loan that Teresa has had with MFP and she feels good in the group since when there have been problems they overcame them like the group they are. With the 800 soles she has asked for, she will buy ingredients and materials to be able to continue with this activity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials to be able to continue doing her activity.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Ислом более 20 лет занимается услугами ремонт автомобилей. Ему в бизнесе помогал сын, но он уехал в Россию на заработки как строитель. Первую заработки сына Ислом израсходовал на свадьбу дочери. Когда его дети были по 2 и 3 годика, его супруга бросила семью, и с тех пор Ислом и его мать вырастили и воспитали детей сами. Ислом метает устроить сына в какую нибудь учебную заведению, что как и другие дети он тоже получил соответствующие образование. Ислом запрашивает займ для покупки оборудование для более качественно ремонтировать автомашины. Ислом надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его и заранее хочет благодарить вас всех за поддержку.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Islom has more than twenty years of experience in auto repair. His son helped him with the business, but his son went to Russia to work as a builder. The first time his son sent money home, the money was spent on Islom's daughter's wedding. When his children were two and three years old, his wife abandoned the family, and since then Islom and his mother have brought up the children by themselves. Islom dreams of sending his son to college so that, like other children, he could receive an appropriate education. Islom is asking for a loan to buy equipment so that he may better repair cars. Islom hopes that lenders will support him and wants to thank you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment so that he may better repair cars

loans.name: Kulbara

texts.en:
Kulbara is a resident of Tup, a small nice village in the eastern part of Kyrgyzstan. She is 43 and married to a farmer, and together with him she is bringing up a daughter and two sons. Their daughter is married and lives separately with her family; their older son studies at school and the younger son is preschool age (under seven). 

Kulbara works as a teacher of mathematics at a school; she earns additional money for the family budget by selling milk products. Five years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms the family started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan Kulbara wants to purchase two bull-calves for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she wants to provide her sons with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two bull-calves.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 33 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children.
 
Perlita owns and operates a retail store at home selling mostly grocery items like shampoo, noodles, soap, toothpaste, rice and many more. She has run the store for over 4 years and has enjoyed the nature of this activity. Her husband as well works as a vehicle driver. She earns approximately PHP 6,200 a month from the store along with other sources. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

Perlita has been a member of GDMPC since 2007.  In the future, Perlita hopes to expand and improve store operations to sustain the day to day needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 30 years old, a married woman with five children, two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling onions and tomatoes in Dar Essalam branch in Yei, south Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the profits from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to able her purchase more onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a videoke rentals business in the Philippines.

Dyna requested a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more materials for her videoke rentals. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

In the future, Dyna would like to save enough so she could afford to send her child to school and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her videoke business.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is 19 years old, single and has no children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by running a stall where he sells toys, balloons and other items. He is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to his customers. Jeffrey joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy toys, robots and balloons to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah has been in the business of farming supplies and products in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 43 years old, married to Margaret, and they have five school-aged children.  

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his seventh loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to support his horticultural contract business.

In the future, Nehemiah hopes to expand his business and directly export the farm products to other markets both within Kenya and abroad.

loans.use: to support his horticultural contract business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking business-woman aged 36.  She is married and blessed with two children who attend school.  She has been selling cereals to support her family.  She also does farming to earn extra income.  Her business environment is busy and competitive.  In the next five years she wants to expand her business.  She has requested for a loan of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy seats for her house.

loans.use: to buy seats for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers) for her business.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en: Sakina (left) is a housewife as well as a working lady who sells clothes to her community clients. She purchases these clothes from wholesale market and sells them at a profit. She is 46 years old and has a 10-year-old son who is studying in class 4th. Her husband is a daily wage laborer who works for a low income. Her brother also lives with her and sells vegetables. The quality of the vegetables he sells is very good that’s why he makes good sales everyday. Sakina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her brother’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling on profits. He is very hard worker and Sakina is confident about his business success after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy fresh seaonal vegetables for her brother's vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Gregoria tiene 5 hijos de los cuales sigue a cargo de  4 hijos debido a que uno ya es casado y vive en otra ciudad, la señora  vive en casa alquilada ya que no tiene ingresos suficientes como para comprar un lote, ella vive en el mismo lugar 7 años ya que sus dueños de casa se fueron al extranjero y dejaron a cargo a la señora y a sus hijos, para que cuidara la casa a cambio de un alquiler módico.                                                                                                     La señora Gregoria se dedica al comercio de anticuchos (los anticuchos son un acomida artesanal parecidas a las brochetas pero de carme de corazón y también con salchichas todo esto se acompaña con aderezó de salsa de maní con ají amarillo) hace más de 5 años, ella vende los días miércoles a lunes, tomándose así un día de descanso para estar con sus hijos. El préstamo es para incrementar capital, es decir compra de insumos  como carne, salchichas, maní, aceite, etc. para el preparado de los riquísimos anticuchos.
texts.en:
Gregoria has five children, four of whom she still cares for, since one is already married and lives in another city.  She lives in a rented house because she does not have sufficient income to buy a plot of land.  She has lived in the same place for seven years since the owners went abroad and left her and her children in charge, so they would take care of the house in exchange for a moderate rent.

Gregoria has worked in the "anticucho" business for more than five years.  (Anticuchos are a traditional dish similar to brochettes but made of heart meat and also with sausage, all accompanied by a peanut sauce dressing with hot yellow chile peppers.)  She sells Wednesday through Monday, taking one day of rest to be with her children.

The loan is to increase capital, that is, to buy supplies such as meat, sausage, peanuts, oil, etc., to prepare the delicious anticuchos.

loans.use: to buy supplies for an "anticucho" [brochette] business.

loans.name: Thuku

texts.en:
Thuku is 66 years old and married to Irene. They are blessed with two children, aged 28 and 24.  He has been in the farming business for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to support his family.

Thuku is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Thuku will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Micaela Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Micaela Jesus es casada, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos 4 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al tricotado de hilos, ella inicio como operaria lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases para mejora su producción de tricotado, espera tener mejor capital.
texts.en:
Micaela Jesus, 38, is married and has 5 children with 4 in school.  She has a knitting business that she began 3 years ago with the financial support of her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy different types of thread to increase her knitting production.  She wants to have better working capital.

loans.use: to buy thread and dye for thread

loans.name: Nevys Johanna

texts.es:
Nevys aunque es una joven de 19 años de edad ya tiene su propio negocio, pues desde los 14 decidió ser comerciante y en esta época tuvo sus primeras experiencias, la cual la llevaron a que emprendiera su aventura de negocio llamada tienda. Hoy vende en su punto comercial ranchos, víveres, útiles de aseo personal y en general todos los artículos de la canasta familiar al detalle a amas de casa que se reúnen, conversan y compran en la tienda de Nevys.
Nevys es una joven emprendedora que con su iniciativa generadora de ingreso, ha logrado salir adelante, pese a su condición de huérfana de padre y así mismo apoya a su familia y logra sostener su negocio. Ella planea verlo crecer permanentemente y por eso trabaja cada día con el mayor empeño. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará en mayor cantidad, víveres, refrescos, útiles de aseo y papelería, que es lo que usualmente solicitan sus clientes en esta primera temporada escolar del año.  Su meta es tener una casa para adecuar su negocio con toda la tecnología y modernidad de su juventud. Mientras esto  ocurre se esmera trabajando y con ello obtiene una rentabilidad promedia sobre las ventas, no menor del 28%, sus inventarios rotan cada 14 días y sus cuentas por cobrar cada 5 días, porque la mayor cantidad de artículos los vende de contado y maneja unos pocos créditos con clientes rentables, con los cuales sostiene buenas relaciones.
texts.en:
Nevys, while still a young woman of 19, already has her own business.  When she was 14, she decided to become a retailer, and had two initial experiences which led her to undertake her business venture of a store.  Today her store sells food, personal grooming products, and in general all the specific items a family needs.  She sells to housewives who meet together, chat and make their purchases at Nevys' store.

Nevys is an entrepreneurial young woman who generates income through her initiative.  She has managed to move ahead in life in spite of being orphaned, and so has supported her family and managed to keep her business going.  She plans to see it grow permanently, and for this reason she works on a daily basis with maximum determination.  

This is the reason why she has come for a Kiva loan; her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan, she will purchase a greater quantity of food, beverages, personal grooming products, and paper goods, which are what her customers normally look for at this first school season of  the year.

Her goal is to have a house where she can use all the technology and modernity of her youth in her business.  In the meantime, she strives to work, and with her work she earns an average profit on her sales of not less than 28%, her inventory turns over every two weeks. and her accounts receivables is at 5 days.  This is because she sells the great majority of items for cash, and provides credit to only a few, profitable customers with whom she has good relations.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of food, beverages, personal grooming products and paper goods.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe   LOLO   sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans,   3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames au quartier BABEMBA un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
AFOU fait le commerce de pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est en deuxième position à partir de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  3 douzaines de pagnes wax  et revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne..

loans.use: Achat de pagnes

loans.name: Fama's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été crée le 14 mai 2010, et regroupe des femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce, habitent le même quartier. Fatou l'emprunteuse en vedette est mariée, âgée de 47 ans est mère de 02 enfants. Elle fait le commerce d'habits d'hommes, de parfums, de bijoux, de l'encens et des ensembles d'enfants. Elle mène cette activité depuis 05 ans, avec son crédit elle va acheter des tissus pour confectionner des habits d'hommes. Elle n'est la seule qui pratique cette activité mais ça marche bien pour elle. Les bénéfices l'aide à se prendre en charge et le permet d'épargner dans le banc villageois.
texts.en: This group was created on the 14th of May, 2010, and is made up of women who are active in commerce and live in the same area. Fatou, the featured borrower, is married, 47 years old and the mother of 2 children. She sells men's clothing, perfumes, jewellery, incense and children's outfits. She has been in business for 5 years and will use her loan to buy fabric with which to make men's clothing. She is not the only one who makes men's clothes, but her business is going well. The profits allow her to be self-sufficient and to build savings in the "banc villageois."

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 14 years, they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been farming for the past 8 years. With the loan from kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and buy cows for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita works hard to support her family. Bernadita is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Bernadita is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Bernadita is aware that by using the solar lamp,she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Maria Dilma Varela

texts.en: I have a shop in the San Juan market in Siguatepeque.  I have been working for a couple years, and I enjoy running my shop very much.  I want to increase my inventory to better serve my clients.

loans.use: Buy inventory to increase sales and happiness.

loans.name: Blanca Hilda

texts.en:
Blanca Hilda Garcia L. is married with four adult children who are 39, 36, 35, and 32 years old. Blanca sells shoes and beauty products because her financial needs forced her to seek additional income. Her oldest daughter participates in the business and has been helping her mother for over 10 years to grow the business.

Blanca needs a loan for $USD375 to purchase a supply of American tennis shoes. She wants to grow her small business and therefore needs your help. Without it, she cannot make her business or her dream a reality. She only needs your generosity. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Blanca Hilda G. L. es casada, tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, los cuales tienen 39, 36, 35, 32 años. La señora Blanca vende calzado y productos de belleza, puesto que las necesidades económicas la orillaron a buscar una entrada de dinero En esté negocio participa su hija menor, ella ayuda a su madre hace 10 años y gracias a su colaboración el negocio ha ido avanzando.

La señora Blanca necesita un préstamo que consta de 375 DLLs, los cuales utilizará para la compra de un lote de tenis americanos, ya que ella quiere crecer como microempresaria y para esto necesita de tu ayuda, sin ella no logrará que su negocio y sueño se realicen. Sólo basta con que tu generosidad te conduzca a ayudar. Gracias.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is married and the mother of four children. She has been doing this business for five years. Her food supply consists mainly of bottles of tinned food, drinks, and milk products, which has a high demand in the area where she lives. This makes sales turn quickly, makes turnover of stock go fast, and makes her capable of repaying her debt before the same sort of delay which would make her stuck.

Mrs. K. is part of a HELP Africa solidarity group of four women. The solidarity group is called, “Shalom,” which has collectively applied for a loan of $800. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

loans.use: Increase business activities

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo R. is married with 5 children, who all attend school. She has been in business for 8 years. She started her business by selling fruit she grew in her own garden at the ‘Pachshanbe’ market. She is a recent client of MicroInvest. She was able to greatly increase her sales after receiving her loan. At the moment it is the fruit season and Marhabo R. is asking for $500 to expand her sales so as to maximize her profits.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Разокова Мархабо замужем, имеет 5 детей. Бизнесом занимается 8 лет. Ее дети учатся в школе. Начинала свой бизнес с продажи фруктов. Собирала фрукты со своего сада и продавала их на рынке «Пачшанбе». В Микроинвесте она недавно. После получения кредита, она намного увеличила свой товарооборот. Так, как сейчас сезон фруктов, Разокова Мархабо запрашивает 400$ для увеличения товарооборота и получения максимальной прибыли.

loans.use: To increase sales during the current fruit season

loans.name: Mayra Vanessa

texts.es:
Senora Namendi is originally from Masaya, a city very well known for its "Cosas de Horno", a typical Nicaraguen pastry. She is married with 4 children who go to school, and often help her in the preparation of her pastries. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest more in her business, primarily in the maintenance and repair of the oven in which she makes her products. The oven is more than 20 years old and very deteriorated. With the loan, Senora Namendi would like to increase her sales, lower her costs, and improve the living conditions of her family.

La Sra.

loans.use: Investment in pastry business

loans.name: Lina Alberto

texts.pt:
Lina lives with her husband and 6 school age children. She joined the credit program in 2000. Her first loan was of 24$. Her business of selling corn has been growing. With this loan she plans on buying more corn and paying for delivery. She helps her husband with home expenses. Lina hopes to improve her home with income from the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Lina vive maritalmente com um homem de quem tem 6 filhos. Todos estao em idade escolar.Lina entrou para o programa de credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2000, como membro de um grupo solidaria que na altura se juntou para tomar tomar dinheiro emprestado. O primeiro valor que ela recebeu nessa altura foi de $24.O negocio dela foi crescendo, ela agora vende milho em sacos. O dinheiro que ela vai tomar e para poder comprar mais sacos de milho e pagar pelo transporte dos mesmos pois que o local onde adquir o milho e numa outra Provincia.O negocio esta a corre-lhe bem. Ela apoia o marido nas despesas da casa e comparticipa no pagamento da escola para os filhos ,pois que todos eles estao em idade escolar.Ela pensa ampliar a sua residencia com os lucros do negocio.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Cafarov Rustem is 33 years old and the father of two children.  He was born in Sumqayit City which is located in eastern  Azerbaijan. He lives in Sumgayit City, with his family, including his father and mother.. His parents are old and ill. Cafarov is the only breadwinner in his family. Fifteen years ago, he began his home repair business. He is a good craftsman who does repairs and offers trades on home items. He is requesting a loan of $500 in order to buy tools and equipment which will improve the service he provides to his customers. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment to improve his home repair and trade services

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Mrs. Maricela lives in the area of San Martin, province and district of Lamas. She is a member of the Community Bank Las Lameñas. She currently manages a food business from her own house, located at Jr. San Martín Nº 600. She adapted the place where her customers come to eat everyday. She is a single mother and has two daughters that help her with the business. With the experience acquired selling cold and grilled items and after many customer requests, she decided to venture into preparing a whole menu of meals. For the last six months she has been able to attract many clients, thanks to the good service as well as the delicious meals. With a loan for S/ 1,000.00, to be paid in 6 months, she will buy a microwave for warming up snacks and food. She will also renovate her cooking utensils such us pots, dishes, glasses, silverware. This will offer a better presentation and service to her customers. Maricela is a young and enthusiastic 35 year old. She wishes to provide a better future for her daughters and is why she would like to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maricela vive en la región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas. Es socia del Banco Comunal Las Lameñas y actualmente vende comida en su propia casa, la cual está ubicada en el Jr. San Martín Nº 600, lugar donde acondicionó un ambiente al que diariamente acuden su comensales. Es madre soltera, tiene dos niñas quienes la ayudan en el negocio. Con la experiencia que tiene en la venta de refrigerios y parrillas y ante el pedido de sus clientes decidió también trabajar en la preparación de comidas tipo menú y desde hace 6 meses ha ido logrando fidelizar muchos clientes, tanto por su buen trato como por su rica sazón. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, pagará en 6 meses, comprará un horno microondas para calentar los refrigerios y platos de comida, así mismo renovará sus utensilios de cocina como ollas, vajillas, platos, vasos, cubiertos, los cuales les permitirá una mejor presentación y atención a sus clientes. Mariela es joven y entusiasta y tiene 35 años. Desea darle a sus hijas un futuro mejor por lo que anhela ampliar su negocio con la venta de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of assets (microwave, plates, kitchen utensils)

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita R. R. has a business selling fish in the jungle city of Bellavista, San Martin.  She has managed the business with her husband for over 12 years.  Her husband is a master fisherman and he catches the fish every morning while Juanita then sells the fish from her home and in the town's main market.  She has many loyal customers because her fish are always the freshest at the market.  Juanita has a lifetime of experience selling fish; her father had a similar business so she rarely runs into a problem she hasn’t seen before.

Juanita is 42 years old and has 5 children.  Neither Juanita nor her husband had the opportunity to study and become professionals.  Sending their children to University is of the highest importance to them.  Juanita loves her business because she can wake up early, work hard until the early afternoon and then have the rest of the day to spend with her children.

Juanita is a member of the community bank Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over six months.  With the loan she would like to buy new fishing nets, inner tubes, and some fish from the coast of Peru.  The investment will make her business more competitive.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets, inner tubes and some fish from the coast

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vo Thi O., 35 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Hung Nguyen, Nghe An. Her husband is a farmer. Her family main activity is to work on the rice field. Because her 2 children are still going to school, she has to spend money on schooling. Mrs. O. breeds pigs and chickens to earn some extra money. Because plowing on the rice field requires a lot of strength, she talks to her husband and decided to borrow 950 USD to buy the plowing-tractor. She also will plow for those who are in need. Doing this will increase her family income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Võ Thị O., 35 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chồng chị là một nông dân. Công việc chính của gia đình là làm ruộng. Hai con còn đang trong tuổi đi học nên chi phí khá tốn kém. Chị O. cũng chăn nuôi lợn, gà để kiếm thêm đồng ra, đồng vào. Việc cày cấy vất vả, chị O. bàn với chồng và xin vay 950USD mua máy cày về giảm bớt gánh nặng trong công việc đồng áng. Ngoài ra chị cũng nhận cày thuê những gia đình có nhu cầu. Việc này sẽ tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Buy a tractor-pulled plough

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar lives on the Avenue of Buenos Aires in the district of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz with her husband and son. She sells clothing, saucepans, baby clothes, and other products that she sells to customers on credit. They pay her in two installments and in some cases, on a daily basis.

The loan she requests is to increase the amount of capital she has since she wants to sell rice, noodles, and sugar as well. Her customers pay her in two or three installments when they buy her products.

Her credit history approves her for a new loan. She is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Pilar vive en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijo; la actividad que tiene es la venta de ropa, ollas, mantillas, productos que ella vende a pedido acomodando a crédito para que le paguen en dos cuotas y en algunos casos diariamente.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que ella quiere vender tambien arroz, fideo, azúcar, a sus clientes bajo la modalidad de cobros en dos cuotas o tres cuotas, para que sus clientes puedan comprar sus productos.

Su antecedente histórico la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, ya que es buena cliente.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, etc to sell to her customers on credit

loans.name: Nyafuru's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Nyafuru is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, 10, 4 and, 2 years old. Nyafuru has been a clothes seller from 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Liberia and Mariam, who have businesses dealing in soap sales and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian N. is a 24-year-old woman. She is single and independent. She sells soft drinks and bottled ice kenkey to the community’s manual workers in the afternoons. Bottled ice kenkey is prepared by boiling milled maize grains and then mixing it with sugar and milk and refrigerating it. It is enjoyed with bread or meat pie, and many Ghanaian manual workers enjoy it as lunch. Vivian wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, sugar, and soft drinks to increase her sales and make more income. She is a member of the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, sugar, and soft drinks

loans.name: Lucianitas Group

texts.es:
The Lucianitas group come come from the Paquip village, which is situated in the municipality of Santa Clara. The only way to reach this location is by travelling to the Palestina canton by a microbus, before walking for 45 minutes. However, when I went there for the interview, I had to walk another 45 minutes in the rain, as the bus driver didn't reach Palestina, and so I had to walk to the center of Santa Clara. This was an incredible experience, as I was walking through the green mountains surrounded by a deep calm.

All of the Lucianitas manufacture belts from beads. These belts are used by indigenous women to decorate their materials or long skirts. The Lucianitas sell the belts to traders who come to Paquip to collect the goods. Together with their respective families, this group of women work very hard to earn their daily bread. Each belt sells at US$6 and it takes one person a whole day to produce one belt.

These women usually work alone and are helped by their daughters after they arrive home from school and do their homework. In Paquip, all girls start producing these belts from the age of 9.

The Lucianitas have been working together for 6 years. During this time, the clients have achieved a unique harmony. This harmony is due to the courtesy of the women. Furthermore, all of these years they have felt very comfortable with the credit agent Gloria Cholotio and also with The Friendship Bridge. They say that they like the Friendship Bridge because an alternative local loan would be very expensive, with monthly fees of up to 10%.

The dream of the Lucianitas is to see their childR. complete school and maybe even university. They all support their childrens' education. They see that their childR. have the opportunity to get an education that they never had. It's because of this that they blindly support the development of their families and we really ought to do the same.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Las Lucianitas provienen D. la aldea Paquip ubicada en el municipio D. Santa Clara. La única manera D. llegar a este lugar es llegar al cantón D. Palestina en un microbús y luego caminar por 15 minutos. Sin embargo cuando yo fui a la entrevista tuve que caminar 45 minutos bajo la lluvia, ya que el conductor D. los microbuses no llegaron a Palestina y tuve que caminar hasta el centro D. Santa Clara. Esta fue una experiencia realmente increíble ya que estaba caminando al medio D. las montañas verdes rodeado por una paz única.

Todas las Lucianitas elaboran cinturones a base D. mostacilla. Estos cinturones son utilizados por las mujeres indígenas para adornar sus cortes o faldas largas. Ellas venden sus cinturones a los intermediarios que vienen a Paquip a recoger la mercadería. Junto con sus respectivas familias este grupo D. mujeres trabajan muy duro para ganarse el pan D. cada día. Para elaborar un cinturón una persona se demora un día entero y venden cada uno a US$6. Lamentablemente, el intermediario se lleva gran parte D. la ganancia.

Usualmente estas mujeres trabajan solas y cuando sus hijas llegan del colegio las ayudan a elaborar las cintas después D. hacer sus tareas. En Paquip todas las niñas empiezan a elaborar estos cinturones desD. que tienen 9 años D. edad.

Las Lucianitas han venido trabajando juntos por 6 años. Durante este tiempo las clientas han logrado una armonía única. Esta armonía se debe a que todas las señoras son cumplidas. Además, todos estos años ellas se han sentido muy cómodas con la agente D. crédito Gloria Cholotio y con la institución. Ellas dicen que les gusta Friendship Bridge porque un prestamista local les cobra muy caro, esto pueD. llegar hasta un 10% al mes.

El sueño D. las Lucianitas es D. ver a sus hijos graduarse del colegio y porque no la universidad. Todas ellas apoyan la educación D. sus hijos. Ellas sienten que sus hijos tienen la oportunidad D. educarse que ellas no tuvieron o no le ofrecieron. Es por eso que ellas ciegamente apoyan el desarrollo D. sus familias y ¡nosotros deberíamos D. hacer lo mismo!

loans.use: To buy beads and thread to produce belts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of use clothing to retail in her community.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is married to N. A. and lives in a small city called Chichawatni, in Pakistan. She is the mother of five sons and two daughters.
