Her eldest son operates a tractor; the other runs his own food business and a small hotel. Razia is a housewife and prefers to care for the household. She has successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. She is now applying for her second loan to purchase more materials such as oil, rice, and lentils to support her son’s food business.

Razia also has additional members in her loan group. They would like to purchase various items, such as wood, fruits, and a sewing machine to power their own businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, and be used to support each respective business. All of the group members support one another- if one of them fails to repay, the others are responsible and will contribute to the group total.

loans.use: To purchase food and cooking materials

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née le 28 décembre1963, dame H. K. Justine est originaire de EKPE dans le département de l'Ouémé et mère de 03 enfants que sont Jacques âgé de 16 ans; Paul âgé de 13 ans et de Lucrèce âgée de 06 ans respectivement en classe de Seconde au cours secondaire ; cinquième au cours secondaire et CP au cours primaire. Elle vend au détail du lait, des biscuits, des bombons et des fournitures scolaires. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans laquelle elle expose tous ses articles. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en fournitures scolaires à la veille de la rentrée des classes.
texts.en:
Mrs Justin H. K. was born on December 28, 1963, and came originally from Ekpe in the region of Oueme. She is the mother of three (3) children; Jacques age 16 who is in fifth grade in Secondary school, Paul, age 13 in second grade in Secondary school and Lucrece, age 6 in Primary school. She sells items including milk, biscuits candies and school supplies. She maintains a stall where she exhibits all of these articles. She has come to request this loan to satisfy her customers needs for school supplies as the return to school approaches soon.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Lila Mati

texts.en:
Mrs. Lila Mati T. is a farmer in Balkhu, Kathamndu. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her land, due to the lack of technology. She sells her vegetables in the local market. Now Mrs. T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming work.

Mrs. T. has three members including herself in her family. Her husband Mr. Bhakta Bahadur T. works in his own grocery store. Her daughter is a tailor and opens her tailoring work in their one house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming work.

loans.name: Aiša

texts.en:
Aiša was born in 1958 and she lives in Zbije, a village outside Visoko in Bosnia. She is married to a construction worker and has two adult sons who live with her and help her in the fields. Her family`s income comes largely from selling vegetables in the local market. The vegetables include tomatoes, potatoes, onions and carrots. Aiša also raises chickens and sells chicken meat to support her family.

Aiša requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women International to build a greenhouse. The greenhouse will allow her to grow vegetables in the late autumn and early spring, providing her family with a larger and more stable flow of income.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard Uwunwmose makes furniture like chairs, cupboards and shelves. He has lots of customers who buy his furniture. He hopes to meet the desires of his customers during and after the festive season. 

He is 46 years old and married with six children. His wife sells yams. He is requesting a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more furniture materials to make more furniture to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and all the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Central B2- Sarifa Ahmed Group

texts.en: Sarifa A. is 27 years old, married with 4 children.  She has a boutique in kabalagala where she sells both new and 2nd hand clothes for ladies. She purchases her stock from owino market and the numerous shopping arcades in town.  From clothes worth Ush 600,000 she earns a profit of Ush 150,000. Sarifa is using the loan to purchase more skirts, blouses, dresses, and suits to meet the rising demands due to her increased customer base. Her prices are fair ands she is so friendly and welcoming to her customers. Her greatest ambition is to purchase her stock directly from Dubai or United Kingdom. She desires to see her children graduate from institutions of higher learning someday.

loans.use: Purchase more skirts, blouses, dresses, and suits.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung R., a 47-year-old resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, currently makes a living selling from her home a variety of groceries including cooked ingredients, canned food, plastic goods, and sweets for childR.. She also provides the national lottery service for a commission.

Soung is married and has two childR., both married and employed, one as a pig raiser and the other as a wine distiller and grocer, while her husband is a local vegetable grower. Soung's business is doing very well, so she is requesting a loan to buy more groceries in order to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juana Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes inició el negocio cuando dejo de trabajar en una tienda comercial donde era empleada y se quedo sin ningún ingreso que le permitiera solventar sus necesidades y las de su madre la cual depende de ella. Comenzó el negocio  en Febrero de 1995 cuando dejo de trabajar como empleada, inicio con una papelería que acondiciono en su casa aprovechando que vive en una avenida muy transitada; además vendía productos para el hogar y de belleza de reconocidas marcas, pero en Febrero de 1995 una tía la convenció que vendiera joyería de oro ya que se acercaba el día de San Valentín y ella viajaba a la ciudad de Guadalajara a comprar, siguió su consejo y así empezó con la joyería, pero después salio la moda de los collares y pulseras de fantasía y plata, y empezó a comprar revistas para aprender a hacerlas y le gustó mucho, hasta la fecha se dedico a esto y le va muy bien. 

Como le ha ido muy bien con la bisutería ya volví a meter artículos de papelería, así como  regalos y novedades para complementar por lo cual de esta manera puede tener diversas fuentes de ingreso y no depender solo de la venta de  la bisutería.


Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar materia prima para elaborar bolsas, pulseras, collares, añillos, etc., y tener un extenso surtido para este 14 de febrero que se acerca y que la gente aprovecha para regalar a sus amistades.
texts.en:
Lourdes began her business in February 1995, when she stopped working at her earlier job in a store and was left without an income. She had no way to provide for herself and for her mother, who is dependent on her. At first, she ran a stationer's out of her house, taking advantage of the fact that her street is a very busy one; then she expanded the range of items she sold to include household products and cosmetics. After a while, an aunt of hers convinced her to start selling gold jewelery in the run up to Valentine's day. Lourdes took her advice and her jewelery business took off. Necklaces and bracelets came into fashion, and she sold many kinds. She also began to read up on how to make jewelery, and really enjoys the process. Now she makes many pieces herself. Since her jewelery business has grown, she has also added other products to her stock. Now, to complement the jewelery, she offers other kinds of gifts and novelty items. In this way, she can have various streams of income and won't be completely dependent on jewelery sales. Lourdes needs a loan of $10,000 pesos, which she will repay in 12 installments, so that she can buy supplies she needs to make bags, bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc. She wants to have lots to offer this Valentine's day and she wants to be able to help people give their friends gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supplies for jewelery making

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana M., 25, is married with 3 children. She has 3 years of experience in a handicrafts business. She sells to the general public, tourists and overseas markets 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to upgrade the level of her business in order to become more successful. She will buy an electric chainsaw, sand paper and painting materials used in carving.

loans.use: To purchase an electric chainsaw, sand paper and painting materials

loans.name: Nasreen M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a wife of M. R. and they have lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past six years. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and has been in this business for five years. Nasreen baji is the mother of two children, one son and one daughter who are in school. Nasreen baji sews clothes to pay for her children's school fees because her husband’s income barely meets the financial expenses of the household. She is requesting a loan to change the body of her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) so he can continue to earn his income.

She is the group leader of a group with four other women. Shagufta baji requests a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Gaman baji requests a loan to buy a donkey cart. Bashiran baji requests a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Rukhsana baji requests a loan to buy a buffalo for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: For vehicle improvement

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Margarita es casada tiene 53 años, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales los  dos menores de  12 y 9 años están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Margarita  trabajaba  en casas limpiando, cocinando y vendiendo de todo, hasta que se sintió cansada y  comenzó criando en su casa dos cerditos cuando crecieron los mato y vendió la carne  y recupero el doble de ganancia, se dio cuenta que con los chanchos ganaba mas
Empezó a comprar  más cerditos, alquilo un corral para criar cerdos, hoy tiene 40 cerdos.  
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de alimentos para cerdos y medicinas para cerdos. 
Desde que esta en Finca, su capital ha crecido, aprendió de las charlas que se dictan en el Bancomunal, también ha aprendido ahorra.  
El sueño de Margarita es poner un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen de las Mercedes." Margarita is 53 years old and married. She has 6 children; the 2 youngest (the 9 and 12 year old) study in the state school. Margarita used to work cleaning houses, cooking, and selling everything until she felt tired and began raising 2 piglets in her home. When they got older, she killed them and sold the meat making double the profit. She then realized that she could earn more with pigs. She began to buy more loans, rented a corral to raise pigs, and today has 40 pigs. Margarita needs a loan of 800 soles, to buy food and medicine for the pigs. Since she has been a member of Finca, her capital her grown. She has learned from the talks her Communal Bank offers and she has also learned to save. Margarita’s dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Margarita necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de alimentos para cerdos y medicinas para cerdos.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
“One must be patient and have perseverance to live life successfully,” is the principle of Virginia M.. She is 59 years old, a mother of four children and married to Herminio M.. They are living in a rural community located in Barangay Nangalisan of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Most of her children are high school graduates only, unable to pursue their college courses due to a lack of finances. Now, all of her children are married and have their own families.

Virginia earns a living by maintaining their general store business. Her husband also maintains a piggery and small rice farm where most of the income from the store are invested. They use only a small amount for their daily necessities. According to Virginia, she can make a net income of PHP700.00 (about USD $14) per week. This is very little to support their piggery business and their small rice farm. Virginia is seeking the support of the lenders to borrow a loan of PHP19, 000.00 (USD $400). She will use the money as additional capital for their businesses and to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Dionisio Rafael

texts.es: El Señor Dionisio Rafael M. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Dionisio tiene 7 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Dionisio es el servicio de electricidad. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Dionicio inicio con este oficio  porque laboraba en una empresa energía, por lo que su trabajo es muy peligroso pero como no tenía muchas opciones de trabajo y decidió prestar los servicios de electricista. Por lo que los financiamientos le han servido de mucha ayuda por que solo así ha comprado las herramientas necesarias para sus trabajos. El solicita este dinero para la compra de alicates, alambres y otros materiales especiales para su trabajo. su sueño es seguir con vida ya que este trabajo es muy peligroso.
texts.en:
Señor Dionisio Rafael M. is 58 years old and married. Don Dionisio has 7 children, all of whom are working. Don Dionisio's has worked as an electrician for more than 20 years. He began in this business because he previously worked for an energy company. His work is very dangerous, but as he did not have many options for employment, he decided to provide services as an electrician. Financing has helped him greatly, because he could not have purchased the tools he needed for this work without these loans. Don Dionisio is requesting this loan in order to purchase pincers, wires and other special materials for his work. His dream is to continue living, since this work is very dangerous.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Liboria

texts.en:
Maria V. R. has been a client of Fundación Paraguaya for five years. She is married, and her husband is a photographer. Together they have three children, all school-aged.

Maria has owned her clothing store for over ten years. It has been growing and she has a well-established clientele base. Maria travels every so often to Brazil to buy more merchandise to sell. Her dream is to build a second floor to her store in order to offer more products to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Ms Dalia N. B. owns a private primary school with 200 pupils. She has been running the school for four years. Dalia will use her loan to stock the school library and to purchase other teaching materials, such as chalks, markers and blackboards. Her business dream is to provide the very best for the pupils and for her pupils to get many first grades. Her goal is to create the very best school there can be.

loans.use: To stock the library and purchase other teaching materials (chalks, markers, blackboards)

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn B. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Judilyn is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Judilyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products like lumpia, banana crackers, and many more in the local community. Judilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Judilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Puli, Carmen, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Asha B. from Mwanza. She is married and 7 children between the ages of 14 and 36 years old. She is also responsible for supporting 2 dependents because their parents cannot fully support them.

Asha sells bricks for house construction. She started the business in 2009 and works 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, assisted by 3 employees. Asha currently earns about $200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 TSHS to expand her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Asha thanks you for supporting her!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Georges

texts.fr:
Georges K. vend des poules et porcs à Kisangani. Une ville victime des guerres atroces en 2000 an, causée par deux armées étrangères qui l’ont cicatrisée. Kisangani est une ville principale de la province Orientale localisée au nord de la ligne de l’Equateur et frontalière avec le Soudan et l’Ouganda.
Georges est éleveur et aussi vendeur. Il vend au marché central de la ville. Son activité soutient sa famille et l’aide à préparer l’avenir de ses enfants. Son ambition est de créer une entreprise de transport qui est très indispensable à Kisangani. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $90 par semaine. Il compte avec le prochain prêt, élargir son activité en achetant des produits de consommation sollicités par beaucoup de ses clients. Georges travaille rigoureusement et a démontré sa fidélité envers L’Institution de Micro Finance HOPE Kisangani RDC en recevant 5 fois les prêts et les remboursant totalement à temps. Il est marié et père de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 8 mois et 15 ans. Quatre d’entre sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Georges K. sells chickens and pigs in Kisangani. A town which fell victim to the atrocious wars in 2000, caused by two foreign armies that scarred it, Kisangani is a main town of the Eastern province, located north of the Equator and bordering Sudan and Uganda.

Georges raises livestock and sells it as well. He makes his sales in the central market of the town. His business supports his family and helps him prepare for his children's future. His ambition is to create a transport business which is indispensable for Kisangani. Presently, his business generates a profit of US$ 90 per week. With this next loan, he intends to expand his business by buying foodstuffs requested by many of his customers.

Georges works very hard and has demonstrated his trustworthiness to the Micro-finance Institution HOPE Kisangani DRC by receiving 5 previous loans and reimbursing them in a timely manner. He is married and the father of 5 children whose ages vary from 8 months to 15 years. Four of them are enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase chickens and pigs for resale to increase his income

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat is 49 years old and married with four children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.  She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly. Kudirat says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes J. is from the village of Manggahan, Lower Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children. Lourdes owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling products like fish and rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the educational expenses of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
At her age of 48, Anilyn B. already has five children. She needs an extra source of income to be able to continue sending her children to school. At present, two of her children are in college and three are taking their high school level. Next school year, one child will be entering college. Her husband is busy farming and planting rice, corn and vegetables for their food. For two years, Anilyn has been selling kugon (light materials made of a kind of grass) for the roof of the house.

Anilyn is willing to finish her children's education but she experiences difficulties in life. When I ask her if her income in her business can sustain their needs, she bows her head and says “not enough”, but she is giving her best to work just to give her children a good future. She dreams that her children will finish their studies because she knows that education is the sword to alleviate poverty. She wants to borrow Php 6,000 for additional capital to be used for her other business, which is a retailing business.

loans.use: Additional capital for the improvement of her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Our client is Carolina. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita D. Belen D. Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Ccorao. She is 48 years old and married with three children who are studying.

She sells grains like quinoa, wheat, etc., in Huacaro and San Jeronimo, two areas of Cusco.  She buys grains from wholesalers in San Jeronimo and communities in Pisaq.  She sells approximately 150 soles worth of goods every week, which equates to $52 each week. She has been working with Arariwa, a Kiva partner, for six years and feels that Arariwa helps her and her family.

Carolina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grains to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio REYNALDO, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 60 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos dos varones y una mujer, ellos son profesionales. El trabaja como docente de nivel secundaria en la ciudad del Cusco.    

El alterna sus actividades de docente con el negocio de venta de equipos de construcción como teodolitos, balanzas de arena, kit de taquimetría, etc. El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de equipos de construcción.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The partner, Reynaldo, belongs to the communal bank "AMAUTA". He is from the city Cusco and is 60 years old. He is married with three children, two boys and a girl, who are professionals. He works as a secondary school teacher in the city Cusco. He alternates his teaching activities with a business that sells construction equipment such as theodolites (angle measuring device), sand scales, Tachymetry Leveling kits, etc. Reynaldo needs the loan to increase his production of construction equipment sales. He is grateful for the opportunity afforded through this mean and likewise promises to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction equipment

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 44 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 7 hijos, en su casa propia.
Años atrás de dedicaba a la venta de comestibles en su vivienda, pero lo fue bien, pues sus hijos pequeños se comías la mercadería a escondidas.
Ahora, ha puesto todas sus energías en sus cultivos de café y plátanos, donde trabaja  juntamente con su esposo. Poco a poco vienen incrementando su producción y cada cierto tiempo envían una carga a su hija que vive en otra ciudad.
Sin embargo, Olga tiene nostalgia por su bodega, es por ello que planea retomar ese negocio para cuando sus hijos crezcan, pero por el momento seguirá trabajando con mucho esmero y ahínco en sus cultivos, ya que mediante estas ganancias viene educando a sus hijos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, demostrando ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos y en las reuniones de su banco comunal, pues estima mucho a su grupo y está agradecida por los créditos adquiridos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cultivos de café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Olga is 44 years old. She and her partner have 7 children and they live in their own home.

Years ago, Olga operated a grocery store out of her home and did very well. Sometimes her small children would eat some of the merchandise without her knowing it. Now she puts all of her energy into helping her husband grow coffee and bananas. Their production has been gradually increasing and they hope to eventually send a shipment to their daughter who lives in another city. Olga gets nostalgic about her grocery store, and she hopes to reopen her business when the rest of her children are grown. For now she continues to work on her crops with great effort and dedication so that she can pay for her children’s education.

This is her third loan with MFP. Olga has demonstrated that she is a reliable client who can make her payments on time. At her Communal Bank meetings, she is well respected by the other members and expresses her gratitude for the loans she has received. The money she requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her coffee and banana crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina A. is currently in the business of selling beer and charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  She is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has one child who goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a house for renting.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Glenn

texts.en:
Ma. Glen S. is 42 years old. She is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan del Sur. She has three children, the eldest of whom is 21 years old. She dreams of providing them with a brighter future and education so that they will be able to get better jobs when they are older. Now, she is busy preparing the soil for the next planting. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to expand her harvest and increase her income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Carmen Ita

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Ita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jazmines”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.
Carmen Ita, se dedica a la venta de panes y dulces,  lleva varios años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Carmencita, como le dicen de cariño, poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día son clientes fijos en su puesto. 
Actualmente, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa, por el trabajo que realiza.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará ingredientes e insumos como: harina, azúcar, sal y saborizantes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva vitrina, para exhibir sus productos.
Carmen Ita, agradece bastante, al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional y a otras mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Ita is a member of the Jasmines Communal Bank in the District and Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is 37 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of three dependent children.

Carmen Ita has been selling breads and sweets for several years at the Central Market in the district. Carmencita, as she is known by those who love her, gradually built up her savings and became more well-known among her customers. Today she has a fixed clientele who visit her vending location. Her business continues and she is very proud of the work she has done.

With her loan of 1500 soles, Carmen Ita will purchase ingredients and supplies such as flour, sugar, salt, and flavorings. Some of the money will also be used to purchase a new display case for exhibiting her products. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing unconditional support to her and other women like her who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, supplies, and a display case

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 21 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Diego, de 22 años, y su querida hija Ruth de tan solo 8 meses de nacida, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Recorriendo las oscuras calles de la ciudad se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi en su motocarro. Aunque sabe que esta es una actividad donde predominan los varones no se amilana y muy firme en sus convicciones sigue trabajando duro, con el único fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede recorrer las calles de la ciudad cumpliendo su trabajo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que tiene que obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias.
Para más adelante, espera reunir el dinero necesario para comprarse otro motocarro, ya que su esposo también ha decidido trabajar en lo mismo.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Silvia con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad y se siente muy segura de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre alegra con sus ocurrencias a todas sus compañeras durante las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados hará arreglar los asientos de su motocarro, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han deteriorado.
texts.en:
Silvia is 21 and is a very happy and uncomplicated young woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Diego, 22, and their dear daughter of 8 months. They are the reason for all her effort. Riding through the dark streets of the city, she works as a motocarro taxi driver. Although she knows that this is work where men predominate, she remains undaunted, and she is very strong in her convictions. She continues working hard, with the only goal of improving the quality of life of her family. What she likes most about her work is that she can go around the city streets doing her job. She has been in this work for 2 years and feels that the hardest part is working late hours because that’s how she makes the most money. In the future she would like to save enough money to buy another motocarro since her husband has decided to do the same work. This is the second loan for Silvia with MFP. She is very happy with the opportunity and feels sure that she can make the payments on time. In her communal bank she is a very well-liked member because she’s always happy with the stories of her companions during the meetings. With the one thousand new soles that she is requesting, she will fix the seats in her motocarro since they have deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up the seats in her motocarro

loans.name: Industrial Area 2 Akoko Margaret Group

texts.en: A. Margaret represents this group. She is an active business woman whose business is dealing in produce: maize, beans, g-nuts (peanuts), etc. She has been in this business for over 16 years. Due to inadequate capital, she needs a loan to purchase goods and increase her stock. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to educate her children and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase produce

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 55 años, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones económicas para la compra de materia prima necesaria. A lo que ella se dedica es una pulpería pues ella ofrece lo más elemental para la elaboración de las comidas diarias. Ella es una persona muy triunfadora y que está al pendiente de lo más necesario de su familia.  Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra materia prima necesaria para su negocio. ella sueña con ampliar su negocio poco a poco.
texts.en:
Maria de Los Angeles is 55 years old and has always tried to improve her standard of living through providing the basics for people. She runs a small store where she offers basic ingredients for daily cooking. She has a winning personality and she is always taking care of the needs of her family. She has always enjoyed working. She is seeking this loan to buy those basics for her business. She hopes to expand her business little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
el señor Abel B. R. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos, Abel se dedica a la 
venta de conos, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. El medio de transporte es una  bicicleta en la cual se desplaza a los barrios, colonias y caserios repartiendo sus conos. Los conos son muy bien vendidos ya que en la ciudad de San Lorenzo el clima es muy caliente y muchas personas compran los conos para refrescarse. utilizara el credito para comprar productos para la elaboracion de sus conos.
Su mayor deseo es comprase una moto para vender su producto, ya que en bicicleta tiene que esforzarse mucho para llegar a lugares largos, tiene mucho desgaste fisico.
texts.en:
Abel B. R. is 43 years old and married with two children. He sells ice-cream cones and has 8 years of experience in the business. His means of transportation is a bicycle, on which he travels to neighborhoods, villages, and districts distributing his cones. They sell very well, since in the city of San Lorenzo the climate is very hot and many people buy them as refreshments. He will use the loan to purchase materials to make his cones. His dream is to buy himself a motorcycle to sell his products, because the bicycle requires great effort to reach remote locations and he is physically exhausted.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, cones, and napkins

loans.name: Faasipa

texts.en:
Faasipa P. is 45 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Faasipa has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faasipa needs a loan of WST $1800 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faasipa joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faasipa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is the wife of M. F. and they come from Multan, a city famous for its shrines and sweetmeats in Pakistan. 
She has three daughters and all of her daughters work in a photo frame-making business. They learnt this art from their mother Allah Rakhi. They earn a profit of Pak Rs. 9,000 every month which is a big help for their family. 

Allah Rakhi’s husband works at a sewing business. He runs his own tailoring shop in the community where he sews specifically men's clothes. His shop has become renowned among his customers.  

Allah Rakhi has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to purchase an electric sewing machine for her husband so he can sew clothes on time and earn a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Edueyovi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de divers articles. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005. Elle est veuve et c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient aux charges de ses 3 enfants et aussi à  ses propres charges. Voulant gonfler son stock en baisse, elle sollicite  son premier crédit pour l’achat de fourneaux, houe, coupe-coupe, tisane et divers.
texts.en:
This woman makes her living retailing various articles. She has been doing this since 2005. She is a widow, and it is thanks to the income from her business that she is able to support her three children and herself. In order to replenish her diminishing stock of goods, she is seeking her first loan in order to purchase stoves, drag hoes, cutters, teapots and various others items.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing stoves, drag hoes, cutters, teapots etc for resale

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Alfred V. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. He is 46 years old, married and has four children who range from 5 to 17 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For six years, Alfred has been selling used clothes on Johnson Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner, which keeps his customers returning.

He plans to use his 19,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 70,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more used clothes.

His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his family so that they can have a better future. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Alfred is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Akosua is a lovely and hard-working woman. She is divorced but takes responsibility for her four children from age 6-12 years. She is now forty years old. Akosua lives together with her children in a family house at Dormaa, where she also does her trading. She is able to provide support to her family’s financial needs through the sale of 'kenkey'. 

'Kenkey' is one of the Ghanaians' favorite local dishes that is rich in carbohydrate. It is prepared with corn dough made into balls, cooked between 1-2 hours and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. It could also be enjoyed with other sauces. 'Kenkey' is known throughout all the tribes in Ghana and commonly sold on most streets.  Selling it for the past 15 years, Akosua has made quite a number of repeat customers through good customer relations. She plans to invest the loan to purchase bags of maize and cartons of fish to support her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a restaurant in her community.

Akosua is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Trust' made up of 12 members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as the sale of groceries, dried fish, food selling, plantain selling, traditional medicine, etc. Akosua hopes to support her kids so they can acquire a good education.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and cartons of fish

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet E. is from the barangay (village) of Pisaan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years of age and separated from her husband. She’s blessed with four children, of both school age and infant age. Juliet was previously engaged in buying and selling bananas. 

At present, she is engaged in a bandsaw mill business with her live-in partner as the operator. Juliet has been engaged in this business for almost a year and earns approximately $330 a month from this activity.  Aside from that, she is still earning income from her banana sales.  

In 2009, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Juliet is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for purchasing good lumber and to buy another bandsaw mill machine. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for her children’s future education.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy good lumber and another bandsaw mill

loans.name: Srorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srorn K. is 55 years old and is the president of this group loan, having been selected by the thirteen members from Thlok Doung Tum village in Takeo province.  Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different businesses.  Mrs. Srorn K. and her husband, Mr. Mook Soam, are farmers who work very hard to support their family living. Mrs. Srorn K. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to pay laborers to plow the farm. Her husband is also in the cow breeding business. This couple has two children; one is a vehicle driver and another one is still at home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to hire farm laborers for plowing.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. She is an energetic lady. She sells clothes in the surrounding area in order to earn an income so that she can help her husband meet their family's financial needs. Her husband is a tailor and has a tailoring business in the market. They both have chosen their businesses because the people of Lahore are fond of clothes. That’s why these businesses have proven to be very successful and profitable.  

Sometimes her husband faces challenges fulfilling tailoring orders on time due to the heavy workload. As a result, he has decided to hire a worker to help in his tailoring shop. Josephine has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy another sewing machine for his worker. He hopes that, working together, they will fulfill the orders on time and generate a good income. Josephine is hopeful that this investment will help her husband to increase his income, which will bring financial satisfaction to his family.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Alma Norma

texts.es: Alma Norma M. desde hace un año cuenta con su negocio de Abarrotes llamado “Nahomi”, mismo que tiene en su misma casa para poder estar al tanto de sus 3 hijas para brindarles mas atención. Su esposo trabaja como empleado de trasportes; para llevar gente a las maquiladoras, entre los dos suplen los gastos. Alma desea surtir más su negocio para seguir generando ganancias y así ofrecer a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alma Norma M. has had her grocery business, which is called “Nahomi”, for one year. It is located in her house so that she is able to give her three daughters more attention. Her husband works as a transportation employee, and he takes people to the factories. Between the two of them they cover the expenses. Alma wants to stock her business more in order to keep generating income. That way she will give her daughters a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer H. is the married father of three children. A tractor operator, Azer combines his profession with his major occupation - farming. It is a very profitable business, which requires significant financial means and physical effort.  He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them to the local bazaar traders and sometimes sells to his neighbors. 

Azer's monthly income is about 250-300 AZN and he is on the way to increase it to 500 AZN. Now he needs to expand his cultivatable land and increase his revenue. Azer is seeking a loan of 600 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will allow him to increase his production and better satisfy his clientele.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna H. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Lorna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Youn

texts.en: Mrs. Youn S. M. is married to Mr. Choeun Bouv and they are living in Srah Takuon village in Takeo province.  Youn S. M. was born in 1971 and owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to support her family. Her husband is a farmer and owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land used to cultivate rice which he sells to support his family. Her husband also buys and resells cattle and motorbikes. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. In order to expand the business, Mrs.Youn S. M. is requesting a loan to buy more cows for her husband to sell. The couple supports two children who are both students. Mrs.Youn S. M. and her husband are featured in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas K. lives in Kisaasi, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She and her husband have five children, all of whom are in school. Evas sells bananas at market for a living and has been in this business for over 10 years. She works six days a week. Her primary business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Evas has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale.  Her goal is eventually to own a delivery van, thus overcoming her transportation hurdle. She aspires to see her children educated through university level.

Evas and her family live in a rented home with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Gavharjon

texts.en:
Gavharjon is a single mother who raises her three children alone. She works hard to ensure a decent livelihood for her small family. Gavharjon started her small business 8 years ago when the clothing sales business was only getting started in Tajikistan. Even today, there is still little competition at the market where she sells her inventories. This business is her family's only income. Gavharjon has used business loans before and finds them very helpful. This time she is requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni to increase the variety of items she offers. Gavharjon hopes to restock her kiosk and make it more profit.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new goods in order to increase the variety of goods.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is grateful for access to business loans, incentive loans (house repair, educational and market day loans), and other services such as savings and insurance. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Lilia is hopeful that her sewing business will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life.

Because Lilia’s sewing business requires more capital to sustain its operation, she is requesting a loan through ASHI for that purpose and to meet the demands of her customers. Lilia’s dream is for her only child, Lannie, to have a good life. Additionally, she hopes to continue the sewing business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

Through the support of ASHI and KIVA, Lilia hopes to someday improve their standard of living and escape the umbrella of poverty. Her long term goals are to have a full-fledged sewing business and to buy a tricycle, a three-wheeled-vehicle used as public transportation. She and her husband want to offer a good transport business in their village. The couple believes that having their own tricycle would be a good additional income source. By then, Lilia believes that their lives will be changed and she will have her dreams achieved.

loans.use: To support her sewing business

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
I Putu S. is a 34-year-old male living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  I Putu is the new group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by MUK. He was chosen to replace I Ketut Budi Utama who went work to in Denpasar.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Taman Indah (PK-10372).


I Putu is married and has one adult and one school-aged child.  To make a living, I Putu owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  I Putu has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 500,000 - 750,000 IDR a month from this activity.


In 2010, I Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  I Putu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,375,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  He is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by I Putu from MUK.  I Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





I Putu S. (0) merupakan 34 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  I Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 8 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Taman Indah (PK-10372).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  I Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Putu menghasilkan sekitar 500.000 - 750.000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, I Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  I Putu telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.375.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.400.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Elar Odon

texts.es:
Elar es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijas en el sector La Clake , una localidad rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Reque, una zona comercial ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas desde que era joven, actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño criadero de cuyes, los cuales engorda para ofrecerlos en venta a sus vecinos y negociantes que siempre vienen a comprárselos para comercializarlos en los principales mercados de la región. Adicionalmente el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar maíz. Con los ingresos que el percibe se encarga de solventar los gastos de su familia y sacarlos adelante.

Elar desea hacer mejoras en su criadero construyendo mejores corrales y adquiriendo alimento balanceado para lograr que sus cuyes de desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a un mejor precio.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitara Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elar is a 39 year-old father who lives with his wife and two daughters in La Clake sector, a rural place in Reque district which is a commercial area located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Elar has worked in farming since he was a young man.  He currently has a small guinea pig farm.  He fattens the guinea pigs up and then offers them for sale to his neighbors and traders who always come to buy them from him so that they can re-sell them in the main markets of the region.  Elar also has a plot of land where he grows corn.  He uses the income he makes from this activity to cover his family's expenses and get them ahead in life.

Elar would like to make improvements to his guinea pig farm, building better pens and acquiring balanced feed so that his guinea pigs develop in the best way possible and can be sold for a better price.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed and to fix his pens so that he can expand his business raising and selling guinea pigs

loans.name: Abadia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Abadia; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, ella hace diferentes trabajos como mesas, sillas, ventanas y puertas, ella quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  madera al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Ms. Abadia, is a member of the "Maquimanta Purisun" communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ms. Abadia is 37 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her carpentry business.  She makes different pieces like tables, chairs, windows, and doors.  Abadia would like to expand her furniture-making business.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy wood wholesale.

Abadia is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale

loans.name: Ma. Georgina

texts.en:
Ma. Georgina D. P. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old. Ma. Georgina is single. To make a living, Ma. Georgina owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing xerox services to local community members. Ma. Georgina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Georgina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Georgina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Ma. Georgina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ma. Georgina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Elvin Nahun

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 23 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán, se dedica a vender refrescos, está soltero y vive con sus padres, este joven es trabajador, ayuda a su madre con sus necesidades y ve por sus propios gastos siendo independiente para sus padres.
El inicio ayudándole a su madre, luego se dedico a vender de forma permanente para contar con un ingreso estable, su inconveniente es que en ocasiones se le terminan los materiales para preparar los refrescos por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales en abundancia de aquellos productos de más duración, como azúcar y frutas de duración, esta será una gran ayuda para él ya que su inventario lo enriquecerá de productos y aumentara su producción de refrescos.
Su objetivo es algún día tener el negocio solvente de deudas y mejorar la condición económica de él y de sus padres.
texts.en: Elvin, 23, lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán area and sells soft drinks. He is single and lives with his parents. This young man is hardworking and helps his mother with the necessities. He is responsible for his own expenses and financially independent from his parents. He began his business by helping his mother and now sells full-time so he can have a stable income. One inconvenience is that he sometimes runs out of materials to prepare his soft drinks and must ask for a loan to buy bulk materials for those longer-lasting products such as sugar and fruit. This will be a great help for him to enrich his product inventory and increase his soft drink production. His goal is to one day have a business solvent of debt and to be able to improve his and his parents’ economic statuses.

loans.use: to buy fruit and sugar to prepare soft drinks

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg, 33, is married and lives with her husband and their four-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house in her father's backyard.  Her husband makes horse saddles from home and her son goes to kindergarten. They have a decent standard of living. 

Oyunchimeg began her business venture by operating a bakery shop from 2000 to 2003. Then she started a seamstress business, which she has been running for the past 5 years. Oyunchimeg and her husband both fill custom orders for traditional clothing as well as items such as deel – a traditional Mongolian long coat, and horse saddles. They sell women's deels for 65,000 MNT, which cost them 30,000 MNT to produce. Men's deels are sold for 80,000 MNT and cost 40,000 MNT to produce. Their monthly profit is between 400,000 to 500,000 MNT.  

Oyunchimeg is a hardworking and active person who tries her best to fulfill her goals. Oyunchimeg says, "We get loans from XasBank and it has already helped us to improve our lives". She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase more materials for her deel making business.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, es una mujer de 35 años que vive junto a su esposo Carlos. Los dos cuidan de sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). La venta de ropa, es su principal actividad económica, desde entonces Lourdes visita a sus clientes durante las mañanas, ellos gustosos compran las novedades que trae. El secreto para su buena venta, son las facilidades de pagó que brinda, ya que deja a crédito las prendas que vende. En sus 8 años de experiencia nunca tuvo dificultades, ahora se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por mayor, aprovechando los conciertos artísticos locales, logrando percibir un dinero extra. Pero su mayor prioridad es acondicionar un espacio en su casa, para poder abrir una tienda de venta de ropa para toda ocasión. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener muchos éxitos. Lourdes, constantemente compra mercadería, por ello con el crédito adquirirá 700 a 800 prendas de vestir entre, pantalones, polos, ropas interiores y uniformes escolares para la campaña escolar que se avecina.
texts.en:
Lourdes, age 35, lives with her husband, Carlos.  Both of them take care of their four children in their own house in the city of La Merced (central Peruvian jungle).  Selling clothes is her primary business activity.    Lourdes visits her customers during the mornings.  They gladly buy the latest fashions that she brings.

The secret to her good sales is the easy payment that she offers.  She leaves the clothes that she sells on credit.  In her eight years of experience she has never had difficulties.

She now sells wholesale beer, taking advantage of the local artistic concerts.  She manages to get extra money that way.  But, her greatest priority is to equip a space in her house in order to be able to open a store selling clothing for all occasions.  

She belongs to the “Las Optimistas” (The Optimists) Communal Bank.  This is their first loan with MFP, and they hope to obtain many successes.  Lourdes constantly buys merchandise.  Therefore, she will use the loan to get 700 to 800 garments like pants, polo type shirts, underwear, and school uniforms for the coming school season.

loans.use: To buy clothing like school uniforms

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida M. is from the village of Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nida provides tricycle transport services. Nida has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Nida joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting her first loan, for 15000 PHP, to be used to purchase tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Merikebu Group

texts.en:
Eshi N., who is in her early fifties, is single with three children. She has been selling ladies clothes door to door as well as selling wheat to local brew businesses for four years. She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Eshi's fouth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more fabrics and sacks of wheat for the local brew and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her business stock. Her dream is to one day build her own house and take her children to good schools.

Eshi will share this loan with her loan group "Merikebu", which has a total of 17 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Eshi is first on the right in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes and wheat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her daughter to use to help her in her tailoring business

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor, es comerciante D. frutas y verduras, resiD. en San Jorge departamento D. San Miguel, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 6, 8 y 11 años D. edad, posee el negocio desD. hace 7 años y fue fundado por iniciativa propia junto a su esposo, trabaja todos los días D. la semana D. 6:00am a 6:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades con el negocio.
Ella quiere invertir en la compra D. tomates, papas, uvas, bananos y otras más, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra con el gasto y le ayuD. a fortalecer el negocio, tratando D. tener para los clientes la mejor mercadería.
Para ella su objetivo es tener una fuente D. ingreso estable, para cubrir los gastos D. sus hijos y velar por todas las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Flor is a fruit and vegetable merchant. She resides in San Jorge in the Department of San Miguel. Flor is married and lives with her husband and three children (ages 6, 8, and 11). She has managed her business for seven years and started it through her own initiative and that of her husband. Flor works every day of the week from 6am to 6pm. As of this date, she has not had any difficulties with her business.

Flor wants to invest in the purchase of tomatoes, potatoes, grapes, bananas, and other types of produce. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to cover the expense and strengthen her business by attracting more customers with the best merchandise.

Her goal is to have a stable source of income to cover her children’s expenses and proviD. for all of the household needs.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, grapes, bananas, and other types of produce.

loans.name: Espuma De Mar Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ESPUMA DE MAR”, está integrado por 10 clientas en este grupo se encuentra la señora Rufina Martínez de 51 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos; 2 mujeres y 3 hombres, estudió hasta el Quinto año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene su negocio de abarrotes que inició aproximadamente 15 años, que se ubica en el Estado de México, el prestamo lo solicita para invertir en mercancía como: enlatados, leche, huevo, arroz, frijol, azúcar,Jabón, y carnes frias etc. Lo que ella espera es tener cada día más clientes y que su negocio prospere para gozar de una mejor economía familiar. En este mismo grupo se encuentra la señora Hermelinda Hernández, de 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos varones, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, su negocio es de Antojitos Mexicanos quien tiene aproximadamente 3 años trabajando en este negocio, pide este prestamo para invertir en más producto para ofrecerles más variedad, ella considera que sus clientes están muy satisfechos con su negocio ya que dicen que lo que prepara es muy rico; ella comenta que sus planes a futuro son tener un negocio más amplio donde pueda atender a mas clientes lo que representaría mayor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “ESPUMA DE MAR” (Sea Foam) and is made up of 10 ladies.  Rufina Martínez is a member of the group and has two daughters and three sons.  She has a fifth grade education and started a grocery store in the State of Mexico 15 years ago.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy inventory, such as canned goods, milk, eggs, rice, beans, sugar, soap, and cold cuts.  She wants to have more customers every day and wants her business to prosper so that she can enjoy a better financial situation with her family.

Hermelinda Hernández, age 39, is a member of this same group.  She is married and has two children.  She has a sixth grade education and has been selling Mexican food for about three years.  She is asking for this loan to invest in more products so that she can offer her customers a greater variety.  She feels that they are satisfied because they tell her that her food is delicious.  She tells us that her plans are to expand her business in the future so that she can serve more customers.  This business is her family’s biggest source of income.

loans.use: to buy inventory and ingredients

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is a thirty year old married woman with four children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in produce for six years.  Eliza  lacks capital. She is asking for a loan to buy cassava flour to sell. Eliza's vision is to own a food store.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Bertha Cecilia

texts.es:
Bertha de 65 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, es separada y tiene tres hijos de 37, 30 y 28 años todos profesionales y trabajan. Su actividad es la venta de comidas rápidas corviches. 

Empezó hace 25 años vendiendo papas rellenas y corviches (comida hecha en verde plátanos y pescado).en Manabi con sus ahorros compro un terreno en Guayaquil e instalo su negocio de comidas rápidas. Labora desde las 6H00 am primero va al mercado a comprar el pescado y el verde para la preparación del corviche para sus ventas. Cada corviches lo vende a 0,30 ctvs. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en sus medicinas por salud y compras de verdes, gas y vitrinas para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea terminar de construir su casa ya que con los créditos de D-miro avanza considerablemente.
texts.en:
Bertha is 65 years old and lives in a peri-urban area in el Fortin de Guayaquil. She is separated and has three children ages 37, 30 and 28 years old and they are all working professionals. She sells fast food corviches (a dish made out of green bananas and fish). 

She started her business 25 years ago selling stuffed potatoes and corviches in Manabi. She bought a plot of land in Guayaquil with her savings and set up her fast food business there. She works from 6:00am. She first goes to the market to buy the fish and the green banana  to prepare the corviche for her sales. She sells each corviche for 30 cents. With the help of this loan she wants to invest in medication for her health and in buying green bananas, gas and display cases in order to increase her profits. In the future she wants to finish building her house since with the loans from field partner Banco D-MIRO S.A. she is able to advance considerably.

loans.use: to purchase her medicine and to purchase green bananas, gas and display cases for her fast food business.

loans.name: Silvia Amparo

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es costurera desde hace 30 años y con su hermana se dedica a la confección a terceros, sin embargo su negocio estuvo un poco parado ya que ella tuvo un accidente y no podía trabajar, su hija se hizo a cargo del negocio y gracias a esto tuvo trabajo hasta su recuperación.

Ella sueña con tener una empresa muy grande y enseñarle a muchas mujeres la labor de la confección y para iniciar con este sueño quiere tener una máquina más y así poder tener mayor capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
Silvia has been a seamstress for 30 years, and together with her sister she engages in making clothes for third parties; however, her activity had to stop for a while because she had an accident and was unable to work. Then her daughter took charge of the shop, and thanks to this the activity kept on running until she recovered.

She dreams of running a big company and to introduce a great number to the dressmaking activity. To start making her dream come true, she wants to buy an extra sewing machine, in order to increase her production rate.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 49 years old and married with one child.

Lorena earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store where she sells ready-to-wear clothes.
