Lorena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 37 years old. She is a hardworking business woman. She is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been providing for her family for the last two years by selling hay. She supplements her income by engaging in farming. She wants, in the next five years, to have opened up another hay shop. Her dream is to become an established business woman.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hay.

loans.use: To buy hay.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen, age 26, has been a farmer for seven years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from her endeavors. She plans to plant more crops to gain more income, and also intends to make essential repairs to the family home. 

Aileen has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC in order to buy fertilizers and pay for land preparation costs. 

She has three school-aged children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for land preparation costs

loans.name: Bremilde

texts.es:
Bremilde de 36 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican al comercio y al transporte público.

Bremilde labora desde hace 2 años realizando servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual trabaja diariamente hasta las 6 de la tarde, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para realizar mantenimiento y cambio de llantas a su mototaxi que está presentando algunas fallas, al encontrarse su unidad móvil en buen estado podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y esto permitirá aumentar sus ingresos.  Bremilde con esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido salir adelante, lo que le permitirá seguir ayudando a sus padres económicamente enla casa.
texts.en:
Bremilde is 36 years old and single.  He lives in his parent's home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the urban area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is part of Chiclayo province.  The population of this district work in commerce and public transport.

For the last two years, Bremilde has been working providing public transportation service with his mototaxi (transport that is used to travel short distances, with a maximum capacity of 3 people).  He does this work daily until 6 p.m., and with his earnings he is able to cover his expenses and personal necessities.

The loan that he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa through Capital Semilla is for 2,000 New Soles, and it will be used to conduct maintenance and change the tires on his mototaxi, which is showing some damage.  This will keep his vehicle in good condition, so as to be able to provide a better service to his customers and allow him to increase his income.

Bremilde knows how to get ahead in life with effort and hard work, which will allow him to continue helping his parents out financially in the home.

loans.use: to conduct maintenance and change the tires on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Laurencina

texts.pt:
Nasceu  na  provincia  de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos  dos  quais  3 frequentam  a  escola e os outros constituiram familia. Fez  a  7ª classe  e  parou  por  falta  de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal quando contraiu matrimonio, é negociante ha mais de 14 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos, e  tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material PARA CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA ( pranchas, ferro, cimento, areia, pedra, barrotes, e outros.) para a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Laurencina was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children; three of them go to school, and the others have started their families. Laurencina finished seventh grade and quit school because she could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left her hometown when she got married. For more than 14 years Laurencina has been a businesswoman who buys and sells various products, and she earns about 6,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Laurencina's first Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials (planks, iron, cement, sand, stone, beams and other items) for building her house.

She plans to finish the house in order to make her family more comfortable, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (planks, iron, cement, sand, stone, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Altantuya is 36 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with the family business. Altantuya operates a salt trading business. She started her business in 2004 at Han-Ord market. She has gained a lot of business experience. Her husband supports the family business a lot. She is a diligent person who is requesting 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase salt.

loans.use: To purchase salt

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul, a 38-year-old divorced mother of two daughters and a son, is the treasurer of this group. Her older daughter studies at school and the other children are of preschool age (under seven).

Nazgul works in the Regional Electro Station and is also engaged in sewing Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets, taking orders to earn additional money to meet the family's needs. Her daughter helps her in running the business. Nazgul started this activity two years ago with an initial investment of 10000 soms and now earns 6000 soms per month, profits that have made possible repairs to the house.

With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and materials to sew more pillows and blankets. In the future, Nazgul plans to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Ignacia Aydalina

texts.es: La señora Aydalina, de 47 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, es casada, madre de dos hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a vender yuca y golosinas. Ella inicio vendiendo golosinas en el parque central de su ciudad vendía de manera ambulante en loa alrededores del parque  después fue buscando un lugar fijo en el mercado central , decidió vender otro producto de mayor demanda en esa ciudad y fue que comenzó a vender yuca. Ahora tiene su puesto de venta de yuca y venta de golosinas en el parque, pero le gustaría poder expandirse un poco mas pero para eso necesita mas producto que ofrecer,tener un local con mejores condiciones es por ello que este solicitando el préstamo para comprar mas inventario de yuca y golosinas para vender. Al tener más producto podrá vender un poco y ofrecer sus productos en otros lugares de la ciudad.
texts.en: Aydalina is 47 years old and she is originally from the city of Granada. She is married and she is the mother of two children. She is a merchant who sells yucca and sweets. She started out selling sweets in the central park of the city, selling itinerantly around the park. She later started to look for a fixed placed in the market. She decided to sell other products which are in higher demand in the city. This is when she started to sell yucca. She now has a stand from where she sells yucca and sweets in the park. She would like to expand a little more but she requires more product to sell and a stand that is in better condition. She requests a loan to purchase more yucca inventory and sweets to sell. When she has more product she will be able to sell more and she will be able to offer her products in other parts of the city.

loans.use: to purchase more yucca inventory and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Lebina

texts.en: Lebina is 42 years old, married and the mother of five children, three of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has worked very hard at her business, which is making baskets. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 from NWTF to buy the materials she needs to make more baskets. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more baskets.

loans.name: Filadelfa

texts.en: Sixty-two-year-old Filadelfa is a married woman with four children. She lives in the town of Cortes, Bohol, with her family. She runs a multicab transportation business with her husband. This business has been running for eight years. Filadelfa also manages their sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned goods. She requested this loan to purchase spare parts and more items to sell at her store. Filadelfa hopes for their businesses to grow. She also hopes for her family to be healthy always.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Tamara Liseth

texts.es: Tamara mujer trabajadora, emprendedora con el préstamo anterior logro ingresar nuevos productos de cosméticos y aumento sus ventas siendo de gran beneficio para su familia.  Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, laminas de zinc, perlines y ladrillos. Para cambiar el techo que está en mal estado, repechar las paredes y colocar ladrillos en el piso que actualmente es de cemento. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a que ella realice los cambios necesarios de los cuales se obtendrán mayor comodidad y seguridad para su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Tamara is an entrepreneurial working woman. With her previous loan she added a new line of cosmetics and the increased sales have been a great help to her family.

With this loan she will buy construction material such as cement, sand, zinc sheets, steel structural sections, and bricks. She needs to change the roof which is in a bad state, plaster the walls, and lay bricks on the cement floor. 

She is grateful to the communal bank for helping her make the necessary changes which will improve the comfort and safety for her family and her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to change the roof of her house

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr:
Honorine est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un comptable. Elle a 1 enfant qui va à l’école et agé de 12 ans.  
Honorine travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation et du sodabi pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Honorine a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et du sodabi (eau de vie). Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Honorine voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Honorine is 34 years old and she is married to an accountant. She has one child who is 12 years old and goes to school. 

Honorine has been working as a retailer since 2003. She sells food supplies and sodabi (whisky) to all customers in her shop. She buys the products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, she has no problems. 

Honorine requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase general food supplies and sodabi. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the next few years, Honorine would like to expand her business. She says that with her profits, she is planning to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy general food supplies.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has worked in the transport industry in Olkalau Town for the last four years.  He is 28 years old, married to Miriam, and together they have two school-going children.  Gabriel is also a farmer.

Gabriel was introduced to Kiva field partner KADET LTD by one of our field loan officers, and this will be his third loan. He paid back all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer. He also plans to use part of this loan to pay for  motorbike maintenance.

In future, Gabriel wants to invest more in his transport business by buying a passenger service vehicle, and hopes to become one of the leading businessmen in the Olkalau area.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Rafiki Shg Group

texts.en:
Ernest is the facilitator of the Rafiki SHG group. Ernest and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ernest and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Ernest takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Ernest had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ernest was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Ernest will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Rafiki SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Ernest is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; el tiene 47 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el socio es propietario de un carro que hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, su sueño del socio es mejorar su carro para que preste un mejor servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LAS ORQUIDEAS" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Edgar, 47, is single and has a transportation business.  He owns a car that he uses as a taxi in the city of Cusco, working from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  His goal is to improve his vehicle so he can provide better taxi service.  He is requesting a loan to buy repair parts and provide maintenance for his vehicle.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy repair parts and provide maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Mamarazhab

texts.ru: Мамаражаб занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Он хочет улучшить жилищные условия и обеспечить своих детей более на высоком уровне. Мамаражаб хочет обрабатывать землю, чтобы получить хороший урожай на следующий сезон. С этой целью ему необходимо минеральные удобрения. Для этой покупки он просит вас о помощи и запрашивает займ в размере 1200 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mamarazhab is involved in growing and selling agricultural crops.  He is married and has three children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Mamarazhab wants to improve his living conditions and provide more for his children.  He wants to treat his land in order to obtain a good harvest next season.  He needs mineral fertilizers to achieve this goal.  Mamarazhab is asking you for help with this purchase and is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 Somoni.  He relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
O Sr. Augusto de 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 9 filhos dos quais 2 sao independente 7 estao a frequentar escola no ensino secundario, primario e na  formacao na Academia militar. Ele è chefe de seguranca de sargentos militares.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, varoes, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para a construcao de uma capoeira para criacao de pintos.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a  dieta almentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Augusto is 50 years old, married and the father of 9 children. 2 of them are independent and 7 go to either high school, primary school or the military Academy. He's the military sergeant chief of security.

With this loan he will buy construction materials (blocks, cement, rods, stone and pay for labour) to build a hen-house for breeding chickens.

His big challenge is to improve his family's living conditions and diet.

loans.use: construction materials (blocks, cement, rods, stone and pay for labour) to build a hen-house for breeding chickens

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph aged 40 years is married with 4 children aged 22, 20, 17 and 15 years. He does retail trading as his major source of income. He has applied for a loan of shs3,000,000 to buy more stock for his business.  He started business in the year 1999 with high hopes of generating income to cater for his family needs. He also does agriculture to supplement on his monthly income. 

His business is located in his local cell of residence on a busy Street in Bugongi, Sheema District and his clients are people in Sheema district. He is a hard working man who works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. He is faced with a challenge of competition but is determined to grow his business through his hard work. 

He hopes to become financially stable to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy items for sale in his retail shop

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 41 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school, Alberta works very hard to provide for them.

Alberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items of groceries to sell to her store such as, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products.

Alberta has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Alberta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items of groceries to sell to her store such as, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Golden Crown group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Joan she is 30 years old. Married with 4 children. She have not gone for any formal hairdressing training â€“ However, she have gained good experience in Sedona salon where she was employed for 2 years. From the commission she received she saved to start her own small salon.

In year 2002, she received a loan of US$143 from WEEC. She was able to rent a plot and put up a structure where she operates. She was also able to provide electricity in the room. She did weaving of the hair awaiting to by other equipments to enable her serve her customers.

After completing the loan she took US$286 and bought a Drier and Steamer. This has attracted more customers. She has also been able to employ one lady. Given a loan of US$575 she will be able to expand her business and serve all her customers under one roof.

loans.use: Expand business to one larger room.

loans.name: Martha Yaneth

texts.en:
My name is Martha M.. I buy and sell linens for use in bedrooms, kitchens, and living rooms as well as women's shoes. I began my business four years ago. I have good clients and sell my product in private offices. My busniess generates income so that I can support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to sell more and be able to provide food for my family and pay for my daughter's education.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Martha M. me dedico a la compra venta de ropa para cama, cocina, sala y zapatos para dama, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en oficinas privadas, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de mis productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagar la escuela de mi hija.

loans.use: to purchase tableclothes, sheets, curtains, pillow covers, mattresses, shoes, pillows, sheets

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en: Hosiyat has been managing her business for the last three years. Her sister asked her to join her in her business; however, for the last two years, Hosiyat has been working independently. Hosiyat is married and is the mother of 4 children. She knows that having a business means sometimes taking risks, but she has been very cautious so far. She is expanding her business gradually. She thinks having four children helps her in her work, because she knows exactly what type of seasonal clothing children need, and therefore what their parents would buy. She will use the next loan for summer-time shoes.

loans.use: Purchase of summer-time shoes

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi  wants to improve his family's living conditions.  He needs to work very hard every day to cover family expenses. Vidadi is 39 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Zangilan region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children.
Vidadi is applying for a loan of $1000 to make capital repairs on his car so that he can offer better service to his clients and so earn a good income.

loans.use: to make capital repairs on his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy inventory to grow his business

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en:
E. Yagub is 30 years old. He is single. He was born in Sumgayit city and lives there. Sumgayit is situated in the eastern part of the Azerbaijan Republic.

Yagub lives with his parents. They are very old. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

He started his business in 1998. He began his business with $300. He started selling a small variety of shoes. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs. He had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, etc.

In 2004, Yagub borrowed $400 from Normicro, expanded his business and increased the selection of shoes. Now, he needs a $800 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy other shoes and goods to increase his business and to improve his family’s living conditions with this additional income.

loans.use: To further develop his business, buy other shoes and goods

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem R., aged 57, is a widow who works selling second-hand clothes in front of her home earning around $6 per day in revenue.  She has three children who are married and live separately.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 to increase her inventory of clothing to meet growing customer demands.  She anticipates that this will increase her revenue and her income in the long term.  In the future, she plans to reinvest the income to expand her business further.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nervith

texts.es:
Nervith is a member of the communal bank Siempre Unidas (together forever) of the district of Tarapoto, San Martin Province, San Martin district. She owns a business located in the Jr Ricardo Palma 1292. She started her business 36 years ago when she was very young and single, with only a sewing machine. She would sew for her friends in the beginning and later started making uniforms for institutions such as the Health Department and the National University of San Martin among others.

With the loan of S/.1,000.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy rolls of cloth to make towels, children's dresses to send to rural communities, clothing for underwear, buttons and thread wholesale, and assorted sewing accessories. Currently she has renovated her sewing machine and bought a mending machine. She will also buy cloth to make bed sheets and sell them at affordable prices.

Mrs. Nervith is 54 years old. She has two daughters who are professionals but are not working yet. This independent job has allowed her to let her daughters study. Also, she has studied High Couture in the city of Lima. With her good work and high quality finishes liked by her customers, she has increased her clientele and she feels very satisfied being able to help her husband and contribute to the household finances.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers.

Nervith es socia del Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas del distrito de Tarapoto, provincia de San Martín, departamento de San Martín. Posee un negocio ubicado en el Jr Ricardo Palma 1292. Inició el negocio hace 36 años cuando era muy joven y soltera sólo con una máquina de coser, la costura era para sus amigas inicialmente y posteriormente comenzó a elaborar uniformes para instituciones como el Ministerio de Salud, la Universidad Nacional de San Martín entre otros.

Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará telas en fardos para confeccionar toallas, vestidos para niños para enviar a las localidades rurales, telas para ropa interior, botones en taper, hilos en docenas y accesorios de costura. Actualmente ha renovado su máquina y comprado una remalladora. También comprará tela para confeccionar sábanas y venderlas a precios cómodos.

La señora Nervith tiene 54 años, dos hijas que son profesionales, pero que todavía no trabajan. Este trabajo independiente le ha permitido hacer estudiar a sus hijas, además estudió en la ciudad de Lima Alta Costura. Con su buen trabajo y acabado de la costura (que gusta a sus clientes) le ha permitido aumentar su clientela y se siente muy satisfecha en apoyar a su esposo y aportar a la economía del hogar.

loans.use: Buying supplies to make clothes (Compra de insumos para la confección de ropa.)

loans.name: Simona

texts.en:
Simona Santamaría B. has a store selling clothes in the jungle city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She rents a space in the main market where customers from all over the Province come to shop.  Simona started the shop three years ago with the help of her parents who live in another city.  She now runs the shop by herself and has built relationships with many loyal customers.  

Simona is 21 years old, single, and has a son.  Although she would have preferred to study and become a professional she feels lucky that she has her shop and doesn’t need to rely on anyone.  She likes business, building relationships, and having a voice in her community.  One day she dreams of owning a home and educating her child.

A member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas, Simona is requesting a $525 loan to repay over four months.  With the loan she would like to buy jeans of all types and styles from a distributor in Lima.  She has wanted to add jeans to her stock since creating the business.

loans.use: To buy jeans of all types and styles.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Pon has been married for eight years and has three children, two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in local school and her two sons still young stay at home. She sells lotus flowers and grows rice for her income. Her husband cannot work because of serious illness. She brings lotus flowers from her village to sell in Phnom Penh. Pon and her family live national road #5, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.
She is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this money for growing rice.

loans.use: For growing rice

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
At first glance, Bertha appears older than she really is because at her 38 years, she has spent the better part of her life working. Since she was a girl, she has sold fruits and vegetables in different places outside of Lima to help her family. Once she formed her own family, she decided to continue with her work because what her husband earned as a laborer wasn't enough. This is why she opened a vegetable stand in the Huaycán market.

Today Bertha has attended to her numerous clients for 17 years, with the help of one of her three children. She never lacks clients because of her kindness. She assures us that her business is going well, but she would like to make it larger.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A primera vista Bertha aparenta tener más edad de la que realmente tiene y es que a sus treinta y ocho años ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida trabajando. Desde niña ha vendido verduras y frutas en distintos lugares fuera de Lima ayudando a su familia. Una vez que formo su propio hogar decidió seguir con su trabajo pues lo que recibía su esposo trabajando como obrero no era suficiente. Es así que abrió un puesto de verduras en el mercado de Huaycán.

Hoy en día Bertha lleva diecisiete años atendiendo con la ayuda de uno de sus tres hijos a los numerosos clientes que gracias a su simpatía nunca le falta. Ella asegura que le va muy bien en su trabajo pero que le gustaría agrandarlo.

loans.use: To obtain a larger fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Hermina

texts.en:
Hermina lives in Soko, a small village near the town Gračanica and she is married. She works in shoe factory and her monthly salary is 300.00KM. Her husband is also employed and works in factory of furniture where his monthly income is 600.00KM.

Hermina wants to use the loan of 600.00KM for buying a cow. Hermina's wish is to do agriculture and breed cattle in order to increase the number of the stock.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Sodoadika

texts.fr:
Mr. Sodoadika L. was born in 1952 in Avétsèdomé in the department of Vo. He is married and is responsible for his eight (08) children. He is a shopkeeper and opened a small grocery store allowing him to provide for his family’s needs. But to secure his income and to fulfill efficiently his role as the head of the household, he needs to get a regular supply for his store. To this end he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Sodoadika L. est né en 1952 à Avétsèdomé dans la préfecture de Vo. Marié, il est père de huit (08) enfants qu’il prend en charge. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais pour sécuriser son revenu et jouer efficacement son rôle de chef de famille, il a besoin de ravitailler régulièrement sa boutique. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un financement.

loans.use: Buying supplies for a grocery shop

loans.name: Chansum Sut Group

texts.en: The group leader in this group of 4 is Mrs. Chansum S.. Mrs. Chansum S. is 32 and the mother of four children, all of whom are attending school. Mrs. Chansum S. has a small  rice plantation business in Trapaing Preal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She usually hires a laborer with cows to plow her rice field, but she cannot afford this at the present time. She is requesting a loan to pay for a laborer. Her husband, Mr. Thea Chan, is a fisherman.

loans.use: To pay for a laborer to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif S. is 60 and lives in Khuroson district. He works in his own store where he sells food. He would like to take out a loan to purchase a refrigerator, which would help him develop his business, enabling him to increase his assortment of goods and store perishable food products. He plans to repay his loan within three months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Шодиев Шариф житель района Хуросон . Возраст 60 лет . Работает в собственном магазаине по продаже продуктов питания. Хочет получить кредит для покупки холодильника. Это поможет развитию бизнеса , увеличить ассортимент товара , а так же хранению быстропортящийся продукции. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 36 years old. She is married. She has been a food seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Asia now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K., 51, and her husband, Mr. Koet Choun, 53, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two sons and a daughter are married and live outside the family home; the daughter and her husband are both silk weavers. The unmarried son raises cows at home, and the unmarried daughter works in a garment factory.

Mrs. Pov has been farming and growing rice since she was married and has been a silk weaver for three years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been growing rice and vegetables since he was married.

Pov is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif Q. is 35 years old. He is married with three sons; the youngest just started school last year. Asif sells sheep for meat production. He started his business in 1999; at that time, he sold one sheep every two weeks. Now Asif is selling more. The business requires much effort. It does generate enough income to provide for Asif 's family, but not enough to expand his business. He gets up every morning at five o'clock to feed and look after the animals.

Asif requests 1200 USD to purchase 20 additional sheep. Asif appreciates every one who supports him in his business!

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Mayrambi

texts.en:
J. Mayrambi is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Mayrambi's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an independent taxi driver didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter, so Mayrambi decided to start her own business nine years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses.

Little by little she has made her business grow and by offering her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally, but she would like to continue bettering herself (and her business) so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni (US$600) that she will pay back in nine months. With this money, Mayrambi will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses.

The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing of seasonal fabrics to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: S. tiene 26 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su familia. Se dedica a la atención de su botica, desde 4 años atrás, desde que pudo instalarla, a base de mucho esfuerzo. Se dedica a su trabajo la mayor parte del día, abre desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 de la noche aproximadamente, está acostumbrada al trabajo duro y esto no se le hace complicado. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer durante tanto tiempo en su negocio, pero ella sabe que la dedicación que le da se ve reflejado en las ganancias que recibe. S. se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de medicinas para implementar su pequeña botica.
texts.en:
S. is 26 years old, single and living at home with her family. She works in her drugstore, which she was able to open 4 years ago after much effort. She is used to working long hours typically opening at 6:00 AM and not closing until midnight. The most difficult aspect of her work is being in the store for such long hours, but she knows that this dedication is reflected in the earnings she receives. This is S.’s second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she was very punctual with her previous payments. With this loan, she plans to purchase more medicines to stock her small drugstore.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of medecines in her drugstore

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 26 year old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Amin has owned an Internet shop for a year. He has internet lines as well as a central telephone. He hasrequested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase five computers and a machine for international phone calls. This is the first time that Amin has requested a loan.
Amin hopes that the loan will improve his shop conditions. He is special in his work because he is the only one in his area and he has a good relationship with his clients. His clients are friends, neighbors and tourists. Amin started his business because he wanted to be independent. In the future, he plans to increase the number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase five computers and a machine for international phone calls.

loans.name: Isiaka

texts.en: Isiaka B. is 60 years old and married with nine children. He lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. He produces and sells palm kernel oil. He needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase additional palm kernel to produce more oil to sell. He is incredibly  grateful to everyone that has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel oil to sell

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Mr. I. is 53 years old and is married with two children.  His older son, who is 25 years old, helps him with his business, Despensa Don Lino.  He has had this small market and meat shop for more than 22 years.  Mr. I. says that like all businesses, his sales have their high and low points, and that these days the country’s overall situation is affecting the meat business.  As beef, milk, and wheat products go up in price, there is a loss of sales in markets like the one owned by Mr. I..  

Mr. I. says that one of his hopes is for an improvement in the country’s quality of life, as the current lack of opportunities for young people causes them to look for work in other countries, something that has consequences on many families.  

He says that his business allowed him to build his own house, support his family, and help his son go to university.  With a loan from Fundación Paraguaya, he plans to buy products and stock his store with the staples that he sells daily, such as milk, beef, beer, sodas, wine, and noodles, among others.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as beef, chicken, fruit, vegetables, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga C. owns a small "sari-sari" store, a Filipino name for variety store, where anyone sells different kinds of goods like rice, soaps, shampoos, drinks, sardines and other products. She is into retailing business since 1990. With her strong entrepreneurial spirit, she still has her store growing and more established. Her husband, Bebiano C. income in his job is not enough to feed and clothe well their family, so she rises to the challenge of venturing into business. Her income goes to pay the electricity, school fees and other needs of her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise in her store. This really could help her attract more customers and will lea to bigger and better sales of her store. 

CEVI is non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. They provide credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage to help their clients manage well their business.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Bushran Allah Rakha Masih Group

texts.en:
Bushran baji has been a citizen of a city named Raiwind, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Raiwind city is famous for its shrines. Her husband's name is A. R. M. and he works in a factory on monthly wage. Bushran baji is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. All are getting an education from a local school. Bushra baji runs a bangle selling business. She sells bangles in the community and in the bangle shops also. With the profits from this business she renovated her house and admitted her kids into school. She is applying for a loan to buy bangles to expand her bangle selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Nargis baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for their sewing clothes business. Sharifan baji and Shaheen baji each want a loan to buy animals (goats & sheep) for their animal selling businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles to resell

loans.name: Roberto Simon

texts.es: El señor Roberto Simón R. López tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en las pilas orientales en Masaya, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos un varón de 13 años que actualmente estudia y le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, el otro varón de doce años solamente estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos para poder darle un bienestar mejor , don Roberto se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años el rubro que trabaja son los granos básicos y hortalizas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio como agricultor por el apoyo de un amigo , con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para poder tener una buena cosecha y poder vender sus productos a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Simón R. López is 39 years old and lives in Las Pilas Orientales in the department of Masaya with his wife who helps him with household expenses. They care for their two sons, one who is 13 and currently studying and helping with the farm work, and the other who is 12 and just goes to school. The plans that Don Roberto has for his family are to improve the living conditions so that he can give his sons better well-being. He has worked in agriculture for 12 years raising basic grains and vegetables. The major difficulty for him is the lack of financing. When he began farming he was helped by a friend, and now financing will help him to buy supplies and fertilizers so that he can have a good harvest and sell his products for a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and supplies to improve crop production

loans.name: Jovenson

texts.en:
Jovenson is married to Irene, a housewife who is presently taking care of their one-year-old son. Jovenson feels that he needs to be more responsible, especially now that he has a child. He promises to work, to the best of his ability, to provide his family with everything they need. 

Jovenson maintains one hectare of rice field as the source of income for his family. However, his income is not enough to sustain his business. That’s why he is seeking a loan for the maintenance of the farm. He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 16,000 ($350 US) to purchase enough fertilizers and seed variety for his farming. After nine years farming, Jovenson knows what’s best for his farm. He wants to prepare the farm to harvest a good yield next harvest season. He wants to earn more profit to provide for the needs of his family, including to send his child to school and to finish college someday. He hopes that he can meet this goal with all the strength and patience he exerts in his farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella Y. is 30-year-old mother with a child who is going to start school. She believes hard work and dedication are the primary antidotes to minimize poverty. As such, she is very serious with her business. Stella has been very resourceful to her family.

Four years ago, Stella started a business of trading food stuff, like plantain. Her major market is the greater Accra of Ghana.  She would like a loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season. In the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country, she believes a loan can help her buy bulk plantain from farmers to eliminate the high prices from middlemen. Stella belongs to a village bank called ‘Yewoha Nhyira’ that means Jehovah’s Blessing.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of plantain

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Doña candida es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace quince años se dedica a las ventas de electrodomésticos y cosméticos, que inicio con la iniciativa de tener ingresos para poder apoyar a sus cuatro hijos para que estudien. Tiene 56 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, no ha podido crecer por falta de financiamientos. Con este préstamo va invertir en electrodomésticos y variedad de cosmético para ofertar a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por los créditos otorgados y por el crecimiento que ha tenido con estos dos préstamos. Sus planes es poder incrementar el volumen de venta y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Candida is an enterprising woman. She has been selling domestic appliances and cosmetics for 15 years. She started the business to obtain earnings so that her four children could continue studying. She is 56 and lives in the Hialeah district of Managua.

Lack of finance prevented her from expanding. She will use the loan to buy domestic appliances and cosmetics to sell to her customers. She is grateful to Afodenic for the loans she has received and because these two loans have enabled her to expand. She plans to increase sales volume and have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic appliances and cosmetics

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe C. is from the village of Dicoyong Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old and married to Rofino C., who is in the Philippine Army.

Mariafe started her business with a small amount of capital ten years ago. She decided to become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and Paglaum helped her business to have additional capital. She deeply wishes that her business will flourish and that they can taste a good life ahead.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her grocery store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of Garang, Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Elena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo started her own clothing business selling clothes two years ago. She is a 24-year-old woman, married, and she cares for three dependents. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzanian shillings. Pendo is a member of the Tushikamane borrower group, In kihesa,Morogoro.

This is Pendo's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 150,000 in order to buy more clothes for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Pendo hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
la sra. Luz Idalia V. tiene 34 años de edad, viven en union libre con el sr. Pompilio Ayala.
su compañero de hogar se dedica al oficio de la fotografia y Luz V. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas.
tienen tres hijos y todos estudian. 
ademas de producir tortillas tambien vende charamuscas y paletas. como la zona donde ellos viven es muy caliente por eso se venden mucho estos helados.
ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas maiz, leña, cal y agua ya que el maiz y la leña estan subiendo de precio. todo lo quiere comprar al por mayor asi le saca mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz Idalia V. is 34 years old and lives with Pompilio Ayala, her common law partner, who is a photographer. Luz makes and sells tortillas. They have three children who are students. Besides the manufacture and sale of tortillas she also sells candy and popsicles since the area in which they live is very hot and these cold snacks are very popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more corn, fire wood, lye and water because both the corn and fire wood have been increasing in price and she would like to buy everything wholesale so that her profits will be greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, fire wood, lye, water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de batterie chargeur

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma P. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling both food and bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond E. is a fisherman. He is a a young father, 26 years old, who does the best he can to be able to provide his family with enough food, clothes and basic needs. He dreams of having a decent house; he also dreams that all his children will grow healthy and respectful just like his parents taught him when he was still a child.

Raymond requested a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fishing equipement to use. Currently, he is repairing an old net but, through the small loan, he will be able to buy a new one. He will also use some of the loan to buy fish from other fishermen to resell. Fishing is a very good business. If his loan is approved, he could start immediately selling fish to the nearby towns and villages.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment and fish to resell

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: El joven Gustavo es originario de la comunidad de Chotacaj su principal fuente de ingreso lo obtiene como receptor pagador del banco BANRURAL  viene trabjando hace tres años hoy necesita el apoyo de la institucion ASDIR en un credito que sera invertido para culminar sus estudios universitarios, para poder tener mayor acceso ser competivo en el mercado academico
texts.en:
Young Gustavo is originally from the community of Chotacaj. His main source of income is from his job as a bank teller at BANRURAL. He has been working for three years and now needs assistance from Asociación ASDIR. This loan will help Gustavo complete his university studies, which will help him become competitive in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University expenses

loans.name: Dania Antonieta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Dania O. se dedica a laborar arduamente con el único propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos. Ella es madre soltera y por esta razón tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a sus pequeños y brindarle los estudios para su desarrollo intelectual.

Ella actualmente solicita un crédito para buscar la manera de cómo abastecer las necesidades de su hogar y cancelar algunas deudas para continuar llevando el sustento a sus pequeños hijos y brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Dania O. dedicates herself to working hard with her only goal being to provide for her household, consisting of her two small children. Dania is a single mother, so she has the responsibility of caring for the kids and providing for their intellectual development. She is requesting the loan as a way of supplying her home with necessities and to pay off some debts so she can continue providing for her young ones and have living conditions that contribute to their development.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide for family's well-being

loans.name: Ruth Belina

texts.es: La señora Ruth L. vende comida y fritanga desde hace seis año, negocio que inicio con la necesidad  de apoyar a sus tres hijos ya que como muchas madre soltera. Vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene 46 años de edad, su deseo es poder dar el apoyo a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan trabajar en mejores condiciones. Donde pone su venta no tiene techo y desea compra zinc y perlines para poder dar un mejor servicio como mejor presentación a sus clientes. Ya que en tiempo de invierno sus ventas son bajas por que se moja y su comida no la saca a fuera lo cual es muy preocupante para ella ya que tiene que pagar los gastos básicos de agua, luz, la alimentación. Es  por eso pondrá un techo de zinc para poder vender en todo tiempo y poder sastifacer las necesidades personales como poder cumplir con el pago mensual del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth has been selling prepared meals and fried snacks for six years. She started this business because she needed to support her three children as a single mother. Ruth is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Norte. Two of her wishes are to provide for her children’s education and have better working conditions. Currently the area of her home where she sells her products does not have a roof. She wants to buy sheets of zinc and metal crossbeams so that her business is more presentable to her customers, and thereby allows her to provide better service.

Sales are lower during the winter because of the rainy season. Ruth has no other place to conduct business and she is worried because she still has to pay her water, electricity, and food bills. Installing a roof will enable her to continue selling food throughout the year so that she can generate income to cover both her personal necessities and her monthly loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a roof over her business

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren T. runs a sari-sari (variety retail store). He is 54 years old, married and has seven grown-up children. He is from the village of Purok 4, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. Efren has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Efren joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Efren has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Efren is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of his family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is married and has four children. He has received senior high education.  Daniel sells soft drinks and fresh fish at Bantuma near Elmina in Cape Coast, which he has been doing since 2002. His wife is a hairdresser.  Daniel uses his income to help his wife in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Daniel will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks and fresh fish for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Daniel plans to save to complete his building.

loans.use: purchase more soft drinks and fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila B. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has three children. She raises and feeds animals with the goal of later selling them. This work creates feelings of satisfaction in her because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes feeding the animals and supplying them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and now she guides them into the field each day for feeding. Rahila makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable children.  Rahila is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more calves. Please support this hardworking woman who has dedicated her life to her children.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es una madre de familia de 42 años, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ambos están a su cargo. Desde hace 3 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de cosméticos, funcionando de la manera ambulante, ella atiende personalmente su negocio y siempre ha contado con el apoyo familiar. Ella tiene varios financiamientos y todos han sido destinados para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pinturas de uñas, lápiz labial, polvos, cremas y mascarilla. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica ya que en estos tiempos es muy difícil porque hay mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Carolina is a 42 year-old mother of two children who live with her. She has been selling cosmetics for three years and has always counted with her family’s support. She has received multiple loans and they have all gone towards improving her business. She is now requesting this loan to buy cosmetics such as, nail polish, lipstick, powders, creams and mascaras. Her wish is to continue to grow her business since nowadays it is more difficult due to increased competition.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Olailong B Ayuru Hellen Group

texts.en: A. Hellen is the group representative. She is 48 years old and married with eight children. All her children go to school. She looks after two dependants too. She has been dealing in the produce business for over 20 years. She is using the loan to purchase produce like beans, simsim (sesame seeds), maize, peas, and so forth. She is a hardworking woman who wishes to expand her business and educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase produce like beans, simsim, maize, peas, and so forth.

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es:
La señora Zoila María es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 60 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos independientes de 27, 28, 30 y 32 años, se dedica a la venta diaria de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace mas de 20 años, también se dedica a la guardianía de carretas de personas que comercializan de forma ambulante en los alrededores de un mercado grande de la zona c de Huaycán.
Zoila nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de pago de servicios, alimentos.
El gran sueño de Zoila es implementar y asegurar su vivienda.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para comprar puertas para su vivienda. 
Zoila agradece toda la ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante por eso es responsable con sus créditos, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Zoila María is an enterprising woman. She is 60 years old and married, and has four grown children who are 27, 28, 30 and 32 years old. She has worked selling beauty products via catalog for more than 20 years. She also stores carts for street vendors on the outskirts of a large market in the area called "Zona C" in Huaycán, Perú. Zoila tells us that her previous loans have been a great help, as she has been able to improve her home. Her earnings cover the cost of utilities and food. Zoila's great dream is to further work on and secure her house. This loan will be invested in buying doors for the home. Zoila thanks everyone who has lent to her because thanks to this help she has been able to get ahead in life. For this reason she is responsible about repaying her loans. She has grown and continues to grow with her family and as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for her home.

loans.name: Copacabana Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Copacabana” esta representado por la señora Noemi y conformado por 10 miembros todas mujeres residentes D. la misma zona. La presidenta se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos en la esquina D. la casa D. su primo, es casada tiene un hijo recién nacido y resiD. en la casa D. su primo hermano, su esposo se dedica al manejo D. un mini bus D. pasajeros, juntos tratan D. ahorrar para poder tener un lote y poder darle a su hijo un futuro mejor, es por esta razón que requiere el préstamo que servirá para agrandar su puesto D. venta y mejorar sus ingresos. El resto del grupo tiene diferentes actividades la mayoría se dedica a la venta D. comida pero también a la venta D. cosméticos, frazadas, camisas y tarjetas. El grupo tiene experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan ya que por este motivo son conocidos por sus clientes en cuanto a la  competencia es granD.  pero la gente del grupo pone toda su voluntad y entusiasmo para salir adelante y cumplir con sus obligaciones. El crédito Será destinado a incrementar su capital D. operación y a la compra D. materiales e insumos para sus negocios.  Este grupo es nuevo pero tienen experiencia crediticia porque ya trabajaron en diferentes instituciones  y conocen la metodología D. banca comunal.
texts.en:
The “Copacabana” communal bank is represented by Noemi and is maD. up of 10 members, all of whom are women, residents of the same aR.. Noemi sells prepared food and beverages at her cousin’s house’s corner. She is married and has a newborn son. She lives in her cousin’s house and her husband is a mini-bus driver. Together they are trying to save up to buy a lot so that they can proviD. their son with a better future. This is the reason behind this loan request: to enlarge her food stand and improve her income. The rest of the group members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: most sell food, but some sell cosmetics, blankets, shirts and cards. The group has experience in their various fields and is well-known to their customers. Although competition is intense, the members of the group exert all their efforts and enthusiasm in order to get ahead and meet their obligations. The funds will be used to increase their operational capital and to buy ingredients and materials for their businesses. The group is newly formed but they have credit history because they have worked with other institutions in the past and know how communal banks operate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Tamalika

texts.en:
Tamalika F. is 30 and married with 1 child (1 year-old).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Tamalika has 2 years of experience in this business.  Tamalika needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tamalika joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tamalika's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion B. is from the village of  Sawali Fuentes, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Concepcion is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Concepcion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma S., from the town of Surallah, is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, for the past 12 years she has been raising pigs for fattening and sale, earning approximately 8000 PHP a month. In 2010, Thelma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 6000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nariku Ene Tananko

texts.en:
Nariku Ene Tananko B. is 24 Years old. She is married to Kilopei Ole Kipaino and a mother of one child.

Nariku is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members in KADET. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend the thirty thousand to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm. Wheat has proved to be doing well in this area and also the market is readily available in the area to both retail and wholesale buyers.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Nariku's dream is to do large scale farming and to buy a bigger piece of land. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm.

loans.name: Margaret Carmen

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Margaret;  ella tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos independientes, el mayo r esta en la universidad, el segundo en un instituto, el tercero preparándose en la academia para la universidad y el último en sus últimos años de colegio. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista ella vende escabeches en el mercado de San Pedro, el escabeche es un plato frío típico de la costa, a base de pollo y cebollas, con zanahorias y un condimento especial. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos (educación).

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank. Our member lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Cusco province and department. Our member is Margaret. She is 45, married, and has four independent children. The oldest is in the university, the second one is studying in an institution, the third is academically preparing for the university, and the last one is in the last years of high school. Our member alternates her activities between the household and her small business. She sells “escabeche” at the San Pedro market. Escabeche is a fried dish that is typical on the coast. Its base is chicken and onions, and it has carrots and special seasoning. Our member is requesting a loan to pay for her children’s education. She is grateful for and values the support offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's education

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen L. is from the village of Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with seven school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a farming business, primarily selling her own harvested rice in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it. Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Helen is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Kuorn

texts.en: Kuorn S., 43, is a villager living in Battambang Province. She is a local farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. Her husband helps her with the hard physical farming activities. The couple is blessed with three children who currently attend the local public school. Kuorn S. planted different types of vegetables months ago but they are not growing well because they need fertilizer. She has therefore applied for a loan  to purchase many sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.use: to purchase many sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Fransisca Linet Achieng

texts.en:
Fransisca Linet Achieng O. used to be a charcoal vendor before starting her current business of hawking second-hand clothes in 2005. She says due to economic hardship, she had to quit the charcoal business because it wasn’t earning her sufficient income. 

The clothing business has been good for her as from the income earned, she can assist her husband in providing for the family with ease, though she claims that it is not enough. She wants to expand her business and that’s why she has applied for a loan worth 30,000 Kenyan shillings to add more stock and boost the business. This will ensure an increase in her earnings.

She is 20 years old, married and a mother of three children. She lives in Nyamasaria.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 37 years old.  He is married, and has 2 children, aged 15 and 12, both in school. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him because he needs help due to pressure from customers, as sales attendants.  In 2005, Musa established his drinks and provision business. He began his business because he did not go to school, so he started business as to change his life and family history of poverty.  

Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about 1,391,800 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 SLL. Musa requires a loan in order to improve his stock and to increase his wife's business capital. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 347,950 SLL.
