In the future, Musa plans to educate his children all the way through school since he did not go to school.  He also plans to service the remote community with a larger customer base.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Duval Nicolás

texts.es:
Duval Nicolás A. S., tiene 19 años.  Es soltero vive con la hermana,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Duval es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Duval  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es seguir con el trabajo de producción e incrementar al negocio. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte especialmente el fútbol.
texts.en:
Duval Nicolas A. Suarez is 19 years old. He is single and he lives with his sister in the city of Ventanas, of the Los Rios province. He has no children. Duval is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Duval is an agriculturist and he sows corn and cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have a plot of land where to build his own home. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys playing soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Sara Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señorita Sara Esperanza L. es socia del banco comunal Tres Marías, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, en esta comunidad su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y también a la agricultura, mucha de su población buscan en la ciudad una mejor oportunidad de trabajo para mejorar sus situaciones económicas.
 
Doña Sara tiene 43 años y es soltera, vive en  casa de su mamá ya que ella le atiende y le cuida por su  avanzada edad.
 
La Señorita Sara se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la costura y ahora posee su propio taller el cual está ubicado en su domicilio, lleva 16 años en su negocio y fue su hermana la que le enseño esta actividad, también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales como borregos, chanchos y cuyes.
 
Trabaja hace 4 años con los créditos de la banca comunal y ha sido su sobrina y su hermana la que la incentivó a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres  luchadoras, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la reparación de una máquina de su taller y en la compra de animales.
 
Su meta es crecer  en su taller.
texts.en:
Sara Esperanza L. is a member of the Tres Marías communal bank. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca in a communiy also called Tres Marías. Residents of this community are farmers and raise animals. Much of the population seeks employment in the city in hopes of improving their economic situation. Sara is 43 years old and single. She lives in her mother’s house because she is the one charged with caring for her elderly mother. From a very young age Sara has been a seamstress and now has her own workshop in her home. She has had the business for 16 years; her sister taught her these skills. She also farms and raises animals like: lambs, pigs and guinea pigs. She has had loans with the communal bank for 4 years. Her sister and niece encouraged her to join this group of tenacious women. The new loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR grants will be used to repair one of the sewing machines in her workshop and to purchase animals. Her goal is to grow in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a sewing machine and to buy guinea pigs, lambs and pigs.

loans.name: Glenis

texts.en:
In 2006 Glenis I. joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) – a microfinance institution in the Philippines and a KIVA partner. A 41-year-old married mother of two, her eldest is a 17-year-old third year college student and the youngest is a 14-year-old third year high school student. Their primary source of income is her retail store which she established with her loans from ASHI. Her profit from this business helps meet many of their financial needs, especially the school expenses of their children. She is able to supplement her husband’s meager income in providing for their daily needs.

As a member of ASHI and KIVA, Glenis performs her duties and responsibilities with excellence and commitment, the real reason she has been tagged as a model member of the institution. She is now applying for another loan of Php 45,000.00 pesos to buy additional stocks of grocery products, canned goods, sacks of rice and sugar, cases of soft drinks or beverages and packs of cigarettes to accommodate the demands of her customers. More importantly, she wants to earn more so that she can achieve her dreams of having her own grocery stall and continuing to support the studies of her children until they finish college and earn a degree. Glenis believes that with the blessing of God and the support of the people from ASHI and KIVA, she will soon reach her dreams.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery products, sacks of rice and sugar, cases of beverages, packs of cigarettes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. brews a local beer and sells it in retail from her home for a living. She has been in this business for over 10 years and works seven days a week. Her primary business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. Mary lives in Kamwokya Kifumbira, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are in school.

Mary has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of millet flour, cassava flour, and maize bran.  She also generates additional income through hair plaiting. Her business goal is to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

Mary and her family live in a rented home and have access to electricity, although they do not have access to piped water. Mary's major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet flour, cassava flour, and maize bran for her brewing business

loans.name: Hiram Ndungu

texts.en:
Hiram is 32 years old and married to Lucy Wairumu. They have one child of three years. He has a retail shop that he has been running for a period of about three years with a profit of approximately 14,800 Kenyan shillings per month.

He intends to use the loan to restock his shop with maize flour, sugar, soaps, detergent, sodas and tea leaves. He has never borrowed from another MFI (microfinance institution) and this is his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He has been successfully repaying the previous ones. 

He hopes to expand his business and buy a piece of land to develop in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock of maize flour, sugar, soaps, detergent, sodas and tea leaves

loans.name: Douglas Isaac

texts.es: Douglas Isaac V. B. de 28 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable, el cual vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo a elaborar tortillas. Él es un joven muy emprendedor, quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Douglas solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: bebidas, pan, golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, pan, cereales y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de Douglas es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten sostener a su hogar.
texts.en: Douglas Isaac V. B. is 28 years old.  He is a very responsible man who lives together with his wife who takes care of the housework and also makes tortillas.  He is a very enterprising young man who owns his own business.  His business is a store in which he sells perishables and convenience store items.  His business is located in his house.  Douglas is requesting a loan so that he can buy more products such as: drinks, bread, candies, disinfectants, detergents, cereals and other products which are popular with his customers.  Douglas' biggest wish is to be able to improve his sales as they enable him to support his household.

loans.use: To stock  his business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca R. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 62 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. To earn a living, Francisca raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. Francisca also uses a part of their land to plant vegetables that she sells to the market.

Francisca needs additional piglets, feed and farm supplies. She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP which she will use for the pigs and farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 68 years old and married with four children who are between fourteen and twenty years old. All of her children currently go to school. Esperance’s husband works as a driver. 

For the past six years, Esperance has been selling CDs and DVDs. She will use her loan to expand her business and buy additional stock. In the future, Esperance dreams of setting up a studio.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El sr. Alberto vive en la zona del plan 3000, es casa propia, es casado y  desde hace unos 2 años, el se dedica al transporte publico hace 20 años, en su casa tiene una venta de abarrotes la cual es atendida por su esposa, el crédito que esta solicitando es para construir un cuarto ya que el que tienen es de madera y  solicito el crédito para la compra de material de construcción. El sr. Alberto es cliente antiguo de la institución y ha demostrado buen comportamiento de pago. El es muy trabajador y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Alberto and his wife live in a house they own in the Plan 3000 neighborhood.  He has operated a taxi business for 20 years.  His wife manages a corner shop that they have set up in a room at their house.  Alberto is applying for a loan to add a room to the house.  He needs the loan to buy lumber and other construction materials.  Alberto is a long-standing customer of the bank and he has a good record of repaying his loans.  He works hard and has his wife's support. He is grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: Buy construction materials for improvements to house.

loans.name: Munhbayasgalan

texts.en: Munhbayasgalan K. is a 38 year old and lives with her husband and two children in Harhorin of Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house and fence. Her two children both attend university while her husband works for the local mining company. Munhbayasgalan operates a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of food products such as ice cream, meat, dairy product and other in her own small shop next to her home. She started her food trading business in 1997 after building her small shop in her fence. Almost 13 years of owing this business, she was able to establish a stable business in her local community and her earnings have enabled her to buy a mini truck for her business. For the future, she plans to start operating PC game center to supplement her earnings. With her business profits, she has paid her children's tuition fees. Munhbayasgalan is a clever and hardworking person and is requesting  a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase computers and other equipments in order to open PC game center in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase computers and other equipments

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina S., 48, believes that being part of CCT* as a Community Partner is a blessing. Fedelina has no college background; nevertheless, she is able to put up a business of her own. She is married to Pedro, a foreman, and they have five children. One of them now works for a living.

A residential ready-to-wear (RTW) business is what Fedelina works on for more than five years now. She buys quality shirts, bags, pants, and shoes, and sells them to business acquaintances and neighbors. But aside from that, she also focuses on her piggery. She raises piglets and makes sure they grow healthy to produce good pork products. Monthly, she earns around Php 11,000 from these two businesses.

To help Fedelina continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a Php 16,000.  She plans to use this loan to buy hog feeds and other materials needed to sustain her piggery even as the piglets are still being raised.  She also plans to use this loan in buying quality Ready-to-Wear products which will suit the tastes of her regular customers.

Frustrations never cease to exist even in the life of Fedelina, but she chooses to focus on her goal rather than on the obstacles. She dreams of seeing her businesses grow and eventually expand. More than anything else, she wants to see her children finish schooling and be a blessing not just to her, but to the entire community.
 	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: hog feeds and quality ready-to-wear items usually ordered by her customers

loans.name: Barangirana

texts.en:
Barangirana J. is an individual client from Kyenjojo. She is 46 years old and is married.  She has 6 children, aged 22 years to 6 months. 

J. poses in the photo with her husband with whom they work together. 

J. is a peasant farmer dealing in the growing of fresh foods from her home for over 6 years.  She is able to make 400,000 UGX in monthly profit. Previously, she was just a farmer selling to traders, but now she sells the produce herself. 

J. is a dedicated farmer and has bought her land through the increased profits she made.  She wants to get a loan to help improve her agricultural production by buying manure and applying better farming techniques.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve agricultural production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell clothing

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 28, is a married mother of two children ages 6 and 10 years who both attend school.  She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces milk, maize and eggs which are all sold locally.  She also owns a motorbike for transport services.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming.  She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to improve her family's livelihood.  In the future, she would like to increase the number of her chickens and also venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to start a new business

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y  reside junto a su hermano en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual vende a sus vecinos de su zona.  Además brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. 

José desea comprar más ropa para posteriormente venderla y, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old, single, and he lives with his brother in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural zone located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital region of Lambayeque. 

He sells clothing to his neighbors in the region. He also provides transport services to passengers on his motorcycle rickshaw. It is a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and a cabin used to transport passengers inside. 

Jose wishes to purchase more clothing for later resale and in order to meet his objective he has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosa  Kelly

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Medianía ubicado a 10km del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores los cuales alimenta y cuando alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece a la venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, esta actividad la realiza hace 7 años, adicionalmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora. Ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales lo que permitirá obtener mayores ingresos, asi tambien desea adquirir insumos para elaborar esta bebida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Rosa is 25, married and lives with her family in Medianía which is 10km from Mórrope, in an agribultural district of Lambayeque, over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo  Rosa raises domestic animals for sale to neighbors and local residents.  She has been engaged in this business for the last 7 years, and also sells chicha, making this drink at home and selling it to local clients. This small business allows her to meet everyday expenses for her family.  Rosa wishes to grow her business and is seeking credit in the amount of 1,000.00 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to meet her objective.

loans.use: to buy domestic animals

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ynes; ella tiene 62 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. hortalizas y frutas, la socia también tiene un terreno donD. cultiva frutas como manzanas, naranjas, mandarinas y entre otras frutas y también siembra zanahorias, cebollas y lechugas y luego los venD. en el mercado D. Urubamba, ella venD. en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. frutas y hortalizas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la tierra D. cultivo.                           
       
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Ynes is a member of the San Isidro D. Yanahura 5th Paradero Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Ynes, age 62, is in a common-law marriage and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling fruits and vegetables.  She also has land where she grows fruits like apples, oranges, mandarins, and other fruits.  She also grows carrots, onions, and lettuce.  She later sells them at the Urubamba market in an itinerant manner.

She wishes to expand her business of selling fruits and vegetables.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her fields.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her fields.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Bless” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ya Mabinty. Ya Mabinty is age 50. She was born in Makeni city, where she is currently residing with her husband. Her husband is a businessman and her 3 children are all adults. For many years now, Ya Mabinty has been selling “Africana soap”, and she will use her share of this loan to buy soap-making materials in order to produce more Africana soap for sale.

loans.use: to buy soap making materials in order to produce more Africana soap for sale

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: Raymundo tiene 28 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, convive con Raquel de 20 años y juntos residen en su propia casa con su querida hija Mariana de 02 años de edad a quien desean brindarle un mejor porvenir. La labor que realiza Raymundo es labrar la tierra, él posee 03 hectáreas de terreno, ahí cultiva cacao, café, achiote y palillo. Cuando era niño, sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra y a la edad de 20 años compró su propia parcela, desde entonces trabajando en ellas. Cuando es temporada de limpiar sus campos y sacar la maleza necesita de jornaleros, asimismo cuando es temporada de cosecha. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son productivas, logrando obtener ganancias. Sin embargo cuando es invierno no es de su agrado porque son épocas donde abunda mayor cantidad de precipitaciones de lluvia, estropeando los brotes de sus plantas. Por tal pide de su apoyo para que pueda intensificarse en esta actividad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP; esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono y semillas de árboles maderables, como: Caoba, Tornillo y Cedro, para así mejorar sus tierras y con los árboles maderables contribuir con la naturaleza por que los árboles nos dan vida; es el lema que emplea al sembrar árboles.
texts.en:
Raymundo, 28, is from the city of Quimbiri. He lives with Raquel, 20, in their own home with their darling daughter Mariana, 2, who they want to give a better future. Raymundo works the land. He has 3 hectares of land where he grows cacao, coffee, annatto, and palillo [similar to a guava tree]. When he was young, his parents taught him to turn over the land and at age 20 he bought his first parcel of land, which he has worked on since. He hires day laborers when it's time to clean his fields and get rid of the brush and also for the harvest. He feels very committed to his work, because thanks to his efforts today he enjoys seeing that his plants are productive and he is earning money. However he doesn't like the winter because there are periods with a great deal of rain, which ruins his plant shoots. 

For this reason he asks for your help so that he can intensify his work This is his fifth loan with MFP. He is ready to make all of his payments punctually, because he wants to access another loan in the future. He is a very participatory member of his village bank. With the loan he requested he will buy sacks of manure and seeds for hardwood trees like mahogany, tornillo [screwbean mesquite] and cedar so that he can improve his lands. The hardwood trees will also contribute to nature because they give us life; that's the motto that he uses when planting trees.

loans.use: to buy sacks of compost and mahogany, cedar and screwbean mesquite seeds.

loans.name: María Blanca

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector vía a Paccha, este lugar está rodeado de naturaleza, su gente es muy amable y cordial, en su mayoría se dedican a la cría de animales y agricultura, también muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Doña María tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 31, 28, 22, 19 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija es soltera, trabaja y le ayuda economícamente, su segundo hijo es casado e  independiente, su tercer y cuarto hijo estudian en la universidad y su ultimo hijo en el colegio. Su esposo labora en el extranjero, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora María se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
   
Está reingresando al banco comunal ya que pertenecía ha otro banco comunal hace un tiempo atrás, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa interior para incrementar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es construir su casa y realizar un criadero de pollos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Génesis community bank and lives in Vía a Paccha sector.  This is a place which is surrounded by nature.  The people are very kind and friendly and most of them work raising animals and farming crops.  Many also work in the city of Cuenca.

María is 48 years old, married, and has five children aged 31, 28, 22, 19 and 16.  Her eldest child (a daughter) is single.  She works and helps María financially.  Her second child (a son) is married and lives independently, her third and fourth children are studying at university and her youngest son is in high school.  Her husband works abroad.  They do not own their own home but rent instead.

María's business is selling underwear.  She has been in this business for five years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday but doesn't work fixed hours.

María is re-joining the community bank as she used to belong to another community bank some time ago.  She will invest her loan money in buying underwear to increase her merchandise.

María's goal is to build her home and set up a poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Kuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuong is a rice farmer from Kompong Cham province, who has ten years experience in the crop-growing business. Currently, she plants rice crops and a few kinds of vegetables on her farmland. She earns around $1.50 a profit a day. In addition, Mrs. Kuong owns a wooden kiosk in front of her house and sells a few items, for instance: foods, soft drinks, cooking ingredients and other goods. Mrs. Kuong’s husband has worked in the public sector since 2000 as a chief villager, and he earns a specific salary monthly. 

As the rainy season is coming now, Mrs. Kuong has requested a loan to plant peanuts and buy additional items for resale. She hopes she can enlarge her mixed goods-selling business and rebuild her house to make it bigger than it is at the present time. She dreams of her children getting degrees.

loans.use: to plant peanuts and buy additional items for resale.

loans.name: Valentine Group

texts.en:
Albert, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been selling second hand clothes for one year now. He works from 7am to 6pm daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more clothes for resale. His dream is to one day build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Valentine" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rodnie

texts.en: Rodnie is a 22-year-old married man residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He has two school-aged children with him. He has been vending barbecue for five years to earn a living. He earns a total of PHP 7,000 monthly from this activity. Rodnie has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase supplies needed for his barbecue vending business. He has been a member of GDMPC for four years already. He hopes to have an accessible food stall in the town market to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase supplies needed for barbecue vending.

loans.name: Maria Felisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Felisa es casada, tiene 60 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica al comercio a la atención de una tienda en general, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia, y lleva 15 años de experiencia con la tienda que está a su cargo.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su tienda y comprar más productos, va a comprar, aguas gaseosas, jugos, fideos, aguas enlatadas, dulces, galletas, etc. En el futuro espera que se negocio crezca por medio del préstamo que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Felisa is 60 years old, married, has two children, and did not have the opportunity to study. She manages a general store. Maria started this business through her own initiative and has 15 years of experience managing her store.

She is requesting a loan so that she can expand her store and buy more products. She plans to buy water, sodas, juices, noodles, canned goods, sweets, candies, and other items. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow by utilizing this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Denes

texts.en:
Denes is 38 years old and is married. He is the father of 4 school-aged children. The family lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. It was just a year ago that Denes started growing and propagating decorative goldfish and other fish at his home for sale. The fish are grouped according to size and similarity. Many people come and visit his place to see and buy earning him a total of PHP 8,000 a month. 
To avail himself of financial services and momentarily ease his financial difficulties, Denes joined GDMPC earlier this year. He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from the cooperative to purchase an aquarium for selling cultured fish. He will buy more fish variants when he gets enough funds and aquariums to display them properly and attract more buyers.

loans.use: To purchase an aquarium to sell cultured goldfish and other decorative fish.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old and has three children. Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Norma has borrowed and paid three prior loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for a year, and she also earns an income from selling fish. Norma hopes to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sanavar's Group

texts.en:
Sanavar is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and a son. The older daughter is married, the second daughter studies at Kyrgyz National University and the son is at school. Sanavar works as a cook at a school; she earns additional money by selling stationery and confectionery. 

She started this business five years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms and in this way she earns an additional 4000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Sanavar wants to increase the assortment of goods she sells. She wants to purchase more confectionery to sell. In the future she wishes to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase confectionery.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 32 ans, il est  marié à une revendeuse. 
Koffi est un revendeur depuis 2001, il achète et revend des meubles à ses clients composés de toutes personnes. Koffi a 3 employés pour l’aider dans son activité. Il sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des fauteuils bourrés et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Koffi, age 32, is married to a reseller. He's been a reseller himself since 2001. He buys and sells furniture to a very wide clientele.

Koffi has three employees to help him with his business. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy padded furniture and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy padded furniture

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
This is Lennie, 46, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Geraldo, a tricycle driver, and is the mother of three children. By the grace of God, Lennie has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Lennie oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. Lennie earns a living through the daily quota that her husband remits each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Lennie also offers direct selling products for added income. She earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lennie dreams of being able to buy another tricycle soon and of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 42 years old. He is married and has 6 children. Billy has a stall that sells fish. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy fish.  Billy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Billy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like fish net, for fishing

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia tiene 32 años de edad y está casada con el señor miguel quien es campesino, con el cual tiene 4 hijos, Arturo, amairani, Luís y José ángel de los cuales solo 3 estudian, 2 están cursando el primer y segundo año de secundaria, otro esta en quinto año de primaria, ya que el mas pequeño apenas va a cumplir 3 años de edad, ella se dedica ala venta de antojitos mexicanos, desde hace mas de 4 años.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que trabajaba demasiado en el campo y no gana lo suficiente para tener una buena solvencia económica, también para continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, y puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos como son: jitomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, aceite, sal, quesos, crema, carne, pollos y leña, para continuar con su negocio.
Una de las metas que tiene doña ofe (como la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio, es la de hacerla crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante construir un local, para poner su comedor, comprar sillas y mesas y tener una mejor producción, ya que así mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los prestatarios de kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le servirá de mucho, puesto que ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 32 years old and married to Miguel who is a farmer; they have four children: Arturo, Amairani, Luis and José Àngel.  Three of them are in school, two in first and second year of secondary school and the third is in fifth grade of elementary school while the youngest is about to turn three years of age.  

Ofelia has bee working selling Mexican fast food snacks for over four years.  She says that she decided to invest in this activity because she wants to help her husband with household expenses because he works very hard in the fields and does not earn enough to have good economic solvency and also to continue helping with her children’s schooling so that they can have good professional careers.

The loan she received will be used to buy ingredients like: tomatoes, chilies, onions, potatoes, oil, salt, cheese, cream, meat, chickens and firewood to continue with her business.

One of Doña Ofe’s (as she’s known in her community) goals is to make the business grow very much because she’s planning to build a locale later on to install her eatery there.  She will buy tables and chairs and increase production because her income will improve and increase that way.

She thanks Fundación Realidad and Kiva for all the support and trust they’ve given her because it will be very beneficial for her because now she’ll be able to continue investing in her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilies, onions, potatoes, oil, salt, cheese, cream, meat, chickens and firewood.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur de taxi moto. Elle a 1 enfant.  
Massan travaille comme vendeuse de produits alimentaires depuis 1990. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation pour tous clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. 
Massan a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits à revendre. Elll veut renforcer son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Massan voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Massan is a 48-year-old woman. She is married to a driver of a motorcycle taxi. She has one child. 

Massan has been selling groceries since 1990. She sells groceries to a variety of clients in a local market. She buys the groceries in Lomé. She works alone.

Massan has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy groceries to resell. She wants to strengthen her business.

In the coming years, Massan would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries.

loans.name: Edwin Rolando

texts.es:
Edwin vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
Edwin, es un hombre soltero de  28 años de edad,  el  se dedica al servicio de construcción como maestro de obras, eligio este oficio ya que su Padre se dedicaba a lo mismo.
Edwin es un hombre eficiente, responsable y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, Edwin empezó en el negocio desde el año 2005, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/450 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo invertirá para el mejoramiento de la vivienda de sus padres ( construcción de cuartos). El desafió de el es en el mes de febrero y marzo por lo que no hay muchas obras. El  sueño de Edwin es seguir creciendo en su negocio y compararse un terreno para la construcción de su propia casa, ya que por el momento vive en la casa de sus padres, el señor Edwin esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando. su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Edwin lives and works in Camaná, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú.  However, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. The  upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to set up their own micro-business, like the one this client is running today.

Edwin is a 28-year-old single man.  He works in the building trade as a master builder.  He chose this trade as his father used to do the same thing.

Edwin is an efficient, responsible and very hard-working man who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  He started out in his business in 2005.  He earns, on average, 450 soles a day.  With this loan for 2,000 soles, that he will receive thanks to Kiva, he will invest in improving his parents' home (building rooms).  The challenge Edwin faces is that in the months of February of March there are not many building projects to work on.  Edwin's dream is to continue growing in his business and to buy a plot of land on which he can build his own home as he currently lives in his parents' home.  Edwin is very grateful for the opportunity that he is being given.  His loan officer believes him to be a good client who will make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to improve his parents' home, building rooms

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 46 years old, and she has two children. In addition to growing rice, she sells fruit in the market and breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. 

Lan has participated in SEDA since 2008. She previously borrowed 8,288,000 VND, which she repaid punctually. She would now like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 36 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 16, 6 y 3 años, ellos dependen de ella y su pareja para poder tener una buena educación y alimentación. Hbaitan en una casa propia en donde a diario trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. EL trabajo de Dina consiste en la venta de abarrotes, tiene una tienda en donde ofrece de todo un poco a sus clientes que van en busca de un buen trato y precio cómodo. Tiene su local condicionado en su casa y trabaja ahí desde hace tres años, durante todo este tiempo aprendió mucho del negocio que al principio no sabia nada, ya que nunca antes había trabajado en esta actividad. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede disponer de tiempo además de poder generar ingresos a su hogar sin tener que salir de su casa. Antes de iniciar con este trabajo ella dependía de los ingresos que generaba su conviviente, sin embargo ahora ella puede generar un ingreso extra y aportar así en la economía de su hogar. Tiene muchos planes y objetivos, pero por el momento solo desea poder implementar con algunas cosas que necesita su negocio. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá una poyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte ella se compromete en  pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mercadería y abarrotes, ya que implementará  mejor su tienda con mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Dina, 36, is a good, kind and hardworking woman.  She lives with her spouse and their four children who are 19, 16, 6 and 3 years old and still dependent on her and her spouse to have food and a good education.  They live in their own house where she works daily to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life. 

Dina’s work consists in selling groceries.  She has a store where she stocks a little of everything for her customers who come by seeking good service and affordable prices.  She has a space at home set up for this and she’s been in operation three years.  During all this time she’s learned quite a bit because when she started out she didn’t know anything because she’d never worked at this type of activity before.  She enjoys her work very much because she can manage her own time and also generate income for her home without having to leave home.  Before starting this business she depended on her spouse’s income but now she can earn extra income and contribute to her household’s economy.  She has many plans and objectives but for the moment all she wants to do is stock up on some things the store needs.

This will be MFP loan #3.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel surer about advancing with her business this way.  On her part she commits to make her payments punctually like she did with previous loans.  Besides, she’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because they are all very responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy merchandise and groceries to better stock her store with a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria's Group is comprised of 2 hard-working women.  Maria is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Maria has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair braids,  and will help Maria generate greater profits and take care of her family. Maria hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Maria's future prospects by helping her to learn to handle her customers.

loans.use: to buy hair braids for her salon

loans.name: Ganesa Jaya Group

texts.en:
Masripah is a mother of four children aged 22, 16, 10 and 4, two of whom are still at school. She has run a grocery store in her home for five years. She sells sugar, oil, rice, eggs and children's snacks in her store. Her business is running smoothly and she is able to contribute to the family income and help her husband, who is an employee, provide food for the family and pay school fees. 
Now Masripah wants to increase the volume of rice in her store. For this reason she is requesting her first loan with Kiva partner, VisionFund Indonesia. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and be an agent. 
The other group members sell nasi uduk (an Indonesian dish), coffee, cosmetics and snacks.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Jeaneth

texts.es:
Evelyn, vive con su esposo y tienen un hijo de 18 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio, vendiendo frutas frescas, con este negocio Evelyn ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos familiares, además que es un ingreso que tambien le ayuda a mantenerse por sí sola.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de banabas, fresas, manzanas, zapotes, papayas, para mantener en el negocio, esta compra la realizara con la intención de mejorar su negocio y que los clientes encuentren en ella los frutos de calidad.
La aspiración de Evelyn es trabajar con su esposo, ahorrar y poderse comprar un lugar donde construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Evelyn lives with her husband. They have a son who is 18 years old. She is in business, selling fresh fruit. With this business, Evelyn helps her husband cover the family's expenses. It is also a source of income that helps her support herself through her own work.

Currently she is asking for a loan to purchase bananas, strawberries, apples, zapotes, and papayas in order to maintain her business. She will make this purchase with the intention of improving her business so that her customers will find her with quality fruit.

Evelyn's aspiration is to work with her husband, to save, and to be able to buy a property where they can build their own house.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, berries, apples, zapotes, and papayas

loans.name: Rob's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Rob is a 56-year-old mother of two children. She has been farming rice and selling grocery items for 10 years. To supplement the income, her husband has been working as paid worker in the village. She and her husband can earn daily income of approximately 70,000KHR and is able to save about KHR25,000 each day for the future needs. 
This is the sixth loan for Rob with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used the past loan from VisionFund to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. She is now leading her group to applying for another loan. Rob wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José es un hombre de 48 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 18 y 20 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyado en su negocio de venta de hojas de huerta actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años. José desea cambiar el techo de toda su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado lo que causa que sus pocas pertenencias se deterioren, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos, madera y alambre para cambiar el techo de toda su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: José, 48, lives in a house of his own with his wife and their two daughters, aged 18 and 20. He spares no effort to support his family. His has been selling leaf vegetables for a living for the last ten years. José wants to give the roof of his house a complete overhaul as soon as possible, since it is in a state of disrepair and the leaks are destroying what few possessions he has. He thus asks FUSAI for a loan in order to buy the materials he needs, namely: galvanised steel sheets, nails, wood, and wire.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to give his roof a complete overhaul.

loans.name: Iktimal

texts.en: Iktimal is a 33 year old Lebanese married woman of three school aged children. Her husband represents the main income provider in his family, he works in the meat market sector. His income is barely sufficient. That’s why currently, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children school fees. She insist that she will be a permanent customer as her only goal is to guarantee an excellent educational path for them in a friendly environment.

loans.use: to pay her children school fees.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: My little market is one of the biggest and luckiest in my whole community.  I sell personal-care products and school supplies for children among other Ã­tems.  I have been in business for 13 years, and I have been able to grow my store little by little each time I sell a little more.  Since school is starting, I need to invest in inventory of school supplies like notebooks, pens, and other things.

loans.use: To invest in inventory such as toys for children, school supplies, snacks, and personal-care products.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en:
Hello. My name is Arcenia, and I am a storekeeper. I do business from home selling clothes and shoes. I have been doing this for many years. My work as a traveling salesperson helps me earn money in order to fulfill my obligations and cover household expenses, considering I am a single mother with one son.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Arcenia, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio en mi casa de habitación de venta de ropa y calzado, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que realizo de manera ambulante y me genera ingresos para cumplir mis compromisos y cubrir mis gastos familiares, tomando en cuenta que soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pants, socks, shirts, and other items

loans.name: Omonigho

texts.en: Mrs. Omonigho E. is 25 years old. She obtained training as a nurse in a notable school of nursing in Nigeria. According to Omonigho herself, LAPO came to her aid in 2005 when she was in need of money to open up a medical store. If given a loan of US$400, she will further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Talib

texts.en: Talib X. owns and operates a tea house in the town of Khachmaz, which is located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Talib is looking for funding so that he can purchase more chairs for his tea house. He knows that people aren’t going to frequent his establishment if they can’t sit down to enjoy their tea.

loans.use: To purchase chairs for his tea house.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S. is a 63 year old diligent mother of 3 children. She works selling porridge and pork rice to the people in her community. She has to get up very early each morning to cook the porridge and rice. She typically earns about $5 each day. S.'s husband is a village chef and also earns roughly $5 /day. All 3 of their children are employed at a garment factory.

Mrs. S. is requesting a $300 loan to purchase more equipment and some utensils for her business.

loans.use: To invest in more equipment and some utensils.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Señor Eduardo F. owns his home located in 8 de Diciembre in the west part of the city of La Paz. He lives there with his wife and three children. Eduardo works as a welder repairing vehichles that have been in accidents. His wife works as a maid in a private residence.

They currently live in a small room on the land they own which is very small and they use as a bedroom/kitchen/dining room. They built it with the small amount of savings they had and they could only afford to buy construction material such as bricks and cement in small quantities to built a small room.

They will use the loan to build another room which will help this family live in better conditions. This is their fist time soliciting a loan and their credit background makes them good candidates.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eduardo F. vive en casa propia en la zona de 8 de Diciembre ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Eduardo trabaja como chapista realizando reparaciones y reconstrucciones de vehículos chocados. Y su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica en un domicilio particular. Actualmente ocupan una habitación en el terreno que tienen, la cual funciona como dormitorio cocina y comedor al mismo tiempo ya que con sus Ahorros pudieron solamente construir la estructura y muros de ladrillo en una habitación nueva. El crédito solicitado será destinado al techado y la construcción en obra fina de la nueva habitación que mejorará las condiciones de vida de la familia. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is very talented when it comes to knitting, and every day she creates beautiful pieces. She began knitting when she was ten years old, because her brothers noticed her talent and pushed her to try to sell her pieces. With practice, she has improved a lot and can now make her garments much more quickly. Her skill and talent have enabled her to get through times of economic difficulty that her family has suffered on many occasions, when their income was not enough to cover the costs of 4 children and their education.

Juana's husband is a bricklayer, and often times his work is seasonal. For this reason, Juana sometimes sells her garments in front of schools and cinemas around the city. She also has plans to build a chicken coop and acquire more chickens to sell. Right now they keep chickens in the house, using them for their own consumption. She hopes to achieve her goals and is requesting a loan to invest in more wool, as well as a number of chickens for the coop she'd like to build. She appreciates your support.

El arte de tejer se materializa finamente en las manos de Juana, quién cada día con dedicación elabora bellos trabajos de tejido a crochet; ella viene tejiendo desde hace diez años porque sus hermanos al observar su talento la animaron a que se dedique para comercializar lo que produce día a día. Ya con la práctica ha mejorado y tiene mayor velocidad al tejer sus prendas y es así que produce con sus bellos tejidos a crochet chalinas, ropones para bebés y fustanes de lana.Este talento que posee le ha permitido superar los tiempos de crisis económica que su familia ha sufrido en muchas ocasiones en que los ingresos económicos han sido insuficientes para cubrir los gastos de manutención de sus cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar. Su esposo es un humilde albañil y muchas veces los trabajos son temporales es por ello que también , Juana, en ocasiones vende canchita en bolsa en las puertas de algunas escuelas y también los cines de su ciudad.Tiene planes de construir una pequeña granja de pollos que por el momento sólo mantiene en casa para consumo familiar. Todos estos deseos espera cumplirlos con perseverancia y ayuda del talento que posee y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de lana y de una cantidad considerable de gallinas para la granja que desea implementar en casa.Juana agradece tu noble deseo de apoyarla.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WOOL FOR THE GARMENTS SHE KNITS AND SELLS, AS WELL MATERIALS FOR A CHICKEN THEY WANT TO BUILD BEHIND THEIR SMALL HOUSE

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 43 years old, is living with her husband and 3 children in Nghi Loc, Nghe An. Before joining the TYM fund, her whole family income depended on their several rice fields. 5 years ago, she talked to her family and took the courage to borrow money from the fund to buy the husking machines. This activity is very economically effective. Her current income is 100 USD/month. Her family has already overcome the poverty and becomes an exemplary business. She intends to borrow 325 USD to buy more unhusked rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, 43 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. Khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ thì cả gia đình chị chỉ trông chờ vào vài sào ruộng. Cách đây 5 năm chị đă bàn bạc với gia đình và mạnh dạn vay vốn của Quỹ về đầu tư mua máy xay xát. Hoạt động này mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao, mức thu nhập của chị Hạnh hiện nay là 100USD/tháng. Gia đình chị đã thực sự thoát nghèo và là tấm gương điển hình của quỹ về việc làm ăn kinh tế giỏi. Dự định chị xin vay thêm 325USD để mua thêm lúa gạo xay xát.

loans.use: Buy rice to husk

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
Zarofat has just turned 27 and is a single mother with one son.

Zarofat sells furniture and has been in this business for 3 years. She has become a real expert in furniture and knows all about the quality of various producers. Zarofat is polite with the clients and ready to offer furniture that can meet any taste and different levels of income. Her business is stable and generates enough income to support the needs of her family.

Today Zarofat requests 1000.00 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. Zarofat is planning to purchase new items of furniture for sale. Zarofat has shown herself to be a reliable client in repaying previous loans from IMON. Zarofat would like to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for sale

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.en:
S. Lutfullo is 23 years old. He is married with one son, 5 years old.

Lutfullo has been providing taxi services with his car for 1 year. The business is the main source of income for his family. Lutfullo works hard, he gets up early and goes to bed late as to not to lose any clients. The business is successful and generates a stable income, allowing Lutfullo to support his family and his mother and father. 

Today Lutfullo requests $225.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. Lutfullo is borrowing for the first time and he thanks all for their trust and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Cirila Alejandrina

texts.es:
Over the past twenty years, Cirila and her husband have made great strides and put in much effort to advance their business in the clothing trade. At present, they run a shop making sportswear and a large clothing store in Huaycán.

It was not easy for them to achieve this. Previously, she spent a good amount of time selling clothing as a street vendor in Ayacucho (located in the Peruvian mountains). Upon moving to Lima with her husband, they decided to continue with this endeavor. They sold their wares in various locations and always from the street, until they realized the risks in this type of informal activity and decided to more formally establish themselves by renting a location for their business. Little by little they increased their inventory and, five years ago, they opened their own shop for sportswear. This gave their business a good boost, although they assure it was not easy, and they have worked very hard to get to what they have today.

Despite this, Cirila dreams of more. She would like to sell clothing at wholesale in one of the largest commercial centers in Lima called “Gamarra”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cirila y su esposo en los últimos veinte años han hecho crecer a grandes pasos y con mucho esfuerzo su negocio de venta y confección de ropa. Hoy por hoy, ellos manejan un taller de confección de ropa deportiva y a la vez, una tienda grande de ropa en Huaycán. No les fue fácil llegara esto. Anteriormente ella estuvo un buen tiempo vendiendo ropa como ambulante en Ayacucho (ubicado en la sierra peruana). Al mudarse a Lima con su esposo, decidieron seguir con este negocio. Estuvieron vendiendo en diversos lados y siempre como ambulante. Hasta que se dieron cuenta del riesgo que corrían como informales y decidieron establecerse alquilando un local para su negocio. Poco a poco fueron aumentando su mercadería. Hasta que hace cinco años abrieron su taller de confección de ropa deportiva. Esto ultimo les dio un buen impulso a su trabajo aunque aseguran que no les fue fácil, trabajaron arduamente para llegare a lo que hoy tienen. Aún así Cirila sueña aun con más. Ella quiere vender ropa al por mayor en uno de los centros comerciales mas grandes de Lima: “Gamarra”.

loans.use: Improve clothing shop.

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefanía R. is married. Her husband is a construction worker, and they have 7 children. 27 year old Juan Manuel works at a paper store, 31 year old Juan Héctor and 29 year old Juan Jesús are construction workers, 24 year old Juan Ernesto is a day laborer, 20 year old Adelfa sells clothing, 22 year old Maria Guadalupe sells food, and 18 year old Maria de los Ángeles is a student.

Estefanía began her business in order to help her spouse maintain their children. It has been 18 years since she began selling clothes in a market with a friend. Later she became independent and has continued alone with her business.

Now she is asking for a loan of US $500 that she will repay in 5 months in order to buy merchandise. With your help, Estefanía will continue helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Estefanía R. esta casada, su esposo se dedica la construcción y tienen 7hijos Juan Manuel de 27 se dedica a venta en una papelería, Juan Héctor de 31 a la construcción, Juan Jesús de 29 a la construcción, Juan Ernesto de 24 jornalero, adelfa de 20 venta de ropa, Maria Guadalupe de 22 venta de comidas y Maria de los Ángeles de 18 estudiante. Inicio su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en la manutención de sus hijos, hace 18 años se inicio en la venta de ropa con una amiga vendiendo en el mercado, luego se independizo y ha seguido sola con el negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Estefanía seguirá apoyando a su familia

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tronfodji

texts.fr:
Tronfodji L. is a 60-year-old farmer who was born in Avétsèdomé. He is the father of seven children. His main business is agriculture. To increase his yield next season, he envisions buying some fertilizer. But due to a lack of financial means, he is applying for financial support in order to achieve good results. The granted request would be his greatest happiness, the reason the family will thrive.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Tronfodji L. est un cultivateur de 60 ans né à Avétsèdomé et père de sept (07) enfants. Son activité principale est l’agriculture. Pour augmenter son rendement à la prochaine saison, il envisage acheter des engrais. Mais par faute de moyens financiers, il sollicite un apport financier pour parvenir à un bon résultat. Cette demande accordée serait son plus grand plaisir, source de l’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Meth

texts.en: Meth S., 65, is a farmer living in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and three children. She typically makes $1 each day, and her husband makes about $2 working in construction. The climate conditions have been unfavorable in Cambodia this past year for farming, and this has caused food prices to soar. Inflation has also been out of control, as this has turned into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Meth S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a pig to raise and eventually sell. She sees this business opportunity as a way to increase her income and to provide a higher standard of living for her and her family.

loans.use: Purchase a pig

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn C. is a villager in Kosh Khtum Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and firewood-seller. Her rice revenue is currently too low because her rice field is small. She wants to expand her rice production so she is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land. Previously, Mrs. Choeurn C. obtained a loan to buy buffalos to plow her field. Mrs. Choeurn C. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in order to cultivate rice

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna is 36 years old. She is married. She takes care of 1 person aged 50. She has been a fish, juice, and ice-cream seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $215 from her sales.

Husna now hopes for a loan to buy more fish and other items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and other items for her business.

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou D., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Kambeng Doumassou depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des balles de friperie à Dakar pour revendre au niveau des marchés de la région. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Safiétou D., is married and has been a member of the village bank of Kambeng Doumassou for 8 and a half years. She wants to buy bales of used clothes in Dakar to re-sell in the marketplaces in her area. The income from her business allows her to contribute to the improvement of living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of used clothing

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Mrs. Kun H. is a villager in Vihea Village in Kandal Province. She is a breeder who raises seven piglets. Since her pigs are growing, she no longer has enough money to buy food to feed them. Consequently, she is asking for a loan with which she will purchase pig food. If any money remains, she will use it to build a piggery for her pigs. Mrs. Kun H. is a 48-year-old widow with two children.

loans.use: Purchasing pig food

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Là năm nay 33 tuổi. Năm  2005 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay 3.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho chồng làm xưởng mộc và cho thu nhập 1.500.000đ / tháng. Đến nay qua 3 năm tham gia Quỹ, nhờ biết cách làm ăn xưởng mộc của gia đình chị phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vốn mua gỗ phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. L. is 33 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2005, and borrowed 3.000.000 VND in the first round of loan to open a small carpentry workshop for her husband, helping the family earn 1.500.000 VND per month. Now after three years, her family’s workshop has become much more popular and organized, which helps generate 3.500.000 VND monthly. In the next round of loan, Mrs. L. would like to borrow 15.000.000 VND ($900) to purchase more wood for the workshop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By wood

loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Mr. Komi G. is 31 year old. He is married and has 2 children.  He lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  To provide for his family, Komi operates a taxi-moto business. Komi picks up passengers along the road with his motorcycle, and drops them off at their destination.  This service is always in demand in Wome as there is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business.  Komi hopes to use this loan, through Kiva, to buy a new motorcycle.  With the profits that he will earn from his business over the next year, Komi will be able send his children to school and provide for his wife and family

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua , madre soltera, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad. Los planes para con su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa y levantar los muros del otro terreno, obteniendo un patrimonio con la seguridad que requiere, ya que es insegura su vivienda por que es de tabla y de zinc, ella ya tiene un comienzo con el muro y desea terminarlo también ya que para ella es importante estar mas segura por la delincuencia Doña Esperanza se desempeña como conserje en una institución desde hace tres años, sus metas en ámbito laboral es cambiar a un trabajo mejor donde pueda ganar mas dinero, lo cual seria de gran beneficio para su familia para cumplir sus objetivos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque, zinc y alambre, obteniendo una casa protegida, segura y solidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in Managua. She is a single mother of two, and her sons are now financially independent. The family plans to finish construction on their house and to build walls around their plot of land. When the walls are built they'll have the security to obtain a patrimony. Their house is made of planks and zinc, and it's not very safe. Esperanza has started the wall and would like to finish it, because it is important to her family to be safe from crime. Esperanza has worked as a receptionist for the past three years, and her goal is to change jobs so that she can earn more money. This would benefit her family and enable her to achieve her objectives. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she'll be able to buy construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, zinc and barbed wire. With these she can have a secure, solid, and protected home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build her house out of concrete

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lina Y. is the leader of a group of four entrepreneurs who live in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province. She sells vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetables to resell.  

Her husband, Mr. P. Laveng, is employed in a garment factory, and he also can make a little salary to support the family. Mrs. Lina Y. is 27 years old and the mother of two children. One child is enrolled in the local school. Her other child is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Silvia Estela

texts.es: la Sra. Silvia M. U. nos comento que tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad generadora de ingresos, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante, pues a traves de esta actividad logro graduarse de licenciada en Pedagogia y ha podido conseguir trabajo en un instituto de secundaria y a su vez apoyar al padre de sus hijos en la formacion profesional de sus 4 hijos, uno de los sueños de silvia es poner su propia academia donde pueda instruir a sus alumnos en confecciones de tela.
texts.en:
Silvia M. U. has told us that she has worked for 20 years at this income generating activity, which has allowed her to get by. During this time she has also graduated with a teaching degree and has found work in a secondary school. This has allowed her to support the father of her children in providing vocational training for their 4 children. One of her dreams is to have her own school where she can teach students how to make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials to make clothing

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia L. is engaged in several businesses. She sells cosmetics products and recently she markets shark's oil products that can treat pimples and other skin irritations. She is also a seamstress. When she is not busy in her cosmetics trade, she makes nice colorful dress for her customers. She is 50 years old and has only 1 child. She worked very hard to help her husband to support the needs of their family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more shark's oil products to sell and repair her sewing machine. She is also interested to start a new business to augment more her income.

CEVI provides their client the credit assistance that they need to run their business. Aside from that, they give all their clients trainings and insurance coverage to make their business grow.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and buy shark's oil products for sale

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en:
Sa Rorn K. lives in Sam Nor Kmao village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Nhang Chaem, is a construction worker.

Although they try to work hard they still earn less income than needed to support their family. In order to improve the living, Sa decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to become a taxi driver to earn more income.

She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a tailor while another is a waiter in a restaurant. One is a construction worker and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for her husband to become motor taxi driver to earn more income.

loans.name: Leiloa

texts.en: Leiloa M., 53, is married with 8 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Leiloa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy more tools and chemicals for her business and also to help with kids school fees and home improvement.

loans.use: To buy tools, chemicals to kill insects

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam S. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a policeman and makes 3 USD per day, while his wife, pictured here, has run a grocery store in the market for years and earns 11 USD every day. The couple has three children: one is a student, one is married, and one is a security guard. Tam S. would like to take out a loan to purchase grocery items for his wife's store, to meet customers' demands.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
“I will do my best to achieve my goals in life,” says Emelyn D., a food vendor in a small vending stall in their simple village of Pieza Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya.
