texts.en: Higinio is requesting a loan to put tile in a room so that his family could live in greater comfort.  In the community where he lives the streets are in bad condition and when it rains the moisture comes into the home, and he wants to avoid the illness this can cause.  Higinio has worked in construction for more than 30 years, and many people seek out his construction services.  He is a hardworking and responsible person.  Higinio's wife helps him with the family's finances with earnings she obtains from a business she has selling used clothing outside the home.

loans.use: to put a tile floor in a room

loans.name: Umoja Farmers B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja Farmers B Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Umoja Farmers B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Mary takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Mary will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Umoja Farmers B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lidia Azucena

texts.es: la sra. Lidia tiene 39 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños, vende jeans, camisas, camisetas, blusas, shorts, calcetines, vestidos y muchas mas prendas de vestir, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva, viene la epoca de navidad y muchas personas compran ropa, desea estar preparada para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, ya tiene muchos pedidos y no quiere quedarles mal a todos sus clientes., su negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico, ahi transitan muchas personas, esto hace que muchas personas visiten su negocio,  tiene una empleada que le ayuda con la atencion de los clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Lidia is 39 years old and works selling new clothing for women, men, and children.  She sells jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, socks, dresses, and many other clothing items.  She will use the loan to buy new clothing.  The Christmas season is approaching and a lot of people buy clothing.  She wants to be prepared for her customers' demands, and she already has a lot of requests and doesn't want her customers to get a bad opinion of her.  Her business is strategically located where a lot of people will pass by.  This makes a lot of people visit her business.  She has one employee who helps her attend to the customers.

loans.use: buy new women's, men's and children's clothing

loans.name: Halprat's Group

texts.en:
The Halprat group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Halprat is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, she has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells firewood and milk. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood for her business, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. Halprat hopes that in the future she will be able to buy cattle. 

Halprat is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Halprat's future prospects by helping her to learn how to negotiate with her customers.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children.
 
Lucila has a retail shop that sells sacks of charcoal and firewood. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of charcoal and firewood.

Lucila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lucila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y ropa, vive en casa que heredo de su padre, es madre de dos hijos, por quienes recibe ayuda del padre de estos, ella inicio el negocio por la necesidad de mejorar y obtener ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos, cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa y frutas, blusas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior; papayas, naranjas, bananas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar el inventario del negocio, ya que por el momento posee más verduras, pero ella quiere tener igual cantidad de productos.
La aspiración de Ana es encontrar la estabilidad en los negocios, que le permita tener mejores oportunidades para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana, who sells fruits, vegetables, and clothing, lives in a house she inherited from her father.  She is the mother of two children, and she receives help from their father.  She began the business because she needed to improve and obtain income to support her children, and to cover the costs of the home.
She is asking for a loan in order to buy clothing and fruits: shirts, skirts, pants, underwear, papayas, oranges, and bananas.  This purchase will help her to improve the inventory of the business.
Ana's aspiration is to discover stability in her businesses.  This will allow her to have better opportunities for her children.

loans.use: buy clothing and fruits, shirts, skirts, pants, and underwear.

loans.name: Asrar

texts.en:
Asrar is a 27 year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah city. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters. (She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.) For the past five years, Asrar and her husband have been working on their own business, raising chickens, which they sell to local traders. It is a good business and the only one in the village. They would like to improve their business.

Asrar requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to rebuild their chicken coop and expand it. By taking this loan, Asrar and her husband will be able to improve their business and increase their income.

loans.use: and her husband to rebuild their chicken coop and expand it.

loans.name: 020405050002 Nông Nghiệp _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs Trang has a retail business selling veterinary medicine. She is requesting a loan to purchase more veterinary medicine to resell.

Trang is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 020405050002 Nông Nghiệp _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Trang has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Trang has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Trang hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more veterinary medicine to resell

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is a 47-year-old woman mother with five children.  She lives a few kilometers out from Honiara city.

She runs a poultry business to support her family's needs, and she obtained a 4,500 SBD loan to buy chicks and other poultry supplies. 

Cathy’s biggest challenge she faces is the lack of a proper shed for her chickens.  Sometimes when she went to feed her birds she noticed that someone broke in and stole her birds, causing a loss in her business that makes her even more financially challenged with her family's demands.

She believes that if she has access to more loans, she will be able to buy timber and other proper materials to improve her poultry shed and its security.

Increasing demand for chicken meat in Honiara has contributed to the growth in her little business. She wishes to expand her poultry business, build another shed for her business, and also improve her family's living.

loans.use: to renovate and improve her poultry shed

loans.name: Faxri

texts.en: Faxri is 33 years old. Faxri is married and lives in the Füzuli region with his family. They have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city. His son is 4 years old and the daughter is 7 years old. The son goes to kindergarden and the daughter in the primary school. Faxri is a farmer. He has been in the animal breeding business for five years. He buys little calves, fattening them to sell in the local bazaar.Today he needs his first loan in the amount of  1750 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He wants to buy calves and develop his business. He is thankful to Kiva organization for the help.  In the future, Faxri wants to build a new stall for calves.

loans.use: to buy calves and develop his business

loans.name: Josã© Arnulfo Gonzã¡

texts.en: I provide transportation for people travelling from the city of El Paraiso to Las Manos in the border between Nicaragua and Honduras.  Iâ€™ve been doing this for the past seven years.  I make the journey on a daily basis, so I need to take my van to the mechanic for a check up and restore the seats in order to improve the security and comfort of my passengers.

loans.use: Repair vehicle.

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.en:
My name is Martha Lilian, and my occupation is in trade. I hope to have a clothing store for all ages, where the product is sold both by order and by traveling sales person. I have devoted several years to this type of work, and I hope to generate revenue to contribute to familial costs and other obligations. Right now, I need to expand my business, especially because the school year, a time when the volume of sales is greatest, is fast approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Martha Lilian, mi actividad Principal es el Comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa para todas las edades, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada escolar y el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To purchase pants, collared shirts, women’s and children’s clothing, undergarments, etc.

loans.name: Neit

texts.en: Neit U. is 64 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their 6 children.  Neit and his wife run a small store on the side of the street selling fresh water, gasoline, and cigarettes.  They earn aboU. $3 per day in this business.  One of their children is a local school teacher and adds $50 per month to the family's income.  Neit U. will use this loan to purchase more fresh water and gasoline for his store.  As his business grows, he would like to move his business indoors where he can sell more grocery items and earn more income.  He plans on working hard so that all of his children will have the chance to finish high school.

loans.use: To buy fresh water, gasoline, and cigarettes to sell on the roadside

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela is 30, she doesn't have any children and her husband works planting corn or during seasonal harvests. He also helps his wife when she needs to transport her merchandise. Micaela knits bracelets and belts with silk thread and after she has accumulated a sizable quantity, she takes them to sell in "Nachij," a community that lies around an hour from her home. This town is a heavily trafficked by tourists who go on to visit San Cristobal. Micaela is a memeber of the solidarity group "Betania 2," the other member is named Juana C. Barato, who participates in the same craft activity as Micaela. Together, the two hope that the loan will help them to purchase more silk thread in order for them to fabricate more goods and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MICAELA TIENE 30 AÑOS, NO TIENE HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA DEL MAIZ O DE ALGUNA COSECHA DE TEMPORADA, Y CUANDO HAY QUE IR A ENTREGAR MERCANCIA AYUDA A SU ESPOSA MICAELA QUIEN SE DEDICA A TEJER PULSERAS Y CINTURONES CON HILO DE SEDA, Y CUANDO YA TIENE PRODUCIDA UNA CANTIDAD LOS VAN A VENDER A “NACHIJ” COMUNIDAD UBICADA A UNA HORA DE SU CASA, POR SER ESTE UN LUGAR MUY TRANSITADO POR TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL. MICAELA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO BETANIA 2, LA OTRA INTEGRANDE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA JUANA C. BARATO QUIEN SE DEDICA TAMBIEN AL MISMO RUBRO POR LO TANTO AMBAS ESPERAN CON EL CREDITO AUMENTAR LAS COMPRAS DE HILO DE SEDA PARA INCREMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS .

loans.use: To craft bracelets and belts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy A., who lives in Goodwill Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria  is 51 years old, married with 5 children. She has been with LAPO for 4 years as a Secretary of her union and and has had her  business since 2001. She hopes to expand her business after receiving the loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Liliana moved to Pucallpa with her husband and son a long time ago, looking to improve their financial situation. They started out selling ribbons and other textile items in the local markets and on the streets but didn't achieve much success. They later began collecting and reselling scrap metal, for which purpose they acquired a tricycle. This has allowed them to operate their business from the early morning hours until evening without rest as they travel around their city.

As their business grew, it required that they repurpose a patio in their home to store the scrap metal. Thanks to their sustained effort, their lives have improved. They would like to expand and improve their storage space to be able to buy more scrap metal for resale, which will increase their earnings and help them continue to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana vino a radicar a Pucallpa con su esposo e hijo hace mucho tiempo, buscando mejorar su situación económica, empezaron a vender primero todo lo que era pasamanería en el mercado en forma ambulatoria sin el éxito esperado, la idea sobre la recolección y venta de metales surgió de su esposo y para realizar esta labor decidieron contar con un triciclo. Así es como vienen realizando este trabajo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta horas de la tarde, sin descanso recorriendo la ciudad entera; a medida que fue pasando el tiempo tuvieron que acondicionar un pequeño depósito en el patio trasero de su casa, sus vidas gracias al esfuerzo de su desempeño han cobrado buenas expectativas.Con el afán de seguir incrementando su calidad de vida necesita ampliar su pequeño almacén y seguir comprando más metales para acrecentar sus ganancias.Hagamos que esta familia siga reciclando en casa muchos deseos de superación.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a cosmetics shop in Sierra Leone town of Makeni. Aminata’s husband is also a small trader. She has been in business for 4 years. Before the loans from SMT, Aminata used to take the goods from a Lebanese merchant on credit. She said it was expensive and the daily repayments could not allow her to make a good profit.  With her previous loans, she reduced the purchases on credit and her income increased. Although she still takes some goods on credit, her aim is to build her own capital, and the loan from SMT with monthly repayments will help her do that. She is therefore requesting the loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more goods with cash instead of credit, to increase her income.

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en:
Milly N. has a poultry farm where she raises chickens, ducks and turkeys. She wants a loan to buy feeders for her chickens and increase her business. She hopes to raise the standard of living for herself and her 4 children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase supplies for her animal business

loans.name: Nabweru South Ii(A) Group

texts.en:
This group of women has been together for six months. Dizzy is 41 years old and married with six children. She has a chicken roasting business. With the extra business profits she earns, she wants to start rearing chickens herself so that she doesn't have to buy from other people. She believes this will reduce costs and thus increase profits. Annet has a cosmetic shop. Josephine sells crafts.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and goods for their businesses

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam Z. is a married 38 year old with two children who are 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Mariam sells clothes and she works at her business from 7am to 10pm everyday. She can earn a monthly profit of about $210 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Waagmi Group

texts.fr:
Our project consists of producing food from seaweed. Recently, our research institutions have discovered additives to enrich common foods. We would like to produce these foods and enrich them with seaweed. We would like to make bread, pies, cakes, cookies and fruit juices with a seaweed component in order to improve the local community’s diet. This project will employ several people and allow us to provide opportunities for the young boys and girls in our village, who in turn will take over the business to distribute our products throughout Senegal. We are sure that, thanks to Kiva, our project will be a success.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Notre projet consiste  à la production d'aliments à base d'algue marine. Ces temps-ci, nos instituts de recherche  ont trouvé des additifs pour enrichir les aliments de consommations courantes. Et c'est avec ces produits là que nous voulons produire des aliments enrichis à base d'algue marine. Nous voulons produire du pain, des galettes, gâteux, biscuits et jus de fruits avec une composante en algue pour amélorer l'alimentation des populations locales. Ce travail va employer plusieurs personnes et nous permettra de trouver un débouché pour les jeunes garçons et filles du village, qui à leur tour prendrons la relève pour vulgariser tout ce travail partout au Sénégal. Nous sommes sûr que grâce à Kiva nous allons parvenir à réaliser ce projet.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food production

loans.name: Omore Jenga Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Oscar O. is an average-aged man who is married with a wife and six children.

He owns a small retail shop which he started ten years ago, after accumulating savings from the little money he earned while working as a shelf attendant for a supermarket. Oscar’s small retail shop sells household goods that his customers can use on a daily basis. The shop mostly stocks food and toiletries.

Oscar is a hardworking man. From the little profits that he gets from his business, he is still able to feed, clothe, and educate his children. With the help of the loan, Oscar will be able to add more stock for his business, which he hopes will generate more income. His long-term business vision is to open up a wholesale unit in the future.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a partner of the Comunal Bank Arco Iris

She is 35 years old, married with 2 children. Margarita travels to the different fairs in the area 2 times a week where she buys small animals, cheese, and grains in order to sell them door to door to a list of clients she has built up over time. She also sells fire wood from her home.

Margarita needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of livestock and fire wood.

Her dream is to build a home, have a big store, and to have her kids receive a good education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Margarita es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Margarita viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 2 veces por semana, de donde compra animales menores, queso, cereales, que vende caminando de casa en casa a clientes que ya tiene. Además Margarita vende leña en su casa.

Margarita necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdo, carnero y leña.

Los sueños de Margarita son construir su casa, tener una tienda grande y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Margarita needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of livestock and fire wood

loans.name: Jero Ketut Meliani

texts.id:
From expanding her pig farming business after obtaining first phase loan from Dinari, Jero Ketut Meliani already felt the profit obtained. From that profit, Jero Ketut Meliani could help her husband to fulfill family needs, however she felt that she needed to increase her income. From the second phase loan from Dinari, Jero Ketut Meliani would use to buy 5 piglets for fattening. Within a period of 6 months, Jero Ketut Meliani could profit Rp 1,500,000. From this second phase loan, Jero Ketut Meliani expects to have larger profit to increase & better family's living standard.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan mengembangkan usaha beternak babi ketika mendapat pinjaman tahap pertama dari Dinari, Jero Ketut Meliani sudah merasakan keuntungan yang dia peroleh. Dari keuntungan tersebut Jero Ketut Meliani bisa membantu suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya, namun dia merasa perlu untuk menambah penghasilannya. Dengan mendapatkan pinjaman tahap kedua dari Dinari Jero Ketut Meliani mempergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi 5 ekor dengan total harga Rp. 1.250.000,- untuk dipelihara secara penggemukan. Dalam 1 eriode selama 6 bulan Jero Ketut Melianibisa memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Melalui pinjaman tahap kedua ini Jero Ketut Meliani berharap dia bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih besar lagi untuk meningkatkan taraf hidup keluarganya menjadi lebih baik.

loans.use: To buy piglets and repair stall (Membeli anak babi dan memperbaiki kandang)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more inventory for his General Store

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with 4 children aged 20, 18, 16, and 5 years old. She became a tailor in 1988. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fatima 1 Group

texts.en:
The Fatima 1 group is maD. up of nine women and three men who live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. The group members are involved in a variety of economic activities: they sell cosmetics, food, clothing and shoes, and work as seamstresses, taxi drivers, and construction workers. Most of the group members have between one and five years of experience in their respective businesses, with the exception of Richard and Carola (who work in construction and fruit sales, respectively), who each have fifteen years of experience.

Most of the group members say they plan to use their loans to buy more merchandise to sell or to buy tools for their businesses. This is the group's first loan cycle, though many of the members have had previous experience with group loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise and tools for their businesses

loans.name: Diribash

texts.en:
Diribash F. is 57 years old. He is married and has four children. All he does is for the well-being of his children. Diribash's wife is a housekeeper, and she takes care of their children. Diribash's business is the main source of income for his family. Diribash started his own business over 30 years ago when he was young.

First he began selling foods in the local market. As time went by, he decided to change his business because he was married and the business did not generate enough income to support his family. He rented a place and started to sell candies, butter, conserves, jam and other food stuffs.

He purchases all goods he sells from his suppliers. With over seven years of working in this business, Diribash has enough experience to do his work successfully. He also has loyal clients. Today Diribash requests $1200 so he can increase the stock of goods. Diribash would like to thank everybody for supporting him, and promises that he will repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods

loans.name: Mayre

texts.es: Mayre tiene 27 años, es soltera, tiene una hija de 5 años que estudia, vive independientemente en una parte de la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que brinda pensión a un grupo de trabajadores de una institución que se encuentra muy cerca de su casa. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 7 años en su propia casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente activa en todo momento, y sobre todo dar una buena atención a sus clientes es lo primordial. Le es rentable su trabajo porque mantiene a los clientes que tuvo desde sus inicios y obtiene nuevos. Le va muy bien y no tiene queja alguna. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero quiere comprar mesas y sillas para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mayre is 27 years old, she is single and has a 5 year old daughter who is studying. She lives independently in her parents’ house. She works selling food that she supplies to an institution near by. She has been selling food for the past 7 years from her home. She likes her work because she is active all the time, providing good service to her clients is a priority for her. Her work is profitable because she keeps clients and always gets new ones. Things go well and she has no complains. This is the first time she requests a loan to MFP. With the money she wants to buy tables and chairs to provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her small restaurant

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo aun pequeño. De profesión, es profesora, en la mañana trabaja en una escuela del nivel primario, por ello que se levanta a 5.00am para preparar el desayuno y atender a su hijo en lo que sea necesario, al regresar del colegio a partir de las 3.00pm se dedica a ofrecer prendas de vestir de casa en casa, y quienes la conocen, la buscan en su propio domicilio. A ella le conviene tener una actividad adicional a su trabajo porque le es muy rentable, ya que si vende al crédito el precio de la prenda se incrementa, y cuando vende al contado inmediatamente puede obtener ganancias, además de la venta le gusta mucho conversar con la gente. Es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero se invertirá en la compra de más prendas de vestir, sobre todo en ropa para niños por campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Rosa is a married 33-year-old mother with one young son. She is a teacher who works in an elementary school in the morning, which is why she must get up at 5:00 am in order to prepare breakfast and help her son with whatever he needs. After returning from school at 3:00 pm, she sells clothing door-to-door. The customers who are familiar with her go directly to her house to buy merchandise. This side business is very convenient for her because it is quite lucrative. If she sells on credit, the price of the garment increases, and if she is paid in cash, she can immediately obtain her profits. Aside from liking retail, she also very much likes to interact with people. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will invest the money in purchasing more apparel, especially for children and for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more apparel

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 37 años, es madre de un hijo y vive junto a su esposo quien la apoya en todo. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería, con el cual brinda servicios diversos que tengan que ver con el trabajo en madera, en este negocio ya tiene 4 años, y lo que le gusta es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y conversar con ellos, además le es rentable, porque es la única persona en su zona que cuenta con este taller y le va muy bien. Es su primer préstamo con  MFP. Y con el dinero solicitado ampliará su taller, sobre todo quiere comprar más herramientas e instrumentos de carpintería.
texts.en:
Lucía is 37 years old, has one son, and lives with her husband, who supports her in everything. She has a small carpenter's workshop where she has been offering various woodworking services for four years. She enjoys providing good customer service and conversing with her clients. The business is profitable because it is the only one of its kind in the district, so she is doing well. This is her first loan with MFP. With the requested funds she will expand her workshop and buy more tools and carpentry equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the workshop and buy tools

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom S. is a villager in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Yun Yoeurn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they face a problem because their field is infertile soil, so Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive, and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support the pump to water the crop. Mrs. Sokhom S. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study because they are four and five years old. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
P. is 45 years old and has been running a small store next to her house for more then eight years, selling grilled meatballs to neighbors in the village. She normally earns approximately US$ 3 per day to help cover the family’s living expenses.

P. is married to Beunsong, 49, who is a domestic car repairman. She has eleven children: nine are single and the other are married. Three of her single children are employed; one of them (a son) is working as a local blacksmith. P. is applying for a US$ 1000 loan for her son to use as capital to buy ferrous equipment to fulfill his customers' needs. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy ferrous equipment

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Melitopol. She has been in this business for 7 years. Large assortment, affordable prices and high client service help Irina to have a successful business. Irina lives with her husband and two sons in a small apartment. She’s got a good family where everybody helps one another.

Irina would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to improve her business conditions. She hopes that patching the holes and giving a new look to her old kiosk would bring even more customers and help her to earn additional income for her family needs.

loans.use: to improve business site conditions

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine O. is 54 years old and married to her husband Jaime, who is a driver.  She is blessed with two children who both got married. Josephine is a good member of the cooperative and she pays her obligations religiously. Her project is snack vending and this project is still progressing. She borrowed from Paglaum MPC the amount of PHP 20,000 to be used for additional capitalization of her projects. Aside from being a snack vendor she uses her extra time to cook at a restaurant as an additional source of income. Her hopes and aspirations are to improve her family members’ lives and live happily forever.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for snacks and empanadas

loans.name: Norma Victoria

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha que significa Árbol Grande en quechua.
Norma es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos, Norma junto a su esposo tienen una sastrería en donde confeccionan ropa a medida, también confeccionan ropa típica que reparte por mayor a las tiendas.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Norma sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Ccatun Sacha Communal Bank, which means Big Tree in Quechua. Norma is married, is 48 years old and has 7 children. Norma and her husband have a tailor shop where they make made-to-measure clothing and also make traditional clothing that they sell wholesale to stores. Norma needs a loan of 1600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of fabric. Norma dreams of her children finishing their studies and diversifying her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070008) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 07 (7).

H. is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While this is not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2500.000 IDR a month from these activities.

H. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. H. is requesting a loan of 4.256.000 IDR, which will be used to purchase medication for the her livestock. This is her first loan through DINARI. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị H. is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.256.000 IDR loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.

2. Nguyễn Thị M. is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 2.016.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3. Nghiêm Thị C. is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector ,operating a furniture-making business.

4. Nguyễn Thị S. is a 22-year-old woman who is requesting a 2.016.000 IDR loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.

5. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.704.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

-------------------------------------------------------- H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070008) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn 07 (7).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2,500 IDR. H. đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ DINARI. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.256.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070009) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

2. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201070010) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Nghiêm Thị C. (20201070011) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

4. Nguyễn Thị S. (20201070012) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

5. Nguyễn Thị L. (20201070013) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.704.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về DINARI:

Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase medication for livestock and to expand the businesses of the group members.

loans.name: Nasiatha

texts.en:
Nasiatha P. is a 59-year-old woman. She is widowed and the mother of six children. Through hard work Nasiatha has paid for three of them to complete senior high school, but the others are still schooling. Her husband died painfully through prolonged sickness. She was almost in tears when we were talking to her because she believes he has left so much responsibility on her.

She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch, and supper. Nasiatha wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children, especially for their education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘God First’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Hairiya

texts.en:
Hairiya is 31 years old and lives in the town of Ds. Sumberkima - Buleleng. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Hairiya makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Hairiya has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hairiya joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hairiya is requesting her first loan from DINARI of 3,200,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Hairiya plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hairiya - (DNR.M-0686) merupakan 31 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Ds. Sumberkima - Buleleng.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Hairiya memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan khusus di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Hairiya sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Hairiya menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2009, Hairiya bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Hairiya telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,200,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli inventaris & modal kerja tambahan.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Hairiya berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Mrs. Vicenta A. is 84 years old, and is a widow with three children. She is a retired teacher, now a pensioner, and lives at Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

She joined Paglaum in June 2009 to secure financial assistance for house completion, especially the window grills and floor tiles. She aspires to have a descent abode where she will spend the remaining days of her life. The repayments will be from her monthly pension.

She is also glad to be obtaining the member’s mortuary assistance fund in the cooperative wherein she feels secure of her future resting place.

loans.use: To pay for the installation of window grills and floor tiles

loans.name: Pav

texts.en: Mr. Pav T. is 38 years old and lives in Prey Chhoeur Tel village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who grows rice on a piece of land he owns. He also works in construction. He is a widower with six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Four others attend the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Pav T. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to be a taxi driver. He hopes to increase his income and to provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to be a taxi driver.

loans.name: Gloria Roxana

texts.en:
Señora Gloria has a small shop where she sells basic grocery goods and beauty products. She is pictured here behind her shop counter. In the forefront of the picture is the glass showcase where she displays her beauty products.

Gloria is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the city of Pucallpa. Her husband works at a sawmill. Gloria's children serve as her inspiration to continue to work hard at her business ventures.

Gloria has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (“New Friends”). Gloria used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in her grocery shop. She plans to use this loan of 1,000 soles to buy products for her shop and also to have the cooler/display case, where she keeps her drinks, sent out to be repaired.

Gloria's vision is to keep progressing with her business until one day she is the owner of a much larger and better stocked grocery shop. Gloria is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos and is grateful for the financial assistance provided by the organization.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop and to repair her cooler/display case for drinks

loans.name: Plan De Lucha Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is the leader of the group Plan de Lucha (or Plan of Attack). This group has taken out loans together for three years and is looking to take out their sixth loan. They have all proven themselves to be successful entrepreneurs and look forward to growing their businesses even more. 

Hilaria runs a small corner grocery store called a colmado where she sells basic cooking supplies. With this loan she will buy rice, sugar and cooking oil. Her store started out as a little hut outside her house, and with her past loans she has been able to build a more permanent structure made from cement blocks. Right now Hilaria´s house is made of wood and sheets of metal and her goal is to make enough money to build her house from cement blocks as well. 

You can help Hilaria and the rest of the members in Plan de Lucha achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Allah Is God Group

texts.en:
Allah is God, led by Mossiame D., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Mossiame is 45 years old and is married with five children age 17 to 25. Her youngest is in school but Mossiame was unable to attend school herself because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Mossiame’s business is retail fish which she buys wholesale locally and from nearby Guinea and sells in a market stall in the central Kolahu market. She has run her business for ten years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Mossiame is taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of sending her youngest to university.

loans.use: To purchase fish wholesale to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda T. is from the village of Puli, Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Belinda is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Belinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty S. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Betty is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Betty joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for selling vegetables. Betty is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Betty from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carmita Condoy

texts.en:
Carmita is 40 years old and married with two children. She owns a retail store in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil, a peri-urban marginalized zone. Currently she sells clothes, DVDs, and beauty supplies.

This loan will be used to buy more DVDs for her shop. In the future, Carmita would like to manage and develop the land next to her DVD shop. She will be saving any future income to make this goal a reality!

loans.use: To buy more DVDs for her shop

loans.name: Shar

texts.en:
Shar O. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son and daughter, ages 14 and 11, attend a local secondary school and her youngest son is 1 year old. O. operates a traditional shoe-making business and a grocery business in her town. She produces traditional Buriad and Mongol shoes which she sells at the local market. Her husband is retired and helps her to operate the grocery business.

O. started her shoe-making business in 1990 and has built up a good reputation in her area over the years. She used her savings from making shoes to later start the grocery business. Today, both businesses are operating successfully and provide her family with financial stability. O. hopes to continue to grow her businesses in the future and improve her family's quality of life. She says, "One can achieve success with hard work." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase materials used in shoe-making.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase materials used in shoe-making

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en: Jovencia F. is from the village of Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Jovencia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Jovencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Jovencia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Bakry

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakry S. a 37 ans, marié et père de trois enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants au quartier Dioulasso de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S. fait la commercialisation de carburant notamment l’essence  et des articles de quincaillerie il y a environ sept ans. En plus de cette activité il cultive pendant l’hivernage 4 Ha de  maïs. 
Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Son magasin se trouve au marché près de la route principale qui traverse  la ville de Kadiolo. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida  de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt.
Il compte d’acheter avec ce prêt,  5 barriques  d’essence et 4 paquets d’articles de   quincaillerie  .
 Il s’approvisionne à Kadiolo ville auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente journalièrement  dans la ville de Kadiolo en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Bakry S. is 37 and lives with his wife and their three children in the Dioulasso neighborhood in the town of Kadiolo (in the third administrative region of Mali). He has sold fuel (mostly gasoline) and hardware for about seven years. Additionally, he raises corn on four hectares of land. He is appreciated by his customers for the quality of his products. His shop is in the market close to the main road through Kadiolo. Because he wanted to be able to meet the needs of his growing clientele, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso (a microfinance organization). This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan he plans to buy five barrels of gasoline and four cases of articles of hardware. He buys his merchandise from wholesalers in Kadiolo, and runs his retail business there every day, relying on a customer base of both men and women. With this loan he hopes to earn an average montly income of 35,000 FCFA, which he will mainly use to increase his capital and pay off the interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuels and hardware.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: Z. Lucienne est née vers 1969 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs 20 ans que Lucienne vit à Dandji à Cotonou. Lucienne est mariée à ASSOCLE Antoine, un soudeur, et est mère de quatre enfants. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Lucienne n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Lucienne vend des tissus et également de l’huile de palme, par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Lucienne s’approvisionne. Lucienne exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans, et est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé. Lucienne a bien remboursé les trois crédits antérieurs qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Lucienne désire élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients ; mais Lucienne manque suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est la raison pour laquelle Lucienne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Lucienne was born around 1969 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Lucienne has been living in Dandji in Cotonou for about 20 years. She is married to ASSOCLE Antoine, a welder, and is the mother of 4 children. Some of her children are attending school. The couple share the responsibility for supporting their family.

Lucienne was never able to attend school. To make a living, Lucienne sells cloth as well as palm oil through the distribution system. She buys her merchandise at the international market of Benin, Dantokpa. Lucienne has been in this business for about 10 years and is on her fourth loan with ALIDé. She reimbursed the three previous loans from ALIDé correctly. She would like to expand her business so that she can better satisfy her customers, but she does not have sufficient financial means to manage this. This is why Lucienne is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lengths of cloth and jerrycans of palm oil

loans.name: Lesbia Elisalda

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Lesbia Elisalda B. P. tiene 39 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos quienes viven con ella y desde hace 6 años se dedica a vender ropa usada en un barrio comercial de esta ciudad de Bluefields y de esta forma ayuda en los ingresos de la casa ya que su marido trabaja como cadete de taxi y los ingresos no siempre son los mejores.

La señora B. ya ha sido beneficiada anteriormente con dos prestamos de kiva los cuales a cancelado en tiempo y forma, aprovecha a la vez para agradecer a los prestamistas que entregaron el dinero para poder ella invertirlo en su negocio los cuales le han ayudado a tener mayores productos y mejorar sus ventas. A la vez se compromete de antemano pagar este nuevo préstamo para poder seguir optando en futuras ocasiones a otros.

Solicita financiamiento para comprar las siguientes pacas de ropa:

1 Paca de ropa usada para niños le cuesta US 200 la paca, 2 pacas de pantalones blue jeans le cuesta la paca US 150 y 2 pacas de sabanas a US 125 cada paca.
texts.en:
Lesbia Elisalda B. P. is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children who live with her. For 6 years she has sold used clothing in a commercial neighborhood in the city of Bluefields. In this way she helps with the household income, since her husband works as a taxi driver and his income is not always the best. Señora B. has previously received 2 Kiva loans which were paid off on time and in full. She would like to take this opportunity to thank the lenders who provided the money so that she could invest in her business, as they helped her to get better products and increase her sales. At the same time she pledges in advance to pay back this new loan, so that she will continue to have the option of taking other loans in the future. She requests financing to buy the following: 1 bale of used children's clothing that costs $200 per bale, 2 bales of blue jeans that cost $150 per bale, and 2 bales of bed sheets at US $125 per bale.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bales of used children's clothing, pants and bed sheets

loans.name: Jose Williams

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el caserío San Pedro de Sasape, distrito de Illimo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la comercialización de pavos y chivos. El cría los animales en un corral ubicado frente a su vivienda y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que periódicamente visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola, pero esta actividad no le brinda los recursos que necesita para sacar adelante a su familia.

El modo en que los cría ha hecho que sus animales tengan muy buena acogida entre sus compradores, por lo que José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pavos y chivos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

José es un padre de familia honrado y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su esposa y sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is the 26-year-old father of a family, who lives with his wife and two children in the small village of San Pedro de Sasape, in the Illimo district, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 10 years he has sold turkeys and kids. He raises the animals in a yard in front of his house and offers them for sale to dealers who periodically visit the area where he lives. He also works as an agricultural worker, but this activity does not offer the means he needs to advance his family.

The way in which he raises his animals has gotten a very good reception from his buyers, so José wants to increase his business with the purchase of more turkeys and kids. For this reason, he is applying to Edpyme Alternative for the first time for a loan of 1200 PEN, which he is planning to use to achieve his goal.

José is an honest and responsible father. His greatest desire is to be able to offer his wife and two children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy turkeys and kids to increase his business

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Bak

texts.en:
Mr. Bak K. is 45 years old and lives in Kakaoh village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Long K., are farmers who own a piece of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. They are shown together in the photo.

With this farming, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. So Mr. Bak K. is requesting a 2,000,000 Riel loan from AMK to buy two cows for breeding. With the loan, his income will be increased which will improve his family living, too.

This couple has four children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, another one is supporting their farming while the other two are attending the public school.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Gelien

texts.en: Gelien D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old and married. To make a living, Gelien owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gelien has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Gelien joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gelien is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gelien from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de verduras, granos y menestras en su domicilio, el negocio nació de la necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso que le permitiera ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia y velar por la calidad de vida de sus padres, que son de edad avanzada. Por otro lado este negocio es de mucha ayuda para los vecinos de su caserío, ya que este queda muy alejado del pueblo y ellos no tienen alimentos de primera necesidad al alcance de la mano.

Debido a que la mayoría de vecinos de la zona son agricultores y reciben sus pagos los fines de semana ella ofrece sus productos al crédito y al contado. Este sistema esta teniendo mucha acogida, asi que Rosaura desea ampliar su negocio, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas verduras y menestras.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida por los vecinos de su zona, ellos la consideran una mujer trabajadora, responsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es otorgarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a 52-year-old single woman who lives with her parents in the Quemazón settlement, a rural area in the Mórrope district of the Lambayeque province, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling vegetables, grains and pulses from home for several years. This business was born out of Rosaura's need to earn a living to help support her family and look after her parents' quality of life, as they are elderly. Concurrently, this business also helps her neighbors in the settlement since the city is far away and they do not have basic need items at hand.

Because the majority of the residents are farmers and receive their pay at the end of the week, she accepts both cash and credit for her goods. This system is having much success, so Rosaura would like to expand her business. For this reason, she is requesting a 1,500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will invest in purchasing pulses and vegetables.

Rosaura is very well-known by her neighbors, who consider her to be a hardworking, responsible and trustworthy woman. Her greatest wish is to give her parents a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pulses and vegetables

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, 48, sells charcoal to have an income for her family. Her ambition is for her children to achieve their dreams. She supports six children in the family. Since 2004, she has partnered her business with Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. 

Currently she is asking for a loan of 15,000 to buy more stocks of charcoal. She likes CEVI loans because of the low interest rates and short weeks of repayments.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr:
Kapinga M.  est vice présidente du groupe de crédit  Hodari,géante avec sourire aux levres, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 11e cycle, âgée de 36 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants et tous étudient dans des écoles  normales  dont 3 à l’école  secondaire et 4 à l’école primaire. 
Son mari est  décedé  le 25 janvier 2005 à Kigali/Rwanda suite à une longue maladie de poumons. Pendant ces 5 ans, elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants orphelins . 
Cette charge pèse lourdement  sur croissance rapide de son business.  
Son business est liberal, sans adresse et ambilatoire, elle  fournit des draps,des habits pour enfants, pagnes, boubous, bijoux en or aux différents preneurs  . Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité appelée "lutte-lutte pita pita".
Elle vivait au Rwanga/Kigali, où le gros de sa belle famille réside, après la mort de son mari, elle se vit sans aucune économie, elle a commencé à tisser les tricots, les napes, etc. Les revenus de ce petit métier(art) lui a permis de deplacer ses enfants orpheilns du Rwanda vers la RDCongo et les quelques  dollars qui sont restés d’une valeur de 50$ lui a permis de prendre un guest house pour s’installer. Elle a commencé à marchander avec les tomates, pétrol, sels, lait, savon en poudre OMO. Ensuite,elle fut informé de l’IMF Hekima qui donne des crédits  sans garentie, elle a béneficié le premier crédit de renforcement.
Lorsqu’ elle venait de retrouver l’équilibre, elle a été en nouveau victime d’une incendie du 08 juillet 2009 qui a brillé plus de 900 maisons dans la ville de Goma, dans le quartier populaire bidonville de Birere.
Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, Kapinga M.   souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achétant  6 paires des draps, sizaine de chainettes d’or (localement appele Garentie manzanza), Sizaine de robes de qualité du Congo Brazza, 6 pagnes .
Kapinga M. est  également servante Evangeliste dans une eglise locale ‘’Chist est Roi” et parfois dans un ministrère chretien de réveil “Combat Spirituel”.
Kapinga  M. est confortable avec son business, dans l’avenir, elle planifie acheter une parcelle d’heritage pour ses enfants orphelins et finir avec le status de locataire de maison. En outre Kapinga M. revet voir tous ses enfants finir les études avec des diplômes qui leurs serviront dans le futur. 
Kapinga M. rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grace à ces credits  lui permet  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Enfin, Kapinga M.  a aisement trouvé le soulagement et l’équilibre  économique grace aux crédit s de Hekima, après la mort de son mari.
Le groupe de crédit  Hodari  est  composé de 15 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Kapinga M. is vice-president of the Hodari credit loan group. A smiling giant of a woman (she is seen raising her hand on the picture), currently in her 11th loan cycle, she is a 36-year-old widow, the mother of seven children all attending school: four in the primary and three in the secondary school system. Her husband passed away 25 January 2005 in Kigali (Rwanda) following a prolonged lung-related illness. She has been the sole support of her children these past five years, which weighs heavily on the rapid expansion of her business. Her business is free-style in nature, itinerant without a fixed location. She provides bed sheets, children’s clothing, pagnes and boubous (colourful West-African clothing), and gold jewelry to all who are interested. It has now been five years since she began an activity known as “lutte-lutte pita pita”. She used to live in Kigali, where most of her in-laws reside, and following her husband’s death, without any savings, she began weaving clothes and tablecloths, etc. The earnings from this activity (craft) enabled her to move from Rwanda to the Democratic Republic of Congo with her children, where with her remaining $50 she was able to settle in a guesthouse. She started to trade in tomatoes, gasoline, salt, milk, powdered detergent (OMO). Then she learned that the Hekima MFI provided loans without collateral, and she was granted her first reinforcement loan. She had just re-established some financial balance when she became one of many victims of the 8 July 2009 fire that destroyed over 900 homes in Goma, inside the Birere shanty-town. With the Hekima MFI loan Kapinga M. wishes to increase her turnover by buying 6 pairs of bedsheets, a half-dozen gold chains (locally called “Garantie manzanza”), a half-dozen quality dresses from Congo Brazzaville, and six pagnes. She is also an Evangelist acolyte in a local church (Christ is King) and sometimes participates in “Spiritual Combat”, a Christian revivalist ministry. She is comfortable with how her business is going, and in the future envisions buying a plot of land as inheritance for her children and eventually renting out as a property owner. Additionally she hopes to see all of her children finish their studies with diplomas that will serve them in their future. Kapinga M. thanks the Hekima MFI for the loans she has received without any collateral because that is what enabled her to meet her children’s needs. She was finally able to enjoy relief and financial stability for the first time since her husband’s death, thanks to Hekima’s loans. The Hodari loan group is made up of 15 members, for the most part women.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 pairs of bedsheets, 6 guaranteed gold chains, 6 quality dresses from Congo Brazzaville, and 6 pagnes

loans.name: Leposo

texts.en:
Leposo has been in farming for the last 16 years.  He plants potatoes and wheat depending on the season throughout the year.  He is 36 years old, married to Alina Maletu, and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy pesticides and also cultivate his other piece of land to plant wheat.

In the future, he plans to buy another piece of land and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and cultivate an adjacent piece of land to plant wheat

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: EL SR. PEDRO NACIO EN CHUQUISACA EL 20 DE ENERO DE 1970 ES CASADO Y TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, AHORA VIVE Y TRABAJA EN SU PARCELA QUE ADQUIRIO MEDIANTE EL SINDICATO DE QUEBRADA ALVARES HACE 25 AÑOS QUE TIENE SU PROPIA PARCELA , EL SIEMBRA MAIZ , PAPA, YUCA, MANI, Y MUCHOS PRODUCTOS QUE SE DEN EN LA COMUNIDAD  TAMBIEN TIENE SU GANADO TODO LO QUE SIEMBRA LO SACA A VENDER AL MERCADO DE EL TORNO, ES MUY TRABAJADOR TIENE SU FAMILIA Y SIEMPRE BUSCA QUE PLANTAR SEGUN A LA TEMPORADA,  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SERA PARA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in Chuquisaca on January 20th, 1970. He is married and has two school age children. He now lives and works on his parcel of land that he got through the Quedbrada Alvares syndicate. He has had his own land for 25 years. He grows corn, potatoes, yucca, peanuts, and lots of products that are grown in the community. He also has livestock. He takes everything he grows to sell in the El Torno market. He is very hard-working. He has his family. He always looks to plant according to the season. The money from the loan is for increasing his working capital. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting him the loan.
